excerpts: On the DAT menu, which has a very nice selection, I ordered the appetizer: Hand Made Orecchiette with duck ragu & fresh ricotta, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, entree:
Dungeness Crab Angolotti with mascarpone vodka sauce,
dessert: Piccolo Tiramisu Lady finger cookies, mascarpone, espresso.

My boyfriend ordered soup: Cauliflower with Dungeness Crab, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, appetizer: Grilled Butcher Steak over creamy portabella mushrooms, red wine & parmesan shoestring fries.
black pepper beef carpaccio.author: Jean T.
black pepper beef carpaccio.review:
I came here for Dine About Town with my boyfriend and another couple. 

First impression: It is tucked in a lit alley with other restaurants. It would be nice to sit outside if it wasn't so cold. They have heat lamps but they're not all around. 

On the DAT menu, which has a very nice selection, I ordered the appetizer: Hand Made Orecchiette with duck ragu & fresh ricotta, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, entree: Dungeness Crab Angolotti with mascarpone vodka sauce, dessert: Piccolo Tiramisu Lady finger cookies, mascarpone, espresso. My boyfriend ordered soup: Cauliflower with Dungeness Crab, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, appetizer: Grilled Butcher Steak over creamy portabella mushrooms, red wine & parmesan shoestring fries.

My favorite had to be the Dungeness Crab angolotti! I could've ordered another 2 orders! It is basically a dungeness crab ravioli with more dungeness crab on time. I will go back just for that!
Everything else was very delicious! No complaints!

The service was very good as well. Our server was very patient, since we were still waiting for my boyfriend to arrive. He was 30mins late. We were able to sit down at our table without having to wait for the entire party to arrive like other restaurants, which is a good thing since it was cold outside! We took our time and didn't feel rushed at all.

I would definitely come back for the food!

excerpts: We also shared the mussels.
mussels.author: Wen L.
mussels.review:
Classic ristorante. Same owner for past 27 years. Our first time was circa 1998. Haven't dined here for sometime. Came back this evening for dinner date with hubby... Same decor, nicely upkept, very Italiano vibe. Although I did miss the Italian servers from before. The owner back in the days was quite the management... Managing every staff from the front point of ristorante to the kitchen and back. But today he is still very hands on managing as the evening host. Taking customers to their table and handing them checks. 

Hubby ordered lamb... He was very pleased. The taste is still the same like when we first dined. Meat was made to perfection... Not over cooked, beautiful pink inside with no signs of red juice spilling out, the lamb had a nice crunchy texture and nut burnt. Topped with mashed potatoes and bed of fresh sauteed spinach. 

I had their petrole fish. Made well... Sitting on top of risotto with green peas and hints of jalapeno slices. Very light and delicioso. 

We also shared the mussels. And the tomato red sauce broth is still the same. 

Really 3.5 stars. 
Service is decent
Food is excellent
Amazed to see owner and still rocking it. Business can be challenging. But glad to see home till hold up this belden lane gem. This is where I ranked highly. 

Buon apetito

excerpts: It had mussels and also lobster bisque inside, it was VERY good.
I highly recommend!
Loved it!
The flavors collided great, I was expecting it to be salty, but not at all.
mussels.author: Natalie L.
mussels.review:
Had a welcome new member team lunch here with my co workers. Decided to try this place since we always go to Plouf. 

Great service and cute little restaurant inside Belden Lane. I got the Risotto. It had mussels and also lobster bisque inside, it was VERY good. I highly recommend! Loved it! The flavors collided great, I was expecting it to be salty, but not at all. My co workers got some other dishes and they also enjoyed their lunch. 

I would come here again, they have really good pasta here, definitely a must try.

excerpts: Two of us had the branzino special, which was perfectly cooked (watch for the bones, though!), which had a sauce with mussels and clams, and nestled on a bed of polenta.
The other two had the sole and the salmon, both of which they liked.
mussels.author: Mi M.
mussels.review:
I came here with co-workers after two of us saw this on Check Please Bay Area. We were disappointed to not see the short ribs on the lunch menu (as it was online), but we liked everything we got. We started with the meatballs, which were delicious (and could feed one for lunch on its own), and the octopus, which was tender and delicious. 

Two of us had the branzino special, which was perfectly cooked (watch for the bones, though!), which had a sauce with mussels and clams, and nestled on a bed of polenta. The other two had the sole and the salmon, both of which they liked. And, of course, for dessert, the tiramisu, which was light and fluffy and delicious.

No complaints about the service or cleanliness of the place. I'd definitely go there again!

excerpts: As for food, we had mussels, tuna and salmon crudo with burrata, short rib risotto with scallops, and tomato and corn soup.
The mussels and crudo were okay--tasty but nothing exceptional.
The soup was delicious and had an addictive smokiness to it, and given the opportunity I could probably finish a tub of it.
The freshness of the scallops and micro-greens were a nice balance to the richness and meatiness of the short rib risotto.
mussels.author: Tina X.
mussels.review:
Ordered a bunch of plates to share with a friend because we are fatties. The restaurant was relatively empty even at around 7PM but that was probably because it was during the middle of the week. Our server was charming and attentive but service was a bit slow since we were sitting far back in the restaurant, which was quite empty. 

As for food, we had mussels, tuna and salmon crudo with burrata, short rib risotto with scallops, and tomato and corn soup. The mussels and crudo were okay--tasty but nothing exceptional. The soup was delicious and had an addictive smokiness to it, and given the opportunity I could probably finish a tub of it. The freshness of the scallops and micro-greens were a nice balance to the richness and meatiness of the short rib risotto.

The restaurant interior was a very ancient Roman, with frescoes and mosaic-like art on the wall. They have patio seating, and the back dining room has a skylight, which is always nice!

excerpts: It came garnished with large shrimp and tiny mussels; I got an extra tiny fork to get the mussels out of their shells.
A sprinkling of peas and a fabulous sauce.
mussels.author: Carol S.
mussels.review:
Give this 4 1/2 stars. Really enjoyed meal, great waiter.
Details: I had a meeting with my financial adviser. After more than 10 years we've become friends as well so he took me to dinner, corporate account, best of all.
We split a salad & bruschetta. He got salmon and I got the seafood special, halibut.
Bruschetta was OK, not special. Salad really good with beets, apples, nuts. Very fresh. My fish was spectacularly good. A light crust, perfectly cooked. Just enough seasoning to enhance but not drown flavor. It came garnished with large shrimp and tiny mussels; I got an extra tiny fork to get the mussels out of their shells. A sprinkling of peas and a fabulous sauce. On a bed of squid ink risotto. My first try of squid ink. I thought it might taste strong but it's actually quite mild, what I'd call an ocean flavor. Probably more drama than anything. 
Also liked the bread with dipping/drizzling sauce - chimichurri? 
In the midst of our meal, a group of women sat at the next table, really a continuation as there was a long bench, several of them wearing VERY STRONG perfume. I am severely fragrance sensitive and knew at once I had to move as I immediately got a massive headache. If I did not get out of there I would be painfully ill, too nauseated to eat, and all food would taste like perfume anyway. We moved outside, although it was a bit cold. (People on the East Coast might disagree.) The waiter kindly carried out plates, wine glasses, bread, water, etc. We were able to finish & enjoy our meals. 
I asked the waiter (large white male) what the sauce was on the fish, he said lobster. No wonder it was so good!
I wonder of those women were able to taste their food?
Dessert: I got cannoli and he got baba. The cannoli were excellent, they nailed the pastry. I have suffered through soggy pastry too many times! Creamy filling with chunks of chocolate, sprinkled with pistachio. We traded bites. The baba had a good fruity sauce but I think the cake was a tad dry.
So lose 1/2 star for cake, also because prix fixe menu on web site but they had discontinued it. Need to update web site to say so.

excerpts: I liked the variety of seafood (scallops, crab meat, mussels, salmon, and others I can't recognize), and the lobster broth it was in was piping hot, with an almost creamy texture that made it suitable to dip a piece of bread in (which I did, as it came with a small piece).
I'll have to try this dish at other places (looking at you, Tadich Grill!)
mussels.author: Viet N.
mussels.review:
What a shame. In terms of the food, I kind of expected more from this place.

I came here the other day with coworkers for lunch, and since we had a reservation for the time they opened, we got seated right way. 

I've never had a cioppino before ($25), so for my first time, it was decent! I liked the variety of seafood (scallops, crab meat, mussels, salmon, and others I can't recognize), and the lobster broth it was in was piping hot, with an almost creamy texture that made it suitable to dip a piece of bread in (which I did, as it came with a small piece). I'll have to try this dish at other places (looking at you, Tadich Grill!) before coming to a conclusion, but I liked what I tasted so far. 

On the other hand, one of my coworkers got one of the steak dishes featured on the prix fixe menu, and while she requested medium, she got well done. 

Also, there's quite a bit of room for improvement in terms of service. For one thing, service was slow, and we were the first group to come in! Some of us were also misled by the waiter into believing that soup of the day came complimentary with our entree, which wasn't the case. Although we probably should have asked to confirm that case, it felt a little unethical to just suggest soup without warning us. But I will give the waiter credit for accommodating my request to redo the payment transaction due to my mistake in splitting the bill. I'm not sure if any Asian restaurant would have done the same. 

All in all, my experience here was okay, but I'm not sure if it's worth a return trip any time soon.

excerpts: I also liked their mussels and clams in spicy tomato broth, corn and leek soup topped with chopped spicy shrimp, and risotto with clam and lobster basque sauce.
I also remember trying ahi tuna and smoked salmon appetizer, but it isn't as good.
mussels.author: Cate L.
mussels.review: Would put a 3.5 star if I could. Went there twice with friends. As expected, the portions are pretty small, but the quality isn't bad for a $$ French restaurant. The pan sheared scollop with risotto is definitely my fav. The rice was extremely flavorful and soaked in scollop sauce, and both the flavor and the texture of the scollops are amazing. I also liked their mussels and clams in spicy tomato broth, corn and leek soup topped with chopped spicy shrimp, and risotto with clam and lobster basque sauce. I also remember trying ahi tuna and smoked salmon appetizer, but it isn't as good.

excerpts: What I HIGHLY RECOMMEND as an opening appetizer is to customize your order by combining their MUSSELS AND CLAMS together in spicy tomato broth!
Having the scrumptious spicy tomato broth to compliment the mussels and clams, the three way combo was tantalizing to my taste buds!!
It was super delicious and when everyone finished eating the mussels and clams, I drank the remaining spicy tomato broth!
mussels.author: Tiffany D.
mussels.review:
Fabulous atmosphere with the restaurant being located in the alley, cushioned right in between other restaurants and having glowing lights hung around the exterior of this place!  Sounds dreamy?  Indeed, it is!

D E C O R - The decor of this place has a Roman touch to it and romantic dining arrangements!  Dine outdoors when the weather forbids!

S E R V I C E - You will be assisted by a hostess upfront and be served by attentive waiters and waitresses throughout your meal courses!

I T A L I A N  F O O D - I loved every dish I tried!  What I HIGHLY RECOMMEND as an opening appetizer is to customize your order by combining their MUSSELS AND CLAMS together in spicy tomato broth!  Having the scrumptious spicy tomato broth to compliment the mussels and clams, the three way combo was tantalizing to my taste buds!!  It was super delicious and when everyone finished eating the mussels and clams, I drank the remaining spicy tomato broth! YUM!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ

O R D E R E D  D I S H E S - 
BRUSCHETTA - Crunchy bread.  Topped with crab meat and diced up, marinated in olive oil, tomatoes, the bruschetta was good.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#UUPXZyoqurkXUkYf9syCeQ

ROASTED SADDLE OF LAMB - The most expensive dish on the menu!  Splurged, but it was surely worth every bite!  The balsamic vinegar with the sage spice flavored around and on the nicely cooked lamb meat, was incredible!

NEW YORK STEAK - Tender and cooked exactly on point!  They could improve on those stringy, thin fries that were topped on the steak, however.  The fries lacked volume and specialty. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#zoTqIB5KPnTdv-amZVrMgA

SEAFOOD MIXED GRILL - The name of the entree is misleading.  The seafood is just salmon!  I like the presentation of this dish - not only was it artsy, but it looked fun!  The capers went well with the salmon!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#9cePDws2M2RgWJCnW_GAXg

VEAL SCALOPPINI - The white wine sauce complimented the mushrooms and veal very nicely.  I love the creamy risotto that was provided with the meal!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#dOPKUbjX08TXy4uDVVZANQ

DESSERT SAMPLERS - There is always room for dessert after a grand meal!  DO GET their dessert samplers because it is basically all the Italian desserts they offer that is combined into petite, delectable portions!  I enjoyed the display and a mini bite of each dessert!  I assumed that their tiramisu will be the best of all the desserts just because the restaurant is named Cafe Tiramisu.  It was not the best tiramisu I have ever had and not the best of all the desserts they provided.  My most favorite dessert, was their ice cream with a cup that was made out of hardened caramel!  It was unique, refreshing and savory!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#nOkzDCEROTQTtEcDeZrRYA

F I N A L  S A Y - A great, low-key restaurant if you are wanting to shy away from the crowd and to enjoy a hint of Italian charm!

excerpts: Get the mussels
mussels.author: Jeffrey N.
mussels.review:
Love it! I try and get there every couple weeks.
Service is great, very efficient.
Get the mussels

excerpts: The squid ink pasta is fantastic, and so are the mussels.
The dessert sampler is huge!
mussels.author: Peter K.
mussels.review: This is a great little Italian joint in that restaurant alley off Bush St. Very good food, and not too expensive compared to some of the high end places there. The squid ink pasta is fantastic, and so are the mussels. The dessert sampler is huge!

excerpts: The squid ink noodles and the mussels were nice.
mussels.author: Gopal R.
mussels.review:
My buddy is a regular here and the staff always treats him well, so I went with him last time I was here.

The squid ink noodles and the mussels were nice.

It's a fun place in the early evening when the alley is full and there's that bustling city vibe going on.  In the later evening it has a fairly different character.  

There's plenty of space to stretch out if you go late, and that makes things a bit more relaxed.

I feel like I come here more for the evening out kind of atmosphere than for the dining experience though.  

With that in mind, you have to make sure you don't have too much fun, however, because that's when you wake up with a headache and a strange, foggy memory of what just went down, wondering where your phone fell out of your pocket.

Some places are just like that.

excerpts: Scallops appetizer and mussels with spicy sauce were both seasoned really well and excellent.
seafood linguini was a little odd (came in a flat platter?)
and so it required more stirring around to get the sauce on the noodles, but it tasted good.
Service quite good as well.
Will be back!
mussels.author: Grapes T.
mussels.review: Really nice little place, buried on a side street and so easy to miss, but defn a fan. Scallops appetizer and mussels with spicy sauce were both seasoned really well and excellent. seafood linguini was a little odd (came in a flat platter?) and so it required more stirring around to get the sauce on the noodles, but it tasted good. Service quite good as well. Will be back!

excerpts: We had mussels with saffron & fennel broth which was nice & the broth was perfectly nice for bread dipping sauce.
I had the cioppino, the classic San Francisco fisherman's stew of local rockfish, Tomales Bay Manila clams & mussels, Dungeness crab in Lobster broth.
mussels.author: Manda Bear B.
mussels.review:
************* REVIEW 134 ****************

Fun, lively place on Belden Lane, reasonable price, simple food. I took my bestfriend & her man here after a long weekend in Napa. 

We had mussels with saffron & fennel broth which was nice & the broth was perfectly nice for bread dipping sauce. 

Then my BF had the linguine with pasta, she thought it was also just OK. Of course for us used to live in Manhattan, it's hard to live it up!

Her BF had the Pappardelle with olive, Arugula, Shaved Pecorino Cheese which was nice.

I had the cioppino, the classic San Francisco fisherman's stew of local rockfish, Tomales Bay Manila clams & mussels, Dungeness crab in Lobster broth. It wasn't as tasty as I would hoped for, compared to what i just had at Cioppino on the Wharf a week ago.

I haven't been here for a while, so it could be because I was tired from Napa, must be my off-day!

$20 corkage fee. 

Overall: 3.5 stars
For value: 4 stars
For Food: 3 stars
For Service: quick & efficient
For ambiance: 3 stars
For location: It was once very happening Belden Lane. Now half pack on a weekend night, surprisingly, must be the economy!

excerpts: The squid ink linguini with mussels, clams and prawns exceeded expectations, with the mussels and clams cooked but not dried out - I think the rapid turnover keeps everything freshen the kitchen.
We also had the linguine with seafood which featured a brown mushroom sauce.
Both dishes were excellent.
The place gets very busy and a bit hectic but we never felt rushed and our waiter, Tony, was very helpful.
They have a small but good selection of half bottles of wine which is perfect for lunch for 2.
We'll definitely go back, and are planning to bring out of town guests this summer.
mussels.author: Mark P.
mussels.review: Went to Cafe Tiramisu for lunch yesterday, after seeing it on Check, Please! Homemade pasta! Homemade bread! Homemade lemoncello! We split an order of the grilled calamari. Perfect! Grilled is so much better than battered and deep fried. The grilled calamari had a wonderful slight sear on the outside and the inside was just cooked enough to remain tender. The squid ink drizzle and the zucchini carpaccio & olives set off the dish wonderfully. Next we ordered 2 pasta dishes. The squid ink linguini with mussels, clams and prawns exceeded expectations, with the mussels and clams cooked but not dried out - I think the rapid turnover keeps everything freshen the kitchen. We also had the linguine with seafood which featured a brown mushroom sauce. Both dishes were excellent. The place gets very busy and a bit hectic but we never felt rushed and our waiter, Tony, was very helpful. They have a small but good selection of half bottles of wine which is perfect for lunch for 2. We'll definitely go back, and are planning to bring out of town guests this summer.

excerpts: Start with the mussels in a choice of either saffron, pesto, or pepperoncini and chive broth.
Sea Bass with Tuscan black mussels salad.
mussels.author: Jenny L.
mussels.review:
Cute, romantic and dimly lit restaurant tucked away in an alley of FiDi.  But you definitely feel like you've stepped into another world once you head inside the restaurant.

Start with the mussels in a choice of either saffron, pesto, or pepperoncini and chive broth.  Go saffron!

Risotto with crayfish, shaved black truffles, and Pecorino cheese.  Yay truffles!

Sea Bass with Tuscan black mussels salad.  Yum sea bass!

And...we had to order the tiramisu for the sake of ordering a tiramisu at Tiramisu.  I admit it's a bit expensive for dessert, but well worth it.

excerpts: I ordered the mussels for a main course, since the weather was soo cold outside, and dipped my bread in the soupy fennel broth.
mussels.author: Nicole G.
mussels.review:
Nish took the yelpettes to Cafe Tiramisu today for our Holiday lunch, a tiny little restaurant in Belden Lane that would be easy to overlook if you didn't know any better.

The ahi tuna crudo and beef carpaccio were lovely starters, and topped with parmesan and freshly shaved truffles. Yes, truffles! You know when the waiter goes around shaving truffles on everything you're in the right place. I ordered the mussels for a main course, since the weather was soo cold outside, and dipped my bread in the soupy fennel broth. I got a tiny bite of Nish's veal and it was cooked perfectly, Roma style.

Oh, and the desserts! This place isn't joking about their tiramisu. It was the perfect texture with just the right amount of cream and rum-soaked cake. But of course, the molten chocolate cake with hazelnut stole the show. It all paired wonderfully with a bottle of wine from the Barbera region in Italy.

Our waiter was really quick, but not very warm, and not helpful at all when we asked for recommendations. I think his attitude was "everything here is good" which is true, but c'mon! I wish he could have pretended to have been inspired about at least one dish.

excerpts:
Not enough crabmeat or something
- Mussels in Saffron-Fennel Broth - great delicious sauce!
Large portion for the price, but the mussels are a little too soft for my taste.
Very generous amount of seafood - scallops, shrimps, clams, mussels, fish.
And for the price of $20, it's a great deal!

And I had a taste of:
- Black Peppered Seared Ahi - done the way it supposed to be.

Black pepper ahi pan seared to perfection
- Caesar Salad -Fresh Dungeness Crab Meat & Chile Croutons - for $13, it's awesome.
mussels.author: Gigi T.
mussels.review:
We went to Cafe Tiramisu for a team lunch and the overall dining experience was pretty awesome.

We sat outside since it was a pretty nice sunny day and not too cold.

For starters, we had:
- Mozzarella & Tomato - Yummy Mozzarella, super fresh, soft, and bouncy.  Delissshh
- Crab cake - it was alright.... I had better crab cake before...  Not enough crabmeat or something
- Mussels in Saffron-Fennel Broth - great delicious sauce!  Large portion for the price, but the mussels are a little too soft for my taste.
- Artichoke blossoms - pretty good, wasn't that memorable.

Entrees:
- I had the Lobster Ciopinno, and there was really a lobster in there! (half)  The lobster was delish!  The sauce was great!  Very generous amount of seafood - scallops, shrimps, clams, mussels, fish.  And for the price of $20, it's a great deal!
And I had a taste of:
- Black Peppered Seared Ahi - done the way it supposed to be.  Black pepper ahi pan seared to perfection
- Caesar Salad -Fresh Dungeness Crab Meat & Chile Croutons - for $13, it's awesome.  Fresh crab meat on top of refreshing caesar salad, yum!

Desserts - we shared:
- Tiramisu - IT WAS DELISHHH!  tiramisu in thin chocolate box, yum!  
- Trio of Creme Brulee - very very good, wasn't too heavy.  I liked the cherry and mandarin flavor lots.  Don't really care about the lemon one
- White Peach Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream - pretty good, nothing EXTRAODINARY to rave about though
- Warm Chocolate Cake with Hazelnut Sauce and Ice cream on the side - omg, the sauce is delicious! I have a feeling they made the sauce themselves!  I love the hazelnut flavor, soo sooo sooooo good.

Yep, well deserved 4 strong stars!

excerpts: The only dish we had that was good was the mussels with calabrese pepperoncini (the sauce was great) but the whole time we ate it, we were paranoid
mussels.author: Sunny K.
mussels.review:
We always do lunch on New Year's Eve in the city and we try a new place to see if we'll come back in the new year.  Well, we will never be coming back here again, and definitely won't be recommending this place to any of our friends or family.  

First of all the service was horrible. Our waiter made eye contact with us several times but never came by... no water... no bread... nothing.  There were only 4 other tables in the entire place @ 1PM and the 3 tables were being serviced by another waiter who definitely seemed more attentive (made sure we got our tabasco sauce for the oysters when we couldn't find our waiter).  

So we ordered raw oysters and that was a big mistake-- when it came, it smelled like sewage...  and sure enough, the second oyster we had was bad-- it smelled like poop! and when we pointed this out (to one of the bus boys as our waiter was nowhere to be seen), and after a long wait, our waiter comes sauntering to our table, brings us 1 new oyster (offers no apologies) and says "What was wrong with it?  We just got the shipment today.  Who got the short end of the stick?" Unbelievable... 

Rissoto with blank ink and scallops-- you expect to get at least 2 or more scallops right?  Wrong.  This dish comes with one scallop cut in half (the scallop itself was good) but the rissoto was way too salty...  it needed more scallops!

We had high hopes for dessert but unfortunately the tiramisu wasn't anything to rave about. The only dish we had that was good was the mussels with calabrese pepperoncini (the sauce was great) but the whole time we ate it, we were paranoid we'd come across another rotten, putrified morsel...

There are so many wonderful Italian restaurants in the city-- don't waste your time or money here.  Unfortunately for us, we learned it the hard way:  the service is poor (our waiter was truly pompous and a big bully) and the standard of food just wasn't there...

excerpts:
From my ventures, my counterparts ordered other things, which I can briefly describe:

The mussels are yum.
mussels.author: Isaac L.
mussels.review:
Been here three times for lunch and guess what?  Ordered the same thing THRICE.

"Sea food Mixed Grill over Roasted Shallots Mashed Potatoes & Lemon Caper Sauce" - $22

This basically comes with 3 major pieces.  One filet of whitefish (i think either trout or maybe bass), a filet of grilled salmon, and then one big ass cousin of a lobster (it's one of those BALCO steroid tiger prawns).   All looking like cooked over a open flame seasoned grill.  The marination on all three were light but seductive.  The whitefish had a touch of lemon, the salmon was great (though I hate salmon), and the prawn was delicious.  All on a bed of creamy mash and spinach.  You can actually taste the wood on the char points of the seafood - tasty.    See picture four in this yelp photo gallery.

From my ventures, my counterparts ordered other things, which I can briefly describe:

The mussels are yum.   But still standard issue.
The tasting trio of crab is very misleading - you get itsy bitsy size portions for $16... pass.
The Buffalo Mozzarella with Roasted Bell Peppers, Toasted Pine Nut and Prosciutto Di Parma is actually good - fresh, and large, i mean large portion - share with someone.
Pappardelle with Moroccan Spiced Lamb Ragout and Grilled Corn Pesto - looked like a stew with untied ribbons.
The crispy chicken looked pretty damn smoking.  Smoking meaning it was kinda charred and black.  But supposed it was very tasty.

I don't know.  But whatever the case, it always tastes good when it's paid by the company.

Oh, btw, if at all possible, request top side seating.  The room downstairs smells like a toilet.  That's because the tables are literally feet from the bathroom.

excerpts: Last time I went, our little group got everything from oysters, mussels (in saffron-fennel sauce), lobster cioppino (which included scallops, salmon and shrimps), veal and a bottle of chianti.
I liked it all
mussels.author: Aron L.
mussels.review:
I really like this place.  I think it's because I love risotto and the risotto here is good.  

I've been here a couple times.  It's pretty fancy and quite pricey but I've always enjoyed the food, wine and company every time I've been.  I've had fun every time I've been here so I guess I like it.  I like the whole Belden Lane area though.  Eating outside in the cool San Francisco air.  What more can you except from life (except lots of other stuff).

Last time I went, our little group got everything from oysters, mussels (in saffron-fennel sauce), lobster cioppino (which included scallops, salmon and shrimps), veal and a bottle of chianti.  I liked it all but there are a few things to keep in mind:

(1)  I'm in the middle of a love affair with oysters so my opinion may be biased.  It was AWESOME!

(2)  I don't really know what either saffron or fennel are (I'm guessing they're herbs of some sort) but I liked the food.

(3)  Lobster cioppino was overall good.  I'm decent with seafood quality so my opinion on this point is not totally off the mark.

(4)  I know nothing about wine.  I like saying the word "chianti" but I couldn't tell it apart from a "cabernet sauvignon" (which I also like saying because it makes me sound cool).

In conclusion:  Yay! I'm a fan.  So speaketh Yelp.  So speaketh I.

excerpts:
We had Raw Oysters - ok
Mussels in Saffron - YUMMY
mussels.author: Sue Ann M.
mussels.review:
Great Atmosphere. Super cute cafe with a feeling of Europe. Great people whatching area. Food was ok. 

We had Raw Oysters - ok
Mussels in Saffron - YUMMY
The Dessert sampler - ok

The best part was the Saffron sauce soaked up with the bread, but they took the bread and bowl away before we had a chance to finish. We felt just a bit rushed even though they were not trying to turn tables over. It was late in the afternoon and not crazy busy at all.

I would definity go back again as I enjoy the atmosphere.

excerpts: Do get the mussels, but be wary, a full order will fill up a party of two before the main dishes are served.
mussels.author: Judy L.
mussels.review:
Here's the rundown:

Don't get the lemonade; its water with bits of lemon juice with little to no flavor. Do get the mussels, but be wary, a full order will fill up a party of two before the main dishes are served. The short ribs melt off the bone. The tiramisu - the cake soaked in alcohol. Nice! If you eat in the inside, it gets a bit cozy.

excerpts: I ordered the orichette with white beans and mussels.
The mussels were huge and very tasty, and the pasta was very good, but could have used a little more tangy taste; maybe some lemon juice or parsley would have added to it.
The tiramisu is awesome!
It had just the right amount of cake to cream/liquor ratio.
Maybe I'm crazy, but I thought it was some of the best tiramisu I've ever had!
They served it with generous pieces of dark chocolate around the edges, too.
Yum!
We sat inside.
If I return, I'll definitely want to sit outside...
Belden Place is cool.
mussels.author: Jenny R.
mussels.review:
First, keep in mind that I came here for a work lunch that my firm paid for, so I may have had a slightly different take if I had actually forked over cash for the meal myself. I thought it was really good. I ordered the orichette with white beans and mussels. The mussels were huge and very tasty, and the pasta was very good, but could have used a little more tangy taste; maybe some lemon juice or parsley would have added to it. The tiramisu is awesome! It had just the right amount of cake to cream/liquor ratio. Maybe I'm crazy, but I thought it was some of the best tiramisu I've ever had! They served it with generous pieces of dark chocolate around the edges, too. Yum!
We sat inside. If I return, I'll definitely want to sit outside...Belden Place is cool.

excerpts: I have to say that the mussels in peppercini was insanely good.
Probably the best I ever had.
My wife and daughter had the salmon which was coked to perfection
and I had the pasta with swordfish
and it was delicious.
We live in a place that has no shortage of Italian restaurants and this one was on par with the best of RI.
mussels.author: Lee K.
mussels.review:
On a recent visit to San Francisco from Rhode Island we asked the concierge at our hotel (SF Marriot) about a good local place for dinner. He recommended the Cafe Tiramisu on Belden Place. We had been to the same little alley the night before at a different restaurant.
It took a little while for us to get served, but when we did the manager himself took care of us. 
I have to say that the mussels in peppercini was insanely good. Probably the best I ever had.
My wife and daughter had the salmon which was coked to perfection and I had the pasta with swordfish and it was delicious.
We live in a place that has no shortage of Italian restaurants and this one was on par with the best of RI.

excerpts: he greeted us, sat us, recommended wine, and served us amazing pasta carbonara, saffron mussels, and amazing red wine from Montepulciano.
GO TO TIRAMISU,  !!
SO MUCH BETTER MUSSELS THAN PLOUF!!
mussels.author: Tina C.
mussels.review: This place has amazing fresh seafood and pasta!  not dried pasta folks, fresh pasta!   I came here for mussel after a disastrous stinky/rank/spoiled mussel encounter at Plouf next door-  the owner of Tiramisu was amazing, Giuseppe- he greeted us, sat us, recommended wine, and served us amazing pasta carbonara, saffron mussels, and amazing red wine from Montepulciano.  GO TO TIRAMISU,  !! SO MUCH BETTER MUSSELS THAN PLOUF!!

excerpts: as the menu changes its hard to specify what my favorite is but don't miss the saffron mussels.
mussels.author: Dennis K.
mussels.review:
as the menu changes its hard to specify what my favorite is but don't miss the saffron mussels. out of this world good. 

great wine selection and i have yet to have a bad meal here. 

as for atmosphere, Its belden lane! great place to people watch or be watched.

excerpts: The fennel mussels came next which were decent, and our entrees when they finally arrived (tortellini & lamb shank) were actually quite tasty.
My gripe with this place was really just the horrible service.
I had to ask multiple times to get these guys to clear our table, asked three times for the check and every time I kept getting attitude like "what now, why are you bothering us?!"
Seriously, this kind of service for $130 meal?
Never again, these guys can go f**k themselves.
mussels.author: Stephen B.
mussels.review: Atrocious service. I'm amazed at how this place is even in business. My friend and I arrived here last night around 7 and got a table on the patio which wasn't at all busy. It took about 15 minutes for a waiter to finally come over and throw menus at us. He didn't greet us, make eye contact or say anything just gave us menus and walked away. So as we peruse the menus another waiter walks over and drops off a couple glasses of water and my friend asks if they have any warm bread. He returns with a basket of room temperature dinner rolls and so my friend asks again politely if he could warm them up. This asshole gives her a cold hard stare, takes the dinner rolls and shoves them onto the wait station near our table and walks away. Wtf? So eventually another waiter (a bald older gentleman) comes over and takes our order. No smiles, no specials, no greetings just another hard stare that said "Wtf do you want?" At this point I suggest to my friend about blowing out of this place but she really wants Italian so we order two apps and two entrees. About ten minutes later another waiter comes by and drops off another basket of dinner rolls, room temperature, whatever. It takes almost half an hour for our first appetizer to appear, a caprese salad which was mediocre at best. The fennel mussels came next which were decent, and our entrees when they finally arrived (tortellini & lamb shank) were actually quite tasty. My gripe with this place was really just the horrible service. I had to ask multiple times to get these guys to clear our table, asked three times for the check and every time I kept getting attitude like "what now, why are you bothering us?!" Seriously, this kind of service for $130 meal? Never again, these guys can go f**k themselves.

excerpts: Anna liked the Cioppino ($18 - stew of local rockfish, Tomales Bay Manila clams & mussels, Dungeness crab in Lobster broth)
- lots of seafood in a light broth.
Annie thought that her sole dover ($24) is kind of bland
and it has no pasta in it.
I tried the Crocchette ($25, I'm not sure if I spell this right) and I love it!
Just enough seafood (clams, Dungeness crab, and shrimp) and thickness of the red sauce and it has some pasta!
Very filling and yummy.
We tried the house wine and had some Merlot and they're ok.

We split a $20 for two dessert sampler (Tiramisu, Warm  chocolate cake, Biscotti, Cannoli, Creme Brulee, Ice cream in a home made sugar cone bowl, Lemon Meringue Tart, Yogurt Panna Cotta, and Profiteroles).
The only ones that I really like are the creme brulee and the yogurt panna cotta.
Overall, the food is okay but pricey but the ambiance is awesome!
The wallpaper inside the restaurant is reminiscent of Pompeii.
They haev a very nice, intimate setting and bar inside
and I'm just glad that they have a restroom, unlike the other restaurant next door.
mussels.author: Joselita T.
mussels.review:
Great place to share a long table with other people and enjoy the outdoor seating while people watching. I like the festive lights the line the alley at night and how you can pretty much smell and check out other people's plates from the restaurant next door from where you're seating. 
My roommates and I had dinner here on a Friday night for my birthday.  I'm glad that it's only a few blocks from the Montgomery Bart station. We had some really good stuffed calamari and squids for appetizer and it's probably the cheapest item in the menu (~$12). The price range is about $12 to $32.  Anna liked the Cioppino ($18 - stew of local rockfish, Tomales Bay Manila clams & mussels, Dungeness crab in Lobster broth) - lots of seafood in a light broth. Annie thought that her sole dover ($24) is kind of bland and it has no pasta in it. I tried the Crocchette ($25, I'm not sure if I spell this right) and I love it! Just enough seafood (clams, Dungeness crab, and shrimp) and thickness of the red sauce and it has some pasta! Very filling and yummy. We tried the house wine and had some Merlot and they're ok. We split a $20 for two dessert sampler (Tiramisu, Warm  chocolate cake, Biscotti, Cannoli, Creme Brulee, Ice cream in a home made sugar cone bowl, Lemon Meringue Tart, Yogurt Panna Cotta, and Profiteroles). The only ones that I really like are the creme brulee and the yogurt panna cotta. Overall, the food is okay but pricey but the ambiance is awesome! The wallpaper inside the restaurant is reminiscent of Pompeii. They haev a very nice, intimate setting and bar inside and I'm just glad that they have a restroom, unlike the other restaurant next door.

excerpts: My boss got steamed black mussels with choice of three sauces.
Since I was too full, I did not order any tiramisu.
The service was okay - the receptionist could be more hospitalized
but she was not
but the waiter was very nice.
I have a very good lunch for my day.
mussels.author: Roserrele W.
mussels.review: My boss bought me lunch there for my birthday.  We have a very pleasure meal there - pan seared ahi tuna with lemon sauce over spicy shrimp risotto is really delicious.  My boss got steamed black mussels with choice of three sauces.  Since I was too full, I did not order any tiramisu.  The service was okay - the receptionist could be more hospitalized but she was not but the waiter was very nice.  I have a very good lunch for my day.

excerpts: Tiramisu had pretty good mussels.
Portions were a little on the small side, but other than that, I enjoyed it.
mussels.author: Beth W.
mussels.review: Of course Belden Place is always cute. Tiramisu had pretty good mussels. Portions were a little on the small side, but other than that, I enjoyed it.

excerpts: One of my favorites thing is definetely the Mussels!
So good!!!!
mussels.author: Martha A.
mussels.review: This is a really good Itailan restaurant. I come here very often with my brother and little nephew. All the staff are incrediby nice and sweet! The have soooo many different wines to choose from too! One of my favorites thing is definetely the Mussels! So good!!!!

excerpts: It is a delicious stew with mussels in the shell, juicy shrimp, pieces of fish and scallops.
It has crunchy bread soaking in it as well
but when you're done you'll want more to soak up the rest of the sauce.
All very fresh and flavorful.
Service was superb.
A very classy place.
I sat indoors but I agree the pedestrian street is a plus if you like to sit outside.
SF generally is chilly though - especially at night.
A sidenote is that the people eating there were friendly and interesting.
mussels.author: Matt K.
mussels.review: The meal starts off with some better than average bread with some good tapanade to go with it.  But save some bread if you order Cioppino.  It is a delicious stew with mussels in the shell, juicy shrimp, pieces of fish and scallops.  It has crunchy bread soaking in it as well but when you're done you'll want more to soak up the rest of the sauce.  All very fresh and flavorful.  Service was superb.  A very classy place.  I sat indoors but I agree the pedestrian street is a plus if you like to sit outside.  SF generally is chilly though - especially at night.  A sidenote is that the people eating there were friendly and interesting.

excerpts: My friend and I started out with the steamed mussels in a saffron-fennel broth.
The mussels were huge and juicy.
Then we both had the lobster ravioli in a light tomato cream sauce with a sprinkling of cavier on top.
The portion size was decent
- I got 6 huge freshly made raviolis.
Each bite was delectable.
I almost couldn't finish my entre as I had half of a huge pot of steamed mussels.
Then for dessert we were debating whether to get the tiramisu and we ended up getting the gelato/sorbet instead.
There were 2 kinds of gelato (vanilla bean/hazelnut) and raspberry sorbet contained in a bird's nest (a crunch sweet shell).
With every bite you would have part of the crunchy shell with a spoonful of gelato/sorbet.
The two elements really complimented each other.
By the end of the meal, I was overly full.
But it was a great meal and the service was decent.
This restaurant would be perfect for a dinner date.
Prices on the menu were average for an Italian restaurant in the financial district.
mussels.author: Candace F.
mussels.review: I came here for dinner on a weeknight. It was quiet around 6:15PM and then as the night progressed it was packed. My friend and I started out with the steamed mussels in a saffron-fennel broth. The mussels were huge and juicy. Then we both had the lobster ravioli in a light tomato cream sauce with a sprinkling of cavier on top. The portion size was decent - I got 6 huge freshly made raviolis. Each bite was delectable. I almost couldn't finish my entre as I had half of a huge pot of steamed mussels. Then for dessert we were debating whether to get the tiramisu and we ended up getting the gelato/sorbet instead. There were 2 kinds of gelato (vanilla bean/hazelnut) and raspberry sorbet contained in a bird's nest (a crunch sweet shell). With every bite you would have part of the crunchy shell with a spoonful of gelato/sorbet. The two elements really complimented each other. By the end of the meal, I was overly full. But it was a great meal and the service was decent. This restaurant would be perfect for a dinner date. Prices on the menu were average for an Italian restaurant in the financial district.

excerpts: A heaping mussel plate ($15) with the largest mussels ever.
I thought I would be scared, but they were tasty.
The oyster appetizer was underwhelming and the oysters were small, smaller than the mussels.
Strange.
As for the main entrees: my seabass was so overcooked, it tasted like halibut.
Erg.

The assorted seafood platter was horrifying: the most gigantic crawfish (or is that shrimp?) ever with the head and arms still attached (I don't want a gigantic insect like thing sitting on the very top of my plate like it just killed the other items there), and the remaining items weren't appealing, either.
mussels.author: A P.
mussels.review: Decent, fun place on a temperate night.  If you sit outside, it'll be very noisy and there will be smoking.  So, sit inside, as close to the window as possible, so you'll feel like you're outside without all the irritations.  It's quieter inside too.  Make sure you eat here on an expense account because it's damn expensive for what you get.  Appetizers were the best value.  A heaping mussel plate ($15) with the largest mussels ever.  I thought I would be scared, but they were tasty.  The oyster appetizer was underwhelming and the oysters were small, smaller than the mussels.  Strange.  As for the main entrees: my seabass was so overcooked, it tasted like halibut.  Erg.  The assorted seafood platter was horrifying: the most gigantic crawfish (or is that shrimp?) ever with the head and arms still attached (I don't want a gigantic insect like thing sitting on the very top of my plate like it just killed the other items there), and the remaining items weren't appealing, either.  The scallop risotto was a thimble full of risotto with maybe two scallops on top.  It was damn tiny, and you had to laugh.  And the ahi tuna was nice, kinda like if you can't decide between raw and cooked, so you get both, seared on the outside, raw on the inside.  But not a lot of it on the plate.  Thank goodness the appetizers were so large!  The desert cheese plate was 5 small pieces of cheese, four grapes and one strawberry slice on an enormous plate, reminding me of a modern art gallery.  The saving grace was the tiramisu, the best I've ever had in my life, and I always get tiramisu when it's available.  But that's not enough to eat here.  Just get appetizer and tiramisu, avoid the entrees.  And if they try to seat you in the basement, just walk out.  The only reason to go down there is to use the restroom.  The atmosphere is horrible, horrible down there!

excerpts: So we ordered raw oysters and that was a big mistake--
when it came, it smelled like sewage...  and sure enough, the second oyster we had was bad-- it smelled like poop!

and when we pointed this out (to one of the bus boys as our waiter was nowhere to be seen), and after a long wait, our waiter comes sauntering to our table, brings us 1 new oyster (offers no apologies) and says "What was wrong with it?
We just got the shipment today.
Who got the short end of the stick?
raw oysters.author: Sunny K.
raw oysters.review:
We always do lunch on New Year's Eve in the city and we try a new place to see if we'll come back in the new year.  Well, we will never be coming back here again, and definitely won't be recommending this place to any of our friends or family.  

First of all the service was horrible. Our waiter made eye contact with us several times but never came by... no water... no bread... nothing.  There were only 4 other tables in the entire place @ 1PM and the 3 tables were being serviced by another waiter who definitely seemed more attentive (made sure we got our tabasco sauce for the oysters when we couldn't find our waiter).  

So we ordered raw oysters and that was a big mistake-- when it came, it smelled like sewage...  and sure enough, the second oyster we had was bad-- it smelled like poop! and when we pointed this out (to one of the bus boys as our waiter was nowhere to be seen), and after a long wait, our waiter comes sauntering to our table, brings us 1 new oyster (offers no apologies) and says "What was wrong with it?  We just got the shipment today.  Who got the short end of the stick?" Unbelievable... 

Rissoto with blank ink and scallops-- you expect to get at least 2 or more scallops right?  Wrong.  This dish comes with one scallop cut in half (the scallop itself was good) but the rissoto was way too salty...  it needed more scallops!

We had high hopes for dessert but unfortunately the tiramisu wasn't anything to rave about. The only dish we had that was good was the mussels with calabrese pepperoncini (the sauce was great) but the whole time we ate it, we were paranoid we'd come across another rotten, putrified morsel...

There are so many wonderful Italian restaurants in the city-- don't waste your time or money here.  Unfortunately for us, we learned it the hard way:  the service is poor (our waiter was truly pompous and a big bully) and the standard of food just wasn't there...

excerpts:
We had Raw Oysters - ok
Mussels in Saffron - YUMMY
raw oysters.author: Sue Ann M.
raw oysters.review:
Great Atmosphere. Super cute cafe with a feeling of Europe. Great people whatching area. Food was ok. 

We had Raw Oysters - ok
Mussels in Saffron - YUMMY
The Dessert sampler - ok

The best part was the Saffron sauce soaked up with the bread, but they took the bread and bowl away before we had a chance to finish. We felt just a bit rushed even though they were not trying to turn tables over. It was late in the afternoon and not crazy busy at all.

I would definity go back again as I enjoy the atmosphere.

excerpts: We had had a range of items, including the raw oysters, black ink risotto with scallops, buffalo mozzarella and heirloom tomato salad, mixed grilled seafood, linguine a la vongole and finally, seared ahi  over spicy shrimp risotto.

Of all of these dishes, the only ones I really enjoyed eating were the oysters and the salad, both of which I could find elsewhere or make at home (not enough scallop with the black ink; grilled fish item from mix was rather dry, and the general mix was good but not special; the linguine also lacked outstanding qualities, with the pasta being a little too dry and too much; the spicy shrimp risotto was like risotto mixed with Sriracha and topped with canned tuna fish since the fish was not so much as seared as it was fully cooked).

But, though not impressed with the food, the waitress and management were very accommodating; example, my grandfather was not familiar with any of the menu dishes and has for a long time considered linguine a la vongole his favorite Italian pasta dish.
It was not on the menu, but management whipped it up for him anyway.
I've been told that at night the outdoor seating does not exist, and really the charm of Belden is the canopied front shop seating (note, if you come at 12, you may have to wait a while
but if you come at 12:30, forget about it.
This place is very popular with those working in the Financial District, so clusters of co-workers and small business lunches line up beginning at 12.
Try to get there at the very latest, 11:45); so, if I were to come back it would only be for lunch.

In summary...
5 for customer service
5 for atmosphere
4 for presentation
3 for food... and though everything else was outstanding, I really have to emphasize and warn about the pretty but lackluster food that priced at $20/person for lunch!
I would not object to coming here again, I did have a lot of fun, but be forewarned... this is about the relaxing, 2 hr dining vacation experience than the actual food itself.
raw oysters.author: Jessica L.
raw oysters.review:
I'd never actually been down the Belden alleyway, and probably would have missed it if my uncle, a long-time SF resident, hadn't pointed it out to my folks when we visited the city.
Although touristy, it definitely has its quasi-European charm, with its lunchtime outdoor seating, Italian speaking waiting staff and beautifully presented dishes. This place is supposed to be known for its seafood, and while very fresh... I'm a little disappointed, but they were not very memorable in terms of taste, although they were visually very stunning. We had had a range of items, including the raw oysters, black ink risotto with scallops, buffalo mozzarella and heirloom tomato salad, mixed grilled seafood, linguine a la vongole and finally, seared ahi  over spicy shrimp risotto. Of all of these dishes, the only ones I really enjoyed eating were the oysters and the salad, both of which I could find elsewhere or make at home (not enough scallop with the black ink; grilled fish item from mix was rather dry, and the general mix was good but not special; the linguine also lacked outstanding qualities, with the pasta being a little too dry and too much; the spicy shrimp risotto was like risotto mixed with Sriracha and topped with canned tuna fish since the fish was not so much as seared as it was fully cooked). But, though not impressed with the food, the waitress and management were very accommodating; example, my grandfather was not familiar with any of the menu dishes and has for a long time considered linguine a la vongole his favorite Italian pasta dish. It was not on the menu, but management whipped it up for him anyway.
I've been told that at night the outdoor seating does not exist, and really the charm of Belden is the canopied front shop seating (note, if you come at 12, you may have to wait a while but if you come at 12:30, forget about it. This place is very popular with those working in the Financial District, so clusters of co-workers and small business lunches line up beginning at 12. Try to get there at the very latest, 11:45); so, if I were to come back it would only be for lunch.
In summary...
5 for customer service
5 for atmosphere
4 for presentation
3 for food... and though everything else was outstanding, I really have to emphasize and warn about the pretty but lackluster food that priced at $20/person for lunch! I would not object to coming here again, I did have a lot of fun, but be forewarned... this is about the relaxing, 2 hr dining vacation experience than the actual food itself.

excerpts: For appetizers we got the pan seared scallops and the bresola (air dried beef) and both were soooo good!
The scallops were flavorful and melt in your mouth and the beef was just filled with flavor.
pan seared scallops.author: Vivian D.
pan seared scallops.review:
Came here for restaurant  week  and had the most exquisite time! Ambiance is real nice. Has a real authentic Italian feel. All the waiters are Italian! Got the prix fix meal and it was definitely worth it. 

For appetizers we got the pan seared scallops and the bresola (air dried beef) and both were soooo good! The scallops were flavorful and melt in your mouth and the beef was just filled with flavor. For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops. The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine. Seriously everything here was great. I got a special dessert sampler and I was in dessert heaven. Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu. The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to. Maybe more like a pudding? But still good nonetheless. 

Glad I got to try a  place I probably never would have gone to!

excerpts: We had the pan seared scallops for starters and they were wonderfully sweet.
I had the gnocchi which were perfect.
They were light and fluffy and melted in my mouth.
My hubs had the braised short rib and that too was delicious.
For desert, we had the cannolis(sp?)
that were made with ricotta instead of marscapone and that made it light.
Inside is nice and quiet, outside is a bit boisterous.
And for two, with No alcohol, it was over a hundred.
So, it's a special occasion place for us.
pan seared scallops.author: Nutan C.
pan seared scallops.review: Just amazing. We had the pan seared scallops for starters and they were wonderfully sweet. I had the gnocchi which were perfect. They were light and fluffy and melted in my mouth. My hubs had the braised short rib and that too was delicious. For desert, we had the cannolis(sp?) that were made with ricotta instead of marscapone and that made it light.  Inside is nice and quiet, outside is a bit boisterous. And for two, with No alcohol, it was over a hundred. So, it's a special occasion place for us.

excerpts: went back for lunch 5 days later and ordered "Just" the pan seared scallops and a glass of wine.
They were again very tasty.
However, only 2 of my 4 scallops were actually seared with the same crust as the other two.
seemed as if the chef was in a hurry to get them out.
My waiter was not quite on the mark.
as the person that I (assumed) to be the owner asked me if i needed anything else.
I asked to see the desert menu.
Before he could get it to me , My waiter was putting my check on my table without asking if I wanted desert.
Think he got scolded for that error by the assumed owner..
I did enjoy my desert.
the triple vanilla dish was delightful.
and I look forward to returning again.
pan seared scallops.author: Judy B.
pan seared scallops.review: went back for lunch 5 days later and ordered "Just" the pan seared scallops and a glass of wine. They were again very tasty. However, only 2 of my 4 scallops were actually seared with the same crust as the other two. seemed as if the chef was in a hurry to get them out. My waiter was not quite on the mark. as the person that I (assumed) to be the owner asked me if i needed anything else. I asked to see the desert menu. Before he could get it to me , My waiter was putting my check on my table without asking if I wanted desert. Think he got scolded for that error by the assumed owner.. I did enjoy my desert. the triple vanilla dish was delightful. and I look forward to returning again.

excerpts:
Appetizers:
- Grilled Octopus with avocado, celery & salmoriglio sauce
- Classic Veal Meatballs over polenta with tomato sauce and dry ricotta
classic veal meatballs.author: Jenn L.
classic veal meatballs.review:
The quality of Cafe Tiramisu isn't the same as it used to be when I first tired this place. I like how they have an outside seating and you have the option to do a fixed price dinner as well. I felt that the appetizers were more tasty than the entires. I was pretty happy with the appetizers but the entrees tasted microwaved and definitely NOT fresh. At least for dessert, the tiramisu was pretty good. 

Appetizers:
- Grilled Octopus with avocado, celery & salmoriglio sauce
- Classic Veal Meatballs over polenta with tomato sauce and dry ricotta
- Bruschetta with fig spread, burratta, prosciutto and aged balsamic

Entrees: (not so good...)
- Ravioli filled with beef shortribs over tomato fondue, sage and garlic chips
- Asparagus and Lemon Risotto with bottarga di tonno

excerpts: On the DAT menu, which has a very nice selection, I ordered the appetizer: Hand Made Orecchiette with duck ragu & fresh ricotta, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, entree:
Dungeness Crab Angolotti with mascarpone vodka sauce,
dessert: Piccolo Tiramisu Lady finger cookies, mascarpone, espresso.

My boyfriend ordered soup: Cauliflower with Dungeness Crab, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, appetizer: Grilled Butcher Steak over creamy portabella mushrooms, red wine & parmesan shoestring fries.
orecchiette.author: Jean T.
orecchiette.review:
I came here for Dine About Town with my boyfriend and another couple. 

First impression: It is tucked in a lit alley with other restaurants. It would be nice to sit outside if it wasn't so cold. They have heat lamps but they're not all around. 

On the DAT menu, which has a very nice selection, I ordered the appetizer: Hand Made Orecchiette with duck ragu & fresh ricotta, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, entree: Dungeness Crab Angolotti with mascarpone vodka sauce, dessert: Piccolo Tiramisu Lady finger cookies, mascarpone, espresso. My boyfriend ordered soup: Cauliflower with Dungeness Crab, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, appetizer: Grilled Butcher Steak over creamy portabella mushrooms, red wine & parmesan shoestring fries.

My favorite had to be the Dungeness Crab angolotti! I could've ordered another 2 orders! It is basically a dungeness crab ravioli with more dungeness crab on time. I will go back just for that!
Everything else was very delicious! No complaints!

The service was very good as well. Our server was very patient, since we were still waiting for my boyfriend to arrive. He was 30mins late. We were able to sit down at our table without having to wait for the entire party to arrive like other restaurants, which is a good thing since it was cold outside! We took our time and didn't feel rushed at all.

I would definitely come back for the food!

excerpts: I got the orecchiette, which is a flat handmade pasta with sauteed greens and spicy sausage.
It was excellent.
My group also enjoyed the tortellini.
orecchiette.author: Bee M.
orecchiette.review:
I came here with 5 other people.  I really enjoyed the ambience.  The walls have "ancient" Roman murals with the effect of peeling paint (except the peels are painted on).  It's located in an alley beside other restaurants and is a little hard to find, but I truly felt like I was in Italy.  There's also patio seating.

I got the orecchiette, which is a flat handmade pasta with sauteed greens and spicy sausage.  It was excellent.  My group also enjoyed the tortellini.  The bread served is room-temperature ciabatta with pesto.

We got a bottle of wine; the waiter told us that he would give us a better bottle for the same price.  When the bill came, the bottle he had recommended was $20 extra - however, when we pointed it out, they reduced it to the price of the original bottle we had wanted.  (Make sure you keep an eye on the bill for tricks like that).

All in all, very reasonable priced - it came to $26 a person for an entree plus wine.  Get a bottle of wine if you are a group.

Parking is difficult, so coming here on public transportation recommended.

excerpts:
the restaurant is a very cute and cozy place snuggled in belden pl

we both got the duck ragu orechiette orecchiette and the tiramisu for dessert.
orecchiette.author: Katherine C.
orecchiette.review:
came here with a friend for a dine about town dinner date.

the restaurant is a very cute and cozy place snuggled in belden pl

we both got the duck ragu orechiette orecchiette and the tiramisu for dessert.  i had the crab ravioli and my friend had the steak. i loved everything except for the crab ravioli. the duck pasta was very tasty and comforting, the steak cooked very nicely and very tender, and the tiramisu was one of the best ive had. the crab ravioli however was pretty disappointing. it lacked depth in flavor and just wasn't a very satisfying dish for me.

overall, good experience!

excerpts: My dining partner order the Orecchiette and that was better tasting than mine but a bit on the spicy side.
Overall dinner was okay.
I thought it would be better but dessert totally made up for it.
We ordered Panna Cotta and well they ran out of the Vanilla one
so we end up getting a White Chocolate one.
Boy was it good and it literally taste like you were eating a bar of White Chocolate.
We also ordered drinks too.
The 7 on 7 is good here, it taste more like a mojito.
My Cosmo was okay.
Our waiter was very nice and attentive.
I would come back
but I think there seafood dishes are better.
orecchiette.author: Donna Y.
orecchiette.review:
I came on Saturday for dinner and thought to try without a reservation. I was all excited since the last time I was here the food was great and the service was wonderful. We were met by the host and she was not very nice. She kept trying to sell me a table outside even though it was freezing cold in the city and the wind was blowing. She told me it was under the heat lamps. That was not true cuz it was just partly under the heat lamps so only half of you was warm and the other half was cold. I wanted to sit inside but the top floor seems to be filled but they had empty tables downstairs which I didn't understand why she told me she didn't have any tables available inside. 

We finally got a table downstairs and out of the cold. End up ordering the Blackened 'Kobe Style' Carpaccio which I thought was alright, I was expecting it to be better since it had Foie Gras and Truffles in it. The Heirloom Tomato Salad was good and it came deconstructed. I end up ordering the Pappardelle which pretty much taste like Bonalese Spaghetti. My dining partner order the Orecchiette and that was better tasting than mine but a bit on the spicy side. Overall dinner was okay. I thought it would be better but dessert totally made up for it. We ordered Panna Cotta and well they ran out of the Vanilla one so we end up getting a White Chocolate one. Boy was it good and it literally taste like you were eating a bar of White Chocolate. We also ordered drinks too. The 7 on 7 is good here, it taste more like a mojito. My Cosmo was okay. Our waiter was very nice and attentive. I would come back but I think there seafood dishes are better.

excerpts: I had the squid ink pici pasta which is rare to find.
I first got introduce to pici when i visited Tuscany and a fan.
Hubby had short rib ravioli.
The tiramisu was good but wished it  had more expresso.
Coming back for their pappardelle wild boar!
pici.author: Emmy D.
pici.review: Fresh pasta made daily..I'm in!  When eating here my hubby and I dined outside and reminded me of Italia :) I enjoyed the grilled calamari for appetizer.  I had the squid ink pici pasta which is rare to find.  I first got introduce to pici when i visited Tuscany and a fan.  Hubby had short rib ravioli.  The tiramisu was good but wished it  had more expresso.  Coming back for their pappardelle wild boar!

excerpts: Other entrees that blessed our table were pici, gnocci, the grand ole pork chop & veal.
They make all of their pastas in house & it pays off.
As if the meal and service weren't enough.
They sent out a table full of complimentary desserts.
How can you say no to that?
Especially when there's an espresso creme brulee, chocolate torte/cake & cream puffs with ganache staring you down.
Out of the couple of different cute little places in this famous food alley I'd definitely pay my next visit to Cafe Tiramisu & opt for that sunny table outside again.
More pasta
and my beet salad (a must!)
pici.author: Stephanie D.
pici.review: Giuseppe, you're amazing & thank you for being the gracious host you were for my buddy's bday/baby shower luncheon.  The food was amazing & I promise to be back for that limoncello.  I'm already plotting my next visit with hopes that the menu isn't changed!!  Everything from beginning to end was delicious.  For starters we had the bruscetta, calamari, oysters, sardines & beet salad.  I would order them ALL and whatever else is on the appetizer menu again.  I myself had the shrimp & zucchini blossom risotto.  Other entrees that blessed our table were pici, gnocci, the grand ole pork chop & veal.  They make all of their pastas in house & it pays off.  As if the meal and service weren't enough.  They sent out a table full of complimentary desserts.  How can you say no to that?  Especially when there's an espresso creme brulee, chocolate torte/cake & cream puffs with ganache staring you down.  Out of the couple of different cute little places in this famous food alley I'd definitely pay my next visit to Cafe Tiramisu & opt for that sunny table outside again.  More pasta please!!!........and my beet salad (a must!)

excerpts: Having been in Tuscany last fall, we have been looking for pici pasta ever since.
We found it here, and the seafood sauce was delicious .
My wife had rabbit, also hard to find.
Guiseppe, the owner, recommended a wine which served us well.
Service was excellent, and clean silverware arrived with each course, and exceedingly rare event.
pici.author: george p.
pici.review: The food was very good: carpaccio flavorful, and the calamari appetizer, not fried but sauted and whole, was also very tender. Having been in Tuscany last fall, we have been looking for pici pasta ever since. We found it here, and the seafood sauce was delicious . My wife had rabbit, also hard to find. Guiseppe, the owner, recommended a wine which served us well. Service was excellent, and clean silverware arrived with each course, and exceedingly rare event.

excerpts: I'm a big fan of their penne arrabbiata.
It has the perfect level of spice and a good earthy flavor from the mushrooms to compliment the goat cheese and tomato sauce.
One of those dishes I always use my bread to wipe the plate clean of sauce when i am done with the pasta.
Just warms the soul.
I enjoy the environment; nice calm atmosphere with friendly staff.
Reminds me of being back in Chicago with my Italian uncles.
Alla prossima...
penne arrabbiata.author: Rebecca R.
penne arrabbiata.review: I'm a big fan of their penne arrabbiata.  It has the perfect level of spice and a good earthy flavor from the mushrooms to compliment the goat cheese and tomato sauce.  One of those dishes I always use my bread to wipe the plate clean of sauce when i am done with the pasta. :)  Just warms the soul.  I enjoy the environment; nice calm atmosphere with friendly staff.  Reminds me of being back in Chicago with my Italian uncles.  Alla prossima...

excerpts: Gnocchi of potato is so good...
tiramisu is not bad.
It's on a small back street near Kearny and Pine.
Outdoor seating is really cool and the food is good
gnocchi of potato.author: Li F.
gnocchi of potato.review: Gnocchi of potato is so good... tiramisu is not bad. It's on a small back street near Kearny and Pine. Outdoor seating is really cool and the food is good

excerpts: Sitting on top of risotto with green peas and hints of jalapeno slices.
risotto.author: Wen L.
risotto.review:
Classic ristorante. Same owner for past 27 years. Our first time was circa 1998. Haven't dined here for sometime. Came back this evening for dinner date with hubby... Same decor, nicely upkept, very Italiano vibe. Although I did miss the Italian servers from before. The owner back in the days was quite the management... Managing every staff from the front point of ristorante to the kitchen and back. But today he is still very hands on managing as the evening host. Taking customers to their table and handing them checks. 

Hubby ordered lamb... He was very pleased. The taste is still the same like when we first dined. Meat was made to perfection... Not over cooked, beautiful pink inside with no signs of red juice spilling out, the lamb had a nice crunchy texture and nut burnt. Topped with mashed potatoes and bed of fresh sauteed spinach. 

I had their petrole fish. Made well... Sitting on top of risotto with green peas and hints of jalapeno slices. Very light and delicioso. 

We also shared the mussels. And the tomato red sauce broth is still the same. 

Really 3.5 stars. 
Service is decent
Food is excellent
Amazed to see owner and still rocking it. Business can be challenging. But glad to see home till hold up this belden lane gem. This is where I ranked highly. 

Buon apetito

excerpts: I definitely loved the seafood risotto and wished one more shrimp included with the serving.
The sauce was delicious; the mushroom was tasty.
Also loved the sauce of meatball dish.
Lamb chops were tender and polenta was good.
Tiramisu cake was delicious as well.
I think a little work on food presentation would go a longer way, but I definitely enjoyed the taste of each dish.
Looking forward to trying something with lobster or crab next time
risotto.author: Ariene S.
risotto.review:
First time here last night. Small place hidden in alley-like location. 
I definitely loved the seafood risotto and wished one more shrimp included with the serving. The sauce was delicious; the mushroom was tasty. 
Also loved the sauce of meatball dish. Lamb chops were tender and polenta was good. Tiramisu cake was delicious as well.  I think a little work on food presentation would go a longer way, but I definitely enjoyed the taste of each dish. 
Looking forward to trying something with lobster or crab next time :)

excerpts: The Jalapeño crab risotto is 10/10 and easily my favorite item to accompany any dish.
My girlfriend loves the spinach and cheese ravioli and that's all she gets!
Also, all of their pasta is made in house and is extremely fresh.
On second thought, everything has always been extremely fresh.
This is due to the fact that the menu is designed around what foods are the freshest at certain times of year.
risotto.author: Anthony F.
risotto.review:
This review is extremely overdue, as in like YEARS overdue, but here it is! 

I have been to Cafe Tiramisu numerous times and every single time I eat here I am reminded of why this establishment is fantastic. First of all, the food is out of this world. The lamb and sole are my personal favorites, however there really isn't a bad dish on the menu. The Jalapeño crab risotto is 10/10 and easily my favorite item to accompany any dish.  My girlfriend loves the spinach and cheese ravioli and that's all she gets! Also, all of their pasta is made in house and is extremely fresh. On second thought, everything has always been extremely fresh. This is due to the fact that the menu is designed around what foods are the freshest at certain times of year. Don't expect the menu to be the same all year long because the owner likes to rotate it as the seasons change. 

The ambiance at Cafe Tiramisu is amazing. Whenever I walk in through the front door it feels like a trip to Italy. It can be a perfect social setting or a more romantic setting depending on which you are going for. The service is great. I could spend hours admiring this restaurant and how beautifully decorated it is. I never want my visit here to end. 

The dessert is amazing especially the Tiramisu!

If you're debating on restaurants to visit in the city give this place a shot as you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: I got the risotto with mushrooms and shrimp, so delicious.
Everyone loved their meals and of course we had to finish with tiramisu.
Wish I lived here because I would go be back regularly.
I can see how some people might get annoyed about the speed of service but we didn't mind, gave us to chat and enjoy our drinks.
risotto.author: Megan P.
risotto.review: Here for a conference so I stopped here with coworkers after finding the  place through open table.  Just wow. The place itself is so charming and the food was amazing. We did some appetizers of the meatballs, bruschetta and prosciutto. Highly recommend the meatballs- they were awesome!  I got the risotto with mushrooms and shrimp, so delicious. Everyone loved their meals and of course we had to finish with tiramisu.  Wish I lived here because I would go be back regularly. I can see how some people might get annoyed about the speed of service but we didn't mind, gave us to chat and enjoy our drinks.

excerpts: I got the Risotto.
risotto.author: Natalie L.
risotto.review:
Had a welcome new member team lunch here with my co workers. Decided to try this place since we always go to Plouf. 

Great service and cute little restaurant inside Belden Lane. I got the Risotto. It had mussels and also lobster bisque inside, it was VERY good. I highly recommend! Loved it! The flavors collided great, I was expecting it to be salty, but not at all. My co workers got some other dishes and they also enjoyed their lunch. 

I would come here again, they have really good pasta here, definitely a must try.

excerpts:
- Ravioli filled with beef shortribs over tomato fondue, sage and garlic chips
- Asparagus and Lemon Risotto with bottarga di tonno
risotto.author: Jenn L.
risotto.review:
The quality of Cafe Tiramisu isn't the same as it used to be when I first tired this place. I like how they have an outside seating and you have the option to do a fixed price dinner as well. I felt that the appetizers were more tasty than the entires. I was pretty happy with the appetizers but the entrees tasted microwaved and definitely NOT fresh. At least for dessert, the tiramisu was pretty good. 

Appetizers:
- Grilled Octopus with avocado, celery & salmoriglio sauce
- Classic Veal Meatballs over polenta with tomato sauce and dry ricotta
- Bruschetta with fig spread, burratta, prosciutto and aged balsamic

Entrees: (not so good...)
- Ravioli filled with beef shortribs over tomato fondue, sage and garlic chips
- Asparagus and Lemon Risotto with bottarga di tonno

excerpts: Last year I got veal scallopini with risotto, which they have changed to pork scallopini.
I really liked this dish!
The risotto is amazing.
risotto.author: Melissa H.
risotto.review:
Very good Italian food! My Italian friend gave me a glowing recommendation for this place, and it definitely lives up to expectations! I've been here twice, once last year in October and again this October. 

It's in a really cute alley with a bunch of different European restaurants, with a choice of outdoor or indoor seating. The indoor seating is pretty nice and the decor is very Roman, but I think I prefer outdoor seating just because the ambiance is better. 

They change up their menus quite often I think, because I didn't see the same entree I got last year on it this year, nor did I see some of the entrees that other Yelp reviewers are talking about. Last year I got veal scallopini with risotto, which they have changed to pork scallopini. I really liked this dish! The risotto is amazing. I also tried the steak carpaccio last year, which was also delicious. 

This year I split a cheese board with a friend; I'm not very informed on cheese nor do I eat it very often so I can't really give an opinion here. For entree I got linguine with clams, which was really good! Lots of clams and the white wine sauce was very flavorful. The tiramisu here is also really good; one order is a lot though so definitely split it. 

I thought the service was fine too! Although I don't really have high standards for service. Definitely will come again!
