excerpts: Hubby had the seafood risotto over lobster bisque.
There were 11 tiny clams and he liked it.
I had the pan-seared sea bass which was moist
risotto.author: Ry T.
risotto.review:
Nice service as the waiter was attentive and very nice.  There is really only one dish I would definitely make a return trip for - the Tiramisu.  It was creamy and tasty and large enough to be shared by two.
My corn and leek soup topped with spicy chopped crunchy shrimp was very good.  
The grilled octopus with avocado which had rave reviews by Yelpers was good but not earth shaking. 
Our entrees were good but didn't wow either of us.
Hubby had the seafood risotto over lobster bisque.  There were 11 tiny clams and he liked it.
I had the pan-seared sea bass which was moist but the flavor wasn't exciting.  

We sat upstairs, inside near the stairway which lead to about another 7 tables downstairs. Hubby had to use the bathroom which was located downstairs.  He said the area downstairs had a mildew odor which i also noticed as I sat near the stairs.  It's below street level, really underground so not much aeration.  There are ample tables for outside seating.  I thought it was too cold outside tonight and do not like sitting outside on the alley street.  SF streets are pretty dirty.  We were close to the kitchen and could see how hard the staff works to make our meals.  If you like tiramisu for dessert, you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: As for food, we had mussels, tuna and salmon crudo with burrata, short rib risotto with scallops, and tomato and corn soup.
The mussels and crudo were okay--tasty but nothing exceptional.
The soup was delicious and had an addictive smokiness to it, and given the opportunity I could probably finish a tub of it.
The freshness of the scallops and micro-greens were a nice balance to the richness and meatiness of the short rib risotto.
risotto.author: Tina X.
risotto.review:
Ordered a bunch of plates to share with a friend because we are fatties. The restaurant was relatively empty even at around 7PM but that was probably because it was during the middle of the week. Our server was charming and attentive but service was a bit slow since we were sitting far back in the restaurant, which was quite empty. 

As for food, we had mussels, tuna and salmon crudo with burrata, short rib risotto with scallops, and tomato and corn soup. The mussels and crudo were okay--tasty but nothing exceptional. The soup was delicious and had an addictive smokiness to it, and given the opportunity I could probably finish a tub of it. The freshness of the scallops and micro-greens were a nice balance to the richness and meatiness of the short rib risotto.

The restaurant interior was a very ancient Roman, with frescoes and mosaic-like art on the wall. They have patio seating, and the back dining room has a skylight, which is always nice!

excerpts: The last two times we have started with the scallops/risotto and the burrata.
risotto.author: Linds L.
risotto.review:
I am sad to see that there are any negative reviews for this place. Also shocked that I haven't left a review before! Let's fix that. 

This is my favorite place to eat in the city. It is as close to feeling like you're in Europe as you're going to get. The restaurants spill out into the alley and you sit right next to your neighbors. It's lovely and wonderful and comforting. 

When the hub and I come here we always split a bottle of wine - usually a Chianti because it's an easy drink. They bring out bread with olive oil and tapenade (they will also bring butter if you ask for it!) The last two times we have started with the scallops/risotto and the burrata. Both delicious! 

For main dishes, the hub always gets the black peppered pappardelle (he's a man of habit). I usually go for the cioppino or the ravioli. Consistently good. 

And what's a great dinner without dessert? Recommend the tiramisu or the profiteroles. And, they often will bring out complimentary lemoncello after your meal. I actually heard a woman complain about that this last time! I mean, what a rough life to have people bring you something for free. 

There's usually a wait on the weekends for dinner but they take reservations and they'll squeeze you in where they can even without one. They also never rush you to leave which is fabulous. I hate to add to the wait, but you should definitely go.

excerpts: On a bed of squid ink risotto.
My first try of squid ink.
I thought it might taste strong
but it's actually quite mild, what I'd call an ocean flavor.
Probably more drama than anything.
Also liked the bread with dipping/drizzling sauce - chimichurri?
In the midst of our meal, a group of women sat at the next table, really a continuation as there was a long bench, several of them wearing VERY STRONG perfume.
I am severely fragrance sensitive and knew at once I had to move as I immediately got a massive headache.
If I did not get out of there I would be painfully ill, too nauseated to eat, and all food would taste like perfume anyway.
We moved outside, although it was a bit cold.
(People on the East Coast might disagree.)
The waiter kindly carried out plates, wine glasses, bread, water, etc.
We were able to finish & enjoy our meals.
I asked the waiter (large white male) what the sauce was on the fish, he said lobster.
No wonder it was so good!
I wonder of those women were able to taste their food?
Dessert: I got cannoli and he got baba.
The cannoli were excellent, they nailed the pastry.
I have suffered through soggy pastry too many times!
Creamy filling with chunks of chocolate, sprinkled with pistachio.
We traded bites.
The baba had a good fruity sauce but I think the cake was a tad dry.
So lose 1/2 star for cake, also because prix fixe menu on web site
but they had discontinued it.
Need to update web site to say so.
risotto.author: Carol S.
risotto.review:
Give this 4 1/2 stars. Really enjoyed meal, great waiter.
Details: I had a meeting with my financial adviser. After more than 10 years we've become friends as well so he took me to dinner, corporate account, best of all.
We split a salad & bruschetta. He got salmon and I got the seafood special, halibut.
Bruschetta was OK, not special. Salad really good with beets, apples, nuts. Very fresh. My fish was spectacularly good. A light crust, perfectly cooked. Just enough seasoning to enhance but not drown flavor. It came garnished with large shrimp and tiny mussels; I got an extra tiny fork to get the mussels out of their shells. A sprinkling of peas and a fabulous sauce. On a bed of squid ink risotto. My first try of squid ink. I thought it might taste strong but it's actually quite mild, what I'd call an ocean flavor. Probably more drama than anything. 
Also liked the bread with dipping/drizzling sauce - chimichurri? 
In the midst of our meal, a group of women sat at the next table, really a continuation as there was a long bench, several of them wearing VERY STRONG perfume. I am severely fragrance sensitive and knew at once I had to move as I immediately got a massive headache. If I did not get out of there I would be painfully ill, too nauseated to eat, and all food would taste like perfume anyway. We moved outside, although it was a bit cold. (People on the East Coast might disagree.) The waiter kindly carried out plates, wine glasses, bread, water, etc. We were able to finish & enjoy our meals. 
I asked the waiter (large white male) what the sauce was on the fish, he said lobster. No wonder it was so good!
I wonder of those women were able to taste their food?
Dessert: I got cannoli and he got baba. The cannoli were excellent, they nailed the pastry. I have suffered through soggy pastry too many times! Creamy filling with chunks of chocolate, sprinkled with pistachio. We traded bites. The baba had a good fruity sauce but I think the cake was a tad dry.
So lose 1/2 star for cake, also because prix fixe menu on web site but they had discontinued it. Need to update web site to say so.

excerpts: and I had the Gnocchi and Risotto.
They both were a palates dream.
The Gnocchi is the dish they are best known for, at least based on recommendations and reviews.
Our entire group was impressed by the food, wine, and desserts.
If ever in San Francisco again I will gladly return to this restauraunt.
My apologies to the owner and he will know why.
risotto.author: Lisa M.
risotto.review: This was recommended to us and it was a great recommendation.  We made reservations and went as a group of six and had a great time.  The food was delicious.  We were served by the owner (I believe) and he was quite helpful in answering our questions, although a bit curt. We started with the Bruschetta, which was excellent. Moving on to the meal, my husband and I had the Gnocchi and Risotto.  They both were a palates dream. The Gnocchi is the dish they are best known for, at least based on recommendations and reviews. Our entire group was impressed by the food, wine, and desserts.  If ever in San Francisco again I will gladly return to this restauraunt. My apologies to the owner and he will know why.

excerpts: The pan sheared scollop with risotto is definitely my fav.
The rice was extremely flavorful and soaked in scollop sauce, and both the flavor and the texture of the scollops are amazing.
I also liked their mussels and clams in spicy tomato broth, corn and leek soup topped with chopped spicy shrimp, and risotto with clam and lobster basque sauce.
I also remember trying ahi tuna and smoked salmon appetizer, but it isn't as good.
risotto.author: Cate L.
risotto.review: Would put a 3.5 star if I could. Went there twice with friends. As expected, the portions are pretty small, but the quality isn't bad for a $$ French restaurant. The pan sheared scollop with risotto is definitely my fav. The rice was extremely flavorful and soaked in scollop sauce, and both the flavor and the texture of the scollops are amazing. I also liked their mussels and clams in spicy tomato broth, corn and leek soup topped with chopped spicy shrimp, and risotto with clam and lobster basque sauce. I also remember trying ahi tuna and smoked salmon appetizer, but it isn't as good.

excerpts: I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto.
I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.
The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.
risotto.author: Amy W.
risotto.review:
This was a holiday team dinner destination.  This place does seem to do a lot of these even though the space was pretty small. There were 12 of us - but another company had the entire downstairs 3-4 large tables and maybe 30-40 people.

We had a long table and it was hard to hear anyone other than those directly across or next to you.  Bread was served and would have been great warm, but was elevated by a lovey green olive/olive oil tapenade sort of dipping sauce.

There were four appetizers served "family style" (not sure if they were pre-ordered by the organizer of the dinner or what - but sadly 3 of the 4 of them served were fish - so I did not partake (as I recall 3 of them: octopus, ahi tuna and grapefruit, a bruschetta + one more I don't remember).

I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto. I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.  The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.

I doubt I would go there on my own just b/c I hate the way all the Belden Alley hostess try and talk you into going there whenever you walk by, it just feels like the cheesy parts of Paris and Rome where they try and lure the tourists...but if I was trying to figure out a place to get 20 co-workers to dinner I might consider it.

Oh and there is no bar - so if you get there before everyone else you can either wait at the table and look like a loser, or wait outside (and look like a loser).

excerpts: I love the creamy risotto that was provided with the meal!
risotto.author: Tiffany D.
risotto.review:
Fabulous atmosphere with the restaurant being located in the alley, cushioned right in between other restaurants and having glowing lights hung around the exterior of this place!  Sounds dreamy?  Indeed, it is!

D E C O R - The decor of this place has a Roman touch to it and romantic dining arrangements!  Dine outdoors when the weather forbids!

S E R V I C E - You will be assisted by a hostess upfront and be served by attentive waiters and waitresses throughout your meal courses!

I T A L I A N  F O O D - I loved every dish I tried!  What I HIGHLY RECOMMEND as an opening appetizer is to customize your order by combining their MUSSELS AND CLAMS together in spicy tomato broth!  Having the scrumptious spicy tomato broth to compliment the mussels and clams, the three way combo was tantalizing to my taste buds!!  It was super delicious and when everyone finished eating the mussels and clams, I drank the remaining spicy tomato broth! YUM!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ

O R D E R E D  D I S H E S - 
BRUSCHETTA - Crunchy bread.  Topped with crab meat and diced up, marinated in olive oil, tomatoes, the bruschetta was good.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#UUPXZyoqurkXUkYf9syCeQ

ROASTED SADDLE OF LAMB - The most expensive dish on the menu!  Splurged, but it was surely worth every bite!  The balsamic vinegar with the sage spice flavored around and on the nicely cooked lamb meat, was incredible!

NEW YORK STEAK - Tender and cooked exactly on point!  They could improve on those stringy, thin fries that were topped on the steak, however.  The fries lacked volume and specialty. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#zoTqIB5KPnTdv-amZVrMgA

SEAFOOD MIXED GRILL - The name of the entree is misleading.  The seafood is just salmon!  I like the presentation of this dish - not only was it artsy, but it looked fun!  The capers went well with the salmon!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#9cePDws2M2RgWJCnW_GAXg

VEAL SCALOPPINI - The white wine sauce complimented the mushrooms and veal very nicely.  I love the creamy risotto that was provided with the meal!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#dOPKUbjX08TXy4uDVVZANQ

DESSERT SAMPLERS - There is always room for dessert after a grand meal!  DO GET their dessert samplers because it is basically all the Italian desserts they offer that is combined into petite, delectable portions!  I enjoyed the display and a mini bite of each dessert!  I assumed that their tiramisu will be the best of all the desserts just because the restaurant is named Cafe Tiramisu.  It was not the best tiramisu I have ever had and not the best of all the desserts they provided.  My most favorite dessert, was their ice cream with a cup that was made out of hardened caramel!  It was unique, refreshing and savory!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#nOkzDCEROTQTtEcDeZrRYA

F I N A L  S A Y - A great, low-key restaurant if you are wanting to shy away from the crowd and to enjoy a hint of Italian charm!

excerpts: I ordered the scallops appetizer served over a butternut squash and risotto and a side of spinach florentine.
The spinach was wonderful served with raisins and onions....
superb.
The scallops were good
however my expectations were that the sauce would have a sweeter taste with the butternut squash sauce
but I really could not taste the squash at all.
risotto.author: Lori M.
risotto.review:
Visited here for a late night dinner after touring San Francisco and it was a pleasant dinner.  We had a wonderful waiter who was on top of everything!

I was only eating small plates because of the hour.  I ordered the scallops appetizer served over a butternut squash and risotto and a side of spinach florentine.  The spinach was wonderful served with raisins and onions....superb.  The scallops were good however my expectations were that the sauce would have a sweeter taste with the butternut squash sauce but I really could not taste the squash at all.  They were still delicious!

My son who is so picky at 13 could not find anything that he wanted to eat, but my hubby and the waiter were able to create a spaghetti and veal meatball dish, that he loved!

Hubby had the short rib ravioli, he liked it but said he would not order it again, just something about the taste.

It is located in the financial district in this cool alley with other restaurants.  They featured outside seating but we chose to eat inside.  The place has a great authentic Italian feel, and I cannot say enough about our waiter and his service.

The only thing minor thing I would add is the menu was kind of limited in choices.  I definitely would go back to try some other dishes.

excerpts:
I ordered:

-Grilled Octopus: over avocado, celery and salmoriglio sauce
-Petrale Sole Dore Picatta: with jalapeño, prawns and green pea risotto

Shared the octopus with several people.
risotto.author: Garett T.
risotto.review:
After a friend's birthday party of Napa wine tasting, we came back to The City looking for somewhere to eat dinner. Café Tiramisu ended up being that place.

We were seated outside in their lit alleyway patio, heated. The decor was reminiscent of Ancient Rome, especially if you entered the restaurant to go downstairs to the restroom -- all of the walls and murals looked exactly like that.

On with the food! I ordered:

-Grilled Octopus: over avocado, celery and salmoriglio sauce
-Petrale Sole Dore Picatta: with jalapeño, prawns and green pea risotto

Shared the octopus with several people. Was very complacent with it -- soft texture on this dish means everything. When my main dish with Petrale Sole arrived, it was fantastic, savory with decent spicy flair.

While a tad touristy (again, the "Roman" walls...), the service and food were both great. Those two elements alone would bring me back. Not even going to mention our dessert!

excerpts: We split the scallop appetizer over risotto and that is what I'm getting for my dinner tonight along with a salad.
risotto.author: Becky A.
risotto.review:
We loved this restaurant and are going back again tonight!  My mom says the gnocchi is the best she ever had!  

The bread and olive tapenade oil is DELICIOUS - if you love olives!  

The owner was walking around making sure all were happy. It was a beautiful night and we sat outside. This place is in with 6 others restaurants all side by side. 

We ate at Plough the night before but were happier with this place!  

We split the scallop appetizer over risotto and that is what I'm getting for my dinner tonight along with a salad. Double yum!

No drinks or dessert for us. I got the farfalle pasta with bolognese. Good but I want the scallops all to myself tonight.

excerpts: Risotto with shrimps ($21) was pretty good.
First time having risotto.
risotto.author: Crystal H.
risotto.review:
We decided to have dinner here for NYE. Small cozy place. We had reservations for 5:30. It was too busy, like only 4 other tables were taken near us. They had inside and outside seating but it was kind of cold for us to be sitting outside. 

We started out with a glass of prosecco each for $10. Yum. Complimentary bread was cold, but i guess that is how they want us to eat it. The oil dip was 

Food:
Risotto with shrimps ($21) was pretty good. First time having risotto. It was creamy and it was hot pretty much the whole time I was eating. 

Braised pork ravioli ($19 ) was tender and really flavorful. A lot of cheese and creamy sauce. 

Kind of expensive, but good portion for me. Music was playing in the background and it wasn't too loud with the people around us.

Service was fine. Pretty attentive to us. Our waiter even put our napkins on our lap for us. He refilled our water, asked us if our food was good, and if we wanted more prosecco.

excerpts: Most of my co-workers got the ravioli and risotto and they were all pretty happy with the entrees.
We didn't have any appetizers or desserts but the entrees were delicious and I'd definitely be back.
risotto.author: Varun K.
risotto.review: A lot of people are complaining about the service but we had a pretty good experience here. Came here for lunch last week and we were a group of about 10. We were seated pretty quickly, got our complimentary bread (which was cold and dry) and didn't have to wait too long to order. I had the shellfish linguini and it was phenomenal!! I would highly recommend it. Most of my co-workers got the ravioli and risotto and they were all pretty happy with the entrees. We didn't have any appetizers or desserts but the entrees were delicious and I'd definitely be back.

excerpts:
Good
Fish with spicy shrimp risotto
: It tasted like the fish you got from Costco
frozen section.
Black Pepper Hanger Steak:
Gosh!
It was a bomb.
The steak was so juicy and tender.
Gelato: I love the presentation.
It was good too.
risotto.author: J L.
risotto.review:
We came during the SF Restaurants Week. At the beginning, the hostess tried to seat us at the basement. Gosh! It smelled so bad down there. So, when you make a reservation, make sure you tell them not to seat you in the basement. 

We had the $25 pre-set menu. 

Salad: Just OK
Soup: Good
Fish with spicy shrimp risotto: It tasted like the fish you got from Costco frozen section. 
Black Pepper Hanger Steak: Gosh! It was a bomb. The steak was so juicy and tender. 
Gelato: I love the presentation. It was good too.

excerpts: We ordered the calamari, spaghetti with crab, and mushroom risotto, all to share.
When the calimari came out it did not look like your usual fried calamari, we were super confused.
But then we ate it.
Wow!
This was the best calamari I have ever had.
It felt lighter since it was not fried but was bursting with flavor.
The plate included potatoes and thinly sliced cucumbers and a vinaigrette drizzle, my mouth is literally watering thinking about it.
The mushroom risotto with ahi tuna was heaven on a plate.
We both said "mmm" on first bite.
I never choose risotto over pasta, but I am so glad we did here.
For all your mushroom lovers, this will hit the spot.
risotto.author: Zahra K.
risotto.review:
In actuality, I give this place a 3.3-3.5, but yelp doesn't accommodate shades of grey!! :)

Anywho, I discovered Belden place when my best friend and I decided to have dinner in the city to catch up. We were both in the mood for pasta, so after walking up and down the street, we chose Cafe Tiramisu. 

I am happy with our decision and would go again and also recommend this place to my friends. Although I work in North Beach where italian is king, this place held its own. 

We ordered the calamari, spaghetti with crab, and mushroom risotto, all to share. When the calimari came out it did not look like your usual fried calamari, we were super confused. But then we ate it. Wow! This was the best calamari I have ever had. It felt lighter since it was not fried but was bursting with flavor. The plate included potatoes and thinly sliced cucumbers and a vinaigrette drizzle, my mouth is literally watering thinking about it. Please do yourself a favor and order this. 

The spaghetti with crab with good, not great. The spaghetti was nice and light, not overly sauced at all. But didn't have the kick of flavor I wanted. The crab was also good. I think if these are the flavors you are in the mood for, it is a tasty dish. Note on the service here -  our waiter was awesome. Very friendly and attentive but not overbearing. We asked him to please break the crab for us (don't judge me) and he graciously did so with a laugh. 

The mushroom risotto with ahi tuna was heaven on a plate. We both said "mmm" on first bite. I never choose risotto over pasta, but I am so glad we did here. For all your mushroom lovers, this will hit the spot. The ahi tuna was also wonderful and went really well with the rest of the ingredients. 

All and all, I am looking forward to trying this place again. I did not check out the inside or the bar. The outside isn't the prettiest/fanciest but it was nice nonetheless. The whole vibe of Belden Place made it a really cute dinner spot.

excerpts: for mains Also had the sole with crab and jalepeno risotto...
Solid... and maple glazed Pork Chop!
Man what a meal.
Eating here 20 years, finally reviewing it and going to eat here again the next time I'm in the City.
Didn't think this should be less than 4 Stars on Yelp and had to give my opinion!
risotto.author: Sean J.
risotto.review: San Francisco is one of the world leaders in food... We come up from the lower part of the state to enjoy the most inventive consistent trends with food in the City ... But sometimes you just need a place that is familiar. We stopped back in to our favorite hole in the wall place for some solid Italian. We love the clams in tomato broth, the bruschetta, the carpociao, the burrata, just to start... All of them perfect. It reminds me of Italy... Good solid high end ingredients in their simple form. for mains Also had the sole with crab and jalepeno risotto... Solid... and maple glazed Pork Chop! Man what a meal. Eating here 20 years, finally reviewing it and going to eat here again the next time I'm in the City. Didn't think this should be less than 4 Stars on Yelp and had to give my opinion!

excerpts: I then placed my order and started with a soup followed by the Black Ink Risotto.
The Black Ink Risotto was nicely plated and looked very nice.
The scallops were very well prepared
and I was able to cut them very easily with the edge of my fork.
As for the black ink risotto itself...
Meh...
It was ok.
risotto.author: David O.
risotto.review:
Just grabbed a quick lunch here.  I was planning to eat Sushi at Akiko's but there was a 30 minute wait so I walked down to Belden Place and decided to try something new.

I sat inside and ordered some water and a glass of Merlot.   At $14, I would have expected a better quality wine.   I then placed my order and started with a soup followed by the Black Ink Risotto.

The soup was a big fat disappointment and all I could taste was the overpowering flavor of tomato, an ingredient that I don't even recall seeing on the menu.   There was some crab meat thrown in for good measure, so at least they made good on that promise.

The Black Ink Risotto was nicely plated and looked very nice.   The scallops were very well prepared and I was able to cut them very easily with the edge of my fork.   As for the black ink risotto itself... Meh... It was ok.   Then again, I really couldn't ask for too much more considering it was a $12 dish.

I probably need to give these guys another try...  I certainly wasn't blown away with my lunch here, but I think they deserve another shot.   Until then, 3 stars it is.

excerpts: I had the veal scallopini on a bed of spinach with a side of parmesan risotto.
The veal was fork tender and very flavorful - risotto was average.
Overall, an enjoyable meal.
risotto.author: Jim M.
risotto.review: Nice little hideaway near Chinatown.  Bread served with pesto is a plus.  I had the veal scallopini on a bed of spinach with a side of parmesan risotto.  The veal was fork tender and very flavorful - risotto was average.  Overall, an enjoyable meal.

excerpts: I had the saffron risotto w/ prawns which was delish, but light.
risotto.author: Cat G.
risotto.review:
Came here for dinner last night on a whim. It's a hidden gem within an alley way of several restaurants and it was great. I was with two friends and the weather wasn't too chilly so we were able to eat on the patio under a heater without jackets. Perfect. 

My two dates ;) jk had the new york peppered steak, with potatoes and some sort of delicious spinach side. I had the saffron risotto w/ prawns which was delish, but light. The gentleman was some sort of manager there and was super nice and took the time to chit chat with us for a while which was really pleasant. 

For (6) beers, (1) appetizer and (3) entrees, the bill was $158, not bad for the amount of food and quality of the food. Definitely a place to try if you're looking to try an upscale but not too upscale italian spot in SF.

excerpts: Risotto with Scallops and Chantrelle Mushrooms was very creamy and tasty.
Scallops were cooked perfectly.
risotto.author: Hector G.
risotto.review:
Beldon Place is such an awesome little gem. I love it more and more each time I visit.

What I am not familiar with is the host/hostess nearly begging you to eat at their restaurant. I still haven't gotten used to it. It's kinda like homeless dude begging you for a dollar, but wearing high heels and a skirt. 

Anyway, we made our way to this spot simply based on the fact that nobody was outside begging and I am so glad we did.

Food was excellent. 

Risotto with Scallops and Chantrelle Mushrooms was very creamy and tasty. Scallops were cooked perfectly. Seared on the outside and tender on the inside. 

Paparedelle with Boar Ragu was delicious! Very tasty, well seasoned and the sauce and pasta were perfectly happy together.  

Service was off the charts. Our waiter, Dario, was very professional, didn't bother us too much and was very kind. We showed up just before closing and he didn't give us the "come on you fockers, it's time to go home" routine that truly makes me anxious. Service is key in this area b/c there are so many good options that I tend to focus on the service. So glad to see waiters busting ass and doing good work. 

I would definitely come back for another visit, which is the ultimate compliment from a diner. Enjoy!

excerpts: Didn't enjoy the salad or the risotto, halibut was good other than the prosciutto crust.
risotto.author: Maggie M.
risotto.review:
Eccentric menu for an Italian restaurant. Cute alley location. We went there on NYE and I couldn't help but order the pre-set menu. Way overpriced for what you received. Didn't enjoy the salad or the risotto, halibut was good other than the prosciutto crust. Pistachio panna cotta was delicious.

Our waiter was sweet but the other waiter in the area complained within earshot.

If I ever returned I'd get dessert here but that's it.

excerpts: When we arrived, the owner greeted us and had the chef whip up a plain cheese risotto for them.
I had the pesto risotto with shrimp.
It was the best risotto I ever had
and I'm sure I'll be thinking about it for a long time.
Good service and very charming location in an alley way full of cafes and light with Christmas lights.
risotto.author: Brianne M.
risotto.review: My kids were craving risotto- I phone the restaurant to ensure they had it. When we arrived, the owner greeted us and had the chef whip up a plain cheese risotto for them. I had the pesto risotto with shrimp. It was the best risotto I ever had and I'm sure I'll be thinking about it for a long time. Good service and very charming location in an alley way full of cafes and light with Christmas lights.

excerpts: For my main dish I got the risotto with prawns.
I ate every single bite.
The only thing I took a bite of and didn't really care for was the gnocchi.
risotto.author: Emily J.
risotto.review:
This restaurant successfully pleased a bride-to-be and 17 of her closest girlfriends.  Cafe Tiramisu FTW!

Upon arrival, I felt like I was walking down an alley in a small European city and this set the stage for a wonderful meal.  We had the "private" dining room downstairs.  I put private in quotes because the room is also the pathway to the bathrooms.  This was great for us since we then only had to maneuver ourselves down and back up the staircase in our 3 - 5 inch heels once.  I just hope that all the people who had to travel past our group to the restroom weren't too appalled by our behavior.  Most of them seemed amused at least.  

The food and drinks were delicious.  A friend got a glass of wine that had obviously gone bad and the waiter took it back no problem.  They didn't charge us a corkage fee on the champagne we brought because most everyone in our group ordered a drink.  The bread and pesto dip were the perfect start to the meal.  I stole bites of the prosciutto and fig appetizer and the bruschetta. Both were flavorful and perfectly balanced.  For my main dish I got the risotto with prawns.  I ate every single bite.  The only thing I took a bite of and didn't really care for was the gnocchi.  The gnocchi itself was prepared perfectly but the sauce had a weird smokey, spicy flavor that I couldn't quite put my finger on or enjoy.  

Our waiter was patient and had a great sense of humor.  The other staff were also helpful and all smiles.  

I plan to bring my honey here.  The outside seating area would be lovely for a date night with my love.

excerpts:
Favorites:
Black Ink Risotto with Scallops and lobster bisque= DIVINE!
I wanted to consume every last drop.
risotto.author: Susan C.
risotto.review:
Gotta love not paying for fine dining ^_^

Step 1: Drive around trying to find this fine dining food alley in SF by taking all the wrong one way streets.
Step 2: Walk into the restaurant with the most people trying to get in, assuming it is the French place that was recommended by concierge at the hotel.
Step 3:  Everything is amazing, our waiter Tony was a bit overwhelmed at first but was excellent once things died down a bit.  He had EXCELLENT wine parings, a dry and witty sense of humor that made our experience homey rather than stuffy.
Step 4: Realize you are definitely not in the restaurant you thought you were because they are so tightly packed together; walk over to the one you wanted to go to originally; and realize that you had a much better time and menu where fate took you rather than your brain.

Favorites:
Black Ink Risotto with Scallops and lobster bisque= DIVINE! I wanted to consume every last drop.  It was perfectly balanced, scallops were cooked perfectly, and it flowed together in my mouth in a happy seafood-gasm.

Zucchini Blossoms stuffed with ricotta with tomato sauce=The blossoms were stuffed, then perfectly deep fried. Not greasy at all, just perfectly crunchy and flavorful.

Sea Bass on Polenta and shell fish= Seafood heaven!  I got steamed muscles and clams, perfect sea bass on perfect polenta with the perfect tomato and mushroom sauce.  It was fantastic.  (Daily special, local and sustainable)

Rack of Lamb=Cooked perfectly with rosemary, gravy, potato and spinach.  Ordered rare, it came out perfectly.  Generous portions.  (Also picked daily, local, and sustainable)

A lot of love is put into this food.  And for being casually upscale, you get generous potions so you leave feeling nice and full.

Sometimes the best plans are the ones you didn't plan!

excerpts: My friend had the risotto and had a similar reaction to her dish.
risotto.author: Joëlle M.
risotto.review:
I've been here twice, and both times it's been just ok.  A friend and I cruised down Belden checking out all the menus in the alleyway, and ended up deciding that we were in the mood for Italian.  It had been 18 months since my first time, so I figured Café Tiramisu deserved a second chance.

My reaction?  Meh.

The sweet potato and mushroom ravioli just wasn't as good as it should be, not with ingredients like that.  I wanted to like it SO much, and was just totally indifferent.  Even with added salt, it just didn't have the flavors it should.  My friend had the risotto and had a similar reaction to her dish.  Our food came out so quickly after we'd ordered it that we almost wondered if it had been pre-prepared.

In any case, this place is fine.  I'd go here again in a pinch.  But don't expect to be wowed.

excerpts: I ordered the black ink risotto while my friend ordered the beef short ribs.
risotto.author: Dani D.
risotto.review:
Food : A solid four stars
Service : Two stars

The food here was absolutely delicious. I ordered the black ink risotto while my friend ordered the beef short ribs. Both were tasty.

We chose Cafe Tiramisu because of the friendly hostess and the intriguing specials. However, our waiter seemed to resent having to come outside to serve us (we were by no means the only party sitting outside) and his timing was awful. It took forever to get our drinks (they arrived immediately before the food). For the price, I would have expected better service from the waitstaff.

excerpts: My friend enjoyed the New York steak while I was very impressed with the seafood risotto.
Light fluffy bed of rice covered with a tangy sauce and delicious crab meat garnished with jumbo shrimp.
Our server, Frank was excellent and we loved the outdoor atmosphere.
Thanks Zoe, appreciate your drawing us in.
When I have time, I shall return for the Tiramisu.
risotto.author: M...I Love This Place S.
risotto.review:
Went for lunch with a friend today. I was not sure if it was Zoe's charming way or her eyes that drew us in, but we were glad we did. My friend enjoyed the New York steak while I was very impressed with the seafood risotto. Light fluffy bed of rice covered with a tangy sauce and delicious crab meat garnished with jumbo shrimp.
Our server, Frank was excellent and we loved the outdoor atmosphere. Thanks Zoe, appreciate your drawing us in. When I have time, I shall return for the Tiramisu.

excerpts: YUM -- the risotto here is absolutely delicious.
The prices are a little heavy for a quick lunch at work but there are some salad/side options you can do to mix it up.
That seared scallop on top of the risotto was also the tops.
YUM.
risotto.author: Mel G.
risotto.review: YUM -- the risotto here is absolutely delicious. The prices are a little heavy for a quick lunch at work but there are some salad/side options you can do to mix it up. That seared scallop on top of the risotto was also the tops.  YUM.

excerpts: We ordered several different appetizers to share - ahi tuna carpaccio, beef carpaccio, black ink risotto, calamari, fresh oysters, and a salad.
The black ink risotto was the best appetizer out of what I listed.
risotto.author: Sandy L.
risotto.review:
I would give 3 stars for the food and location, but the service level makes it 2 stars!  I came here last night for a friend's birthday dinner.  We ordered several different appetizers to share - ahi tuna carpaccio, beef carpaccio, black ink risotto, calamari, fresh oysters, and a salad.  The black ink risotto was the best appetizer out of what I listed.  For my entree, I had the Rack of Lamb and that was pretty good - not the best, but good.

The service was so SLOW...luckily, we were a group of 8 girls so we had a lot to talk about to kill time.  Also, the server we had just didn't really care...his attitude sucked!  I would much rather go to Plouf, Sauce, and other places on Belden Place!  Ugh...

excerpts: The risotto was fantastic, lots of spices and a ton of flavor throughout.
The ravioli was OK, a very good flavor
risotto.author: Joshua B.
risotto.review:
Five years and Cafe Tiramisu hasn't changed at all, right down to the same man waiting on us both times. Man, that's amazing, really brought some memories back. It was a quiet evening when we strolled in here off of the glitz of Van Ness, so service was definitely up to par; while it's definitely priced like a tourist trap, I had to see if they were still there.

Bruschetta was classic and tasty, and the basic bread was delicious. The oysters were fresh, of course, and the Caesar salad was decent but not the best we've had. The risotto was fantastic, lots of spices and a ton of flavor throughout. The ravioli was OK, a very good flavor but _very_ small portions.

The only issue we had was when we ordered one of the less expensive bottles of wine, and the one brought out was the same but an earlier year, thus nearly twice as expensive when the bill came. We never even saw the other year on the menu, but he brought it back and sure enough it was at the very bottom; given how quickly it was taken care of, I sort of wonder if they pull this to fleece inattentive tourists out of a few extra bucks.

excerpts: For entrees, we ordered the salmon, black ink linguini with ahi, and mushroom risotto.
The salmon was well seasoned and over grilled asparagus.
It was a basic dish, but well prepared.
The black ink linguini was very creative and something I had never had before.
The ahi is supposed to be seared, but I have never been a fan of seared fish, so
I requested that it be well done.
They had no problem customizing the dish for me.
There is not a lot of flavor in the pasta itself other than a lot of olive oil with some tomato....a little plain but still delicious.
As for the mushroom risotto, I was really impressed with the mushroom flavoring - a lot of places make the mushroom flavor too strong and I get tired of it after a few bites.
risotto.author: Naomi P.
risotto.review:
Came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised.  I love it's location in the FiDi - we went on a sunny day and sat outdoors (I didn't even go inside so no idea what it's like in there).  Good mix of working professionals and lucky people who did not have to work that day.  Very European style outdoor seating with flower pots and large umbrellas.  Pleasant waiters and hosts to serve us.  Bread is served with olive paste at the start.  The bread was nothing special....save your appetite for the appetizers and entrees!

First, we ordered the caesar salad (freshly baked croutons and tasty dressing) and bruschetta to start.  The bruschetta has anchovies which I was not fond of, so I picked them off.  Otherwise, it was very tasty.  

For entrees, we ordered the salmon, black ink linguini with ahi, and mushroom risotto.  The salmon was well seasoned and over grilled asparagus.  It was a basic dish, but well prepared.  The black ink linguini was very creative and something I had never had before.  The ahi is supposed to be seared, but I have never been a fan of seared fish, so I requested that it be well done.  They had no problem customizing the dish for me.  There is not a lot of flavor in the pasta itself other than a lot of olive oil with some tomato....a little plain but still delicious.  As for the mushroom risotto, I was really impressed with the mushroom flavoring - a lot of places make the mushroom flavor too strong and I get tired of it after a few bites.  However, this was really delicious and I almost wished I had ordered it instead of the linguini.  

As for the portions, the dishes look small but they are very filling.  I found myself slowing down towards the end, but we were all able to finish the entrees.  The dishes were all fulfilling but light....none of us suffered from food coma and were able to be productive at work after :)

excerpts: I ordered the grilled sardines and the squid ink risotto with scallops.
WOW!
Both dishes were sooooo good.
I tried to write the sardine recipe down
so I could attempt to replicate when I get home.
risotto.author: Food D.
risotto.review:
It was late on a tuesday night and i was looking for a place to eat near my hotel. A lot of places were closing. I stumbled across this ally with a bunch of restaurants in it. I checked all the menues of the restaurants in the alley and settled on Tiramisu. I was a little scared because it felt a little like a touristy restaurant with over priced bad food. I went in anyway because the menu items sounded the best. 

I ordered 2 appetizers instead of an entree because I wanted to try more than one dish. I ordered the grilled sardines and the squid ink risotto with scallops. WOW! Both dishes were sooooo good. I tried to write the sardine recipe down so I could attempt to replicate when I get home. I don't cook a lot with squid ink so that one is probably out. 

Are the prices a little high? Not really for the area I would guess. I thought the dishes I ordered were worth what I paid. The service started out a little gruff but warmed up as the meal progressed. It wasn't a deal breaker though. I would go back in a heartbeat.

excerpts: Ordered caprese salad, lobster risotto, bruschetta, and a bunch of other dishes to share.
My goodness the food was delicious.
Service was ok.
risotto.author: Hanna Y.
risotto.review:
Made 11 person reservation over the phone, headed over, seated immediately, food arrived timely, service was decent.  Ordered caprese salad, lobster risotto, bruschetta, and a bunch of other dishes to share.  My goodness the food was delicious. Service was ok.  Took them a long time to bring out check.

It was 2 weeks ago so I don't remember everything but I don't remember the place being a memorable experience either.  Thus just 4 stars. 

Update: I realized i made it sound like it was so amazing so I'm giving it 5 stars. But it's really 4.5 now that I remember that the service was not fast enough. (Which I updated above).

excerpts: Not only that but the food is also amazing, I ordered the Sea Food Mixed Grill and I can tell that the dish is fantastic - the spinach risotto by itself was the best I ever had!!!!!
risotto.author: Vivian M.
risotto.review:
I went to Cafe Tiramisu last Saturday to celebrate my bday with my closest girls! We sat outside and it was great to enjoy the mixture of that little French/Italian alley scene!!! Not only that but the food is also amazing, I ordered the Sea Food Mixed Grill and I can tell that the dish is fantastic - the spinach risotto by itself was the best I ever had!!!!!

Btw, great place to suggest a guy to take you out on a date lol

excerpts: The asparagus and crab Risotto with delicious, but the seared Ahi tuna was overcooked.
A very common but novice mistake.
The doughnuts filled with Italian custard dessert was pretty sweet, although the sauce was a nice dark chocolate.
risotto.author: Bushra S.
risotto.review:
This cute Italian place with outdoor seating on Belden place, evokes memories of old school Italian restaurants from NYC little Italy... except the food is twice as expensive (well it is San Francisco) and about half as tasty. On the positive side, it is a lot less touristy. 

The wine list is extensive, but their selections for the per glass and half bottles are a little dated. The asparagus and crab Risotto with delicious, but the seared Ahi tuna was overcooked. A very common but novice mistake. The doughnuts filled with Italian custard dessert was pretty sweet, although the sauce was a nice dark chocolate. But personally I think, Bearded Papa is worth the calories a lot more than the ones at Cafe Tiramisu! 

Friends who were from out of town loved it. Great atmosphere, good food, friendly and attentive service. I will be back, but not when I'm the mood for great food.

excerpts: Black ink risotto & angolotti were delicious.
The service was nice and the atmosphere was very pleasant and unique.
risotto.author: Michael D.
risotto.review: Tasty, authentic Italian seafood. Black ink risotto & angolotti were delicious.  The service was nice and the atmosphere was very pleasant and unique.

excerpts: I ordered the seared ahi which was excellent along with a spicy vegetable risotto that came with it.
My friends had the pork chop and salmon which I also liked.
We ordered a half bottle Mondavi merlot from our waiter but after a few sips, we found out he gave us a Cab...what the f----?
At that point, whatever, the wine was fine.
Despite the wine cock-up, our waiter tried his best to serve us...although the seating arrangement made it hard to talk to him.
For dessert, we got the panna cotta with the fresh fruit.
risotto.author: Ben H L.
risotto.review:
Came here for the first time during Friday night dinner hours.  My awesome two friends were treating me for my birthday and I had never been to the Belden Place alley before.  All the tables were lined up next to each other outside...restaurant to restaurant with people packed in like sardines.  When we sat down, I literally could hear four conversations around me from adjoining tables since we and most people who sat outside had to raise our voice to be heard.  

Well onto the food.  I ordered the seared ahi which was excellent along with a spicy vegetable risotto that came with it.  My friends had the pork chop and salmon which I also liked.  We ordered a half bottle Mondavi merlot from our waiter but after a few sips, we found out he gave us a Cab...what the f----?  At that point, whatever, the wine was fine.  Despite the wine cock-up, our waiter tried his best to serve us...although the seating arrangement made it hard to talk to him.  For dessert, we got the panna cotta with the fresh fruit.  I liked it and how it was their lightest dessert compared to their biscotti, chocolate cake, or creme brulee options.  

I'd definitely come here again but perhaps during a less crowded lunch service or an early dinner.  There are like five other restaurants on the Belden Row, so I'd probably head to see those first before I try Tiramisu again.

excerpts: I tried the risotto with a pumpkin sauce..
creamy, butter with a hint of truffle oil..
risotto.author: Monica S.
risotto.review:
I totally forgot about my last review.. haha that happens.. 

Well I came back to Tiramisu for a business meeting. The food was actually pretty yummy. I tried the risotto with a pumpkin sauce.. creamy, butter with a hint of truffle oil.. mmmmm

I'll come back for more..

excerpts: We tried the Black Ink Risotto.
I highly recommend this appetizer!
I was a little bit put off because the word black ink, but I mainly tasted a great blend of the lobster bisque.
Perfect blend of creaminess and so flavorful.
I ordered the Dungeness Crab Agnolotti.
They do not skimp out on the crab!!
They make their own pasta here and you can definitely tell the difference.
I'm actually not a big fan of Italian because usually places usually overload it with sauce and cheese but this place is not that.
Extremely well made food and the ambiance is just warm and loving.
And I didn't even drink wine!!
I definitely recommend this place.
risotto.author: Tammy N.
risotto.review: I'm so glad I tried this place.  It's down the cute Belden Alley.  Service was great from start to finish.  We tried the Black Ink Risotto.  I highly recommend this appetizer!  I was a little bit put off because the word black ink, but I mainly tasted a great blend of the lobster bisque.  Perfect blend of creaminess and so flavorful.  I ordered the Dungeness Crab Agnolotti.  They do not skimp out on the crab!!  They make their own pasta here and you can definitely tell the difference.  I'm actually not a big fan of Italian because usually places usually overload it with sauce and cheese but this place is not that.  Extremely well made food and the ambiance is just warm and loving.  And I didn't even drink wine!!  I definitely recommend this place.

excerpts: The big hits for our party of 15 were the hangar steak, seared ahi tuna with shrimp risotto, the rotisserie chicken and the pan roasted salmon.
risotto.author: Helen Y.
risotto.review:
I love eating on Belden Pl. Today we came here for one of my co-worker's going away lunch. Unfortunately our party was too large to be seated outdoors but we had the entire downstairs area to ourselves.

The bread is yummy -- especially the pesto based olive oil.

The big hits for our party of 15 were the hangar steak, seared ahi tuna with shrimp risotto, the rotisserie chicken and the pan roasted salmon.

excerpts: Black Ink Risotto with pan seared scallop and lobster bisque.
Sounds like three dishes, doesn't it?
Ah, but it's all one deliciously delightful dish.
The lobster bisque is very thick and served more as a sauce.
It's wonderful.
risotto.author: Denise M.
risotto.review:
Black Ink Risotto with pan seared scallop and lobster bisque.  Sounds like three dishes, doesn't it?  Ah, but it's all one deliciously delightful dish.   The lobster bisque is very thick and served more as a sauce.  
It's wonderful.  Simply wonderful.

Had the short ribs for my entree.  So good!  Fall off the bone tender, the way short ribs should be.  Hubby had the hanger steak, also perfect.

Sadly, no room for dessert.

excerpts: I got the Black ink risotto with seared scallops.
It was good but not great.
It was a little bit salty to me.
risotto.author: Liza T.
risotto.review:
Café Tiramisu used to be my favorite lunch spot.  Love their outdoor seating, especially when it is sunny and warm.  But based on my last two visits, I think the food was going downhill.  It was not as good as before.  

We started with the Caesar Salad.  The salad was fresh.  The complimentary bread was just so so.  You can save room for something else.  

I got the Black ink risotto with seared scallops.  It was good but not great.  It was a little bit salty to me.  My friend ordered the beef short ribs.  She told me it was just ok.  

My last visit was able a month ago......I got the Sea Bass.  The sea bass was tasteless.  

However, the services were still pretty good there.  Sweet, warm, friendly and efficient.  No complaints on that!

excerpts: I myself had the shrimp & zucchini blossom risotto.
risotto.author: Stephanie D.
risotto.review: Giuseppe, you're amazing & thank you for being the gracious host you were for my buddy's bday/baby shower luncheon.  The food was amazing & I promise to be back for that limoncello.  I'm already plotting my next visit with hopes that the menu isn't changed!!  Everything from beginning to end was delicious.  For starters we had the bruscetta, calamari, oysters, sardines & beet salad.  I would order them ALL and whatever else is on the appetizer menu again.  I myself had the shrimp & zucchini blossom risotto.  Other entrees that blessed our table were pici, gnocci, the grand ole pork chop & veal.  They make all of their pastas in house & it pays off.  As if the meal and service weren't enough.  They sent out a table full of complimentary desserts.  How can you say no to that?  Especially when there's an espresso creme brulee, chocolate torte/cake & cream puffs with ganache staring you down.  Out of the couple of different cute little places in this famous food alley I'd definitely pay my next visit to Cafe Tiramisu & opt for that sunny table outside again.  More pasta please!!!........and my beet salad (a must!)

excerpts: This was where I first tried risotto when I was at Cal
and I was happy that I was able to share this special restaurant with my family.
The risotto dish with seared ahi tuna is the best in town.
Prices very competitive.
Barramundi fish was prepared very well.
Wait staff was nice.
Sauteed spanish complimented the food well.
risotto.author: Captain S.
risotto.review: This was where I first tried risotto when I was at Cal and I was happy that I was able to share this special restaurant with my family. The risotto dish with seared ahi tuna is the best in town. Prices very competitive. Barramundi fish was prepared very well. Wait staff was nice. Sauteed spanish complimented the food well. My child said the short ribs were good, but the mash potatoes were not good according to their opinion (I didn't try this dish). But the fingerling fried potatos were good. You need to go.

excerpts: For dinner, my entree was the risotto with A seared scallop.
My dish was, YUP, you guessed it good, but a bit too salty for my taste.
DH had the wild boar
and I thought it was,
Ummm, yeah,
risotto.author: Karen B.
risotto.review:
Food was good.  Not excellent or memorable, but not dreary or boring either.

DH and I shared the burrata with lobster and that was good.  For dinner, my entree was the risotto with A seared scallop.  My dish was, YUP, you guessed it good, but a bit too salty for my taste.  DH had the wild boar and I thought it was, Ummm, yeah, good; however, he didn't really care for it.

Dessert.  We shared tiramisu.  All I can say is it wasn't that good.  I've had better, much, much better.

Service was "meh."  Our server wasn't very friendly, kinda dry and boring actually.  He wasn't overly attentive, nor was he under attentive.  However, the bus boys were anxious to rid our table of our plates, even with a few bites left.

Overall, perhaps I should give it 2 vs. 3 stars, but things were just okay and good and times, but nothing deserving more or less . .  this place is simply mediocre.

excerpts: Get the black ink risotto with scallops, yum...
risotto.author: Veronica S.
risotto.review:
The place is very small but I was beyond impressed with the variety of dishes they served. All authentic but very particular which are rare in the U.S, I only saw these dishes in Italy.

Get the black ink risotto with scallops, yum...

The waiters also tend to have a sense of humor, especially if you speak Italian

excerpts: I had the risotto and it was very good, but I felt like I was being rushed out of there.
My friend and I felt rushed to order, rushed to eat and rushed to get out.
It's a shame because we wanted to order dessert but were stressed out!
risotto.author: Sandra P.
risotto.review: Extremely limited menu at Cafe Tiramisu. I had the risotto and it was very good, but I felt like I was being rushed out of there.  My friend and I felt rushed to order, rushed to eat and rushed to get out.  It's a shame because we wanted to order dessert but were stressed out!

excerpts: He ordered a side of parmesan risotto just because and that too was wonderful.
Truly one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a while.
risotto.author: Cyndi S.
risotto.review: Tucked away in what appears to be an ally you will find this little treasure of a restaurant. With an Italian feel and menu to match the food is exquisite. Our experience began with oysters with classic mignonette and fresh horseradish. Typically I'm not a fan of horseradish but the way it was served it made it not only tolerable, but enjoyable.  Our main dishes arrived, I ordered the chicken breast. Don't allow the name alone to fool you, the dish was fulfilling and more. The chicken was juicy and the melted cheese and spinach married the flavor of the truffle sauce together wonderfully. The pumpkin gnocchi were a pleasant match with the dish. I took a few fork fulls of my boyfriend's dish (for review purposes of course ;D ) He ordered the striped sea bass filet which came with lobster, mashed potatoes, and saffron sauce-all of course rich and satisfying. He ordered a side of parmesan risotto just because and that too was wonderful. Truly one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a while.

excerpts: My dad had the risotto & my mom had the steak I believe.
I had asparagus ravioli, with asparagus & ricotta filling & fresh asparagus with the pasta.
It was SO delicious.

My dad sad that the place reminded him of a restaurant he visited in 
Geneva so that was cool.
My only complaint is that the women's restroom could be a little better managed.
But go for the food definitely!
risotto.author: Jenna K.
risotto.review:
Delicious food. My foodie parents loved their meals. My dad had the risotto & my mom had the steak I believe.  
I had asparagus ravioli, with asparagus & ricotta filling & fresh asparagus with the pasta.
It was SO delicious. My dad sad that the place reminded him of a restaurant he visited in 
Geneva so that was cool. My only complaint is that the women's restroom could be a little better managed. But go for the food definitely!

excerpts: Risotto with crayfish, shaved black truffles, and Pecorino cheese.
risotto.author: Jenny L.
risotto.review:
Cute, romantic and dimly lit restaurant tucked away in an alley of FiDi.  But you definitely feel like you've stepped into another world once you head inside the restaurant.

Start with the mussels in a choice of either saffron, pesto, or pepperoncini and chive broth.  Go saffron!

Risotto with crayfish, shaved black truffles, and Pecorino cheese.  Yay truffles!

Sea Bass with Tuscan black mussels salad.  Yum sea bass!

And...we had to order the tiramisu for the sake of ordering a tiramisu at Tiramisu.  I admit it's a bit expensive for dessert, but well worth it.

excerpts: I ordered the Risotto which was excellent.
Pesto, summer corn, spicy prawns on top of a lobster bisque drizzle.
risotto.author: Lauren F.
risotto.review:
I'm always looking for good Italian restaurant that aren't in North Beach to try out. This one was actually pretty good!

Tucked away in a little alley off of Kearny, we were greeted by French-speaking hostesses and waiters. Makes the atmosphere feel a little more authentic.

I ordered the Risotto which was excellent. Pesto, summer corn, spicy prawns on top of a lobster bisque drizzle. Delish. 

Did not get to try any of the desserts, but will have to come back to try other dishes!

excerpts: We ordered the zucchini blossom tempura, scallops and risotto for appetizers.
My fiancée liked his scallops
but I was disappointed in the zucchini.
It was a small size and it was lukewarm.
And mind you, there were only 2 other patrons at the time, so I expected the food to be piping hot since none of the staff had much to do but cook, greet, and serve.
The staff was very prompt, however.
Anyway.
risotto.author: M D.
risotto.review: Had a table for 2 at 5pm on a Thursday. They gave us cold, hard bread that was definitely not fresh. We ordered the zucchini blossom tempura, scallops and risotto for appetizers. My fiancée liked his scallops but I was disappointed in the zucchini. It was a small size and it was lukewarm. And mind you, there were only 2 other patrons at the time, so I expected the food to be piping hot since none of the staff had much to do but cook, greet, and serve. The staff was very prompt, however. Anyway. So for entrees, we ordered the ravioli beef short ribs and the grilled hawaiian swordfish. Very, very underwhelming. The swordfish tasted like it was frozen then microwaved for too long. Very bland and dry. No flavor whatsoever. The ravioli was just ok but my fiancée's grandma makes it ten times better. Also the portions were both so small compared to the prices they were set at. Finally, we order a tiramisu. This was the best thing we ate. I mean, it wasn't the best tiramisu I've had but it was the best part of the meal. So all in all, we spent $100 for the whole meal, including tip and, unfortunately, I have to say that it was not worth the money, time, or appetite. Save yourself for some real authentic Italian food in north beach.

excerpts: but I tried the Parmesan Risotto and again I have had better.
So I thought I will try the Tiramisu, terrible.
Again made in house but over espresso-ed and the bitter chocolate powder was just that a bitter addition, the dish wasn't overly sweet that the powder needed to be added.
It was super crowded, why who knows.
I'm no food expert but this experience for me was bad.
And to offend all the foodies out there, Maggianos which is a chain has better food and the atmosphere doesn't need to transport me anywhere except to sheer ecstasy.
Their Tiramisu is wonderful, and you get as much as you want!

Some Yelper posted on her review that an appetizer, 6 beers and 3 or 4 entrees was $ 150.00, for 1 salad 2 entrees 1 prosecco and a coke was close to $ 80.00 and for a 20% tip we left $ 100.00 lighter.
It's kinda upscale, maybe since I was wearing a Giants ball cap nice yoga outfit and tennis shoes and the b.f.
the same we looked like we didn't belong there?
We had been at a football game all day and wanted to eat a nice meal after, we didn't think we need to change!
Wrap Up, wouldn't go back, wouldn't recommend to anyone I like super disappointed and mad at Bay Area Check Please...
risotto.author: RedHighHeels R.
risotto.review:
Went since Check Please Bay Area everyone loved it! Why!!!!!
I know KQED has a lot of foodies, and it's quality t.v. so while in the City I was dying to try this place.  We were greeted by the hostess, the owner was as my bf. said "kind of an ass', didn't get the friendly vibe like on the show.  We were sat at the very back, people have said " They felt as if they were transported to Italy!" Yea it smelled like the Venice canals.  I get it, its an old building but the smell was off putting and gets worse when you go down stairs to use the bathroom or being punished and actually have to sit at the tables down there...  The owner took our order, didn't go over any specials maybe there weren't any?  The menu wasn't that exciting, I wanted to try the homemade pasta and at the recommendation of the owner I ordered the Paperadelle with meat sauce and the bf had Veal Scallopine.  Truthfully nothing sounded all that great.  I ordered a deeelish Prosecco, the waiter brought out with bread, never caught his name.  The bread is made in house, again nothing exciting rolls that should have been served warm I thought and the dipping oil people raved about on this site was forgettable.   I ate a lot of bread since I knew the entree was gonna tank, it did... My dish was paperdalle noodles that were super thin, maybe that's how they are in Italy but I like my pasta with a bit of substance.  The sauce was kinda tasteless except for an overbearing wine taste.  Meeehhh on my food. The bf loooovvveeed his Veal Scaloppine, I don't eat veal but I tried the Parmesan Risotto and again I have had better.  So I thought I will try the Tiramisu, terrible.  Again made in house but over espresso-ed and the bitter chocolate powder was just that a bitter addition, the dish wasn't overly sweet that the powder needed to be added.  It was super crowded, why who knows.  I'm no food expert but this experience for me was bad.  And to offend all the foodies out there, Maggianos which is a chain has better food and the atmosphere doesn't need to transport me anywhere except to sheer ecstasy.  Their Tiramisu is wonderful, and you get as much as you want!  Some Yelper posted on her review that an appetizer, 6 beers and 3 or 4 entrees was $ 150.00, for 1 salad 2 entrees 1 prosecco and a coke was close to $ 80.00 and for a 20% tip we left $ 100.00 lighter.  It's kinda upscale, maybe since I was wearing a Giants ball cap nice yoga outfit and tennis shoes and the b.f. the same we looked like we didn't belong there?  We had been at a football game all day and wanted to eat a nice meal after, we didn't think we need to change!  Wrap Up, wouldn't go back, wouldn't recommend to anyone I like super disappointed and mad at Bay Area Check Please...

excerpts:
ok for area
--Park in a garage or take BART

Scallop black ink risotto is the dish to get here.
risotto.author: Rich H.
risotto.review:
Summary based on several lunches and an occasional dinner over years:
--Generally ok to good food
--Good service
--Seating inside or out is pretty good
--Prices ok for area
--Park in a garage or take BART

Scallop black ink risotto is the dish to get here.  With a lot of wine.

excerpts: Zeeky had the risotto with prawn?
it looked like prawn.

Jeremiah had the rack of lamb which they also came and topped
off with garlic and something else
And I had the stupid capellini, I failed to notice that it said Scallop not Scallops..
risotto.author: phillip w.
risotto.review:
Ok seriously I have to come here again. What I had here just did not make justice for what I saw my co-workers have.

Zeeky had the risotto with prawn? it looked like prawn.
Jeremiah had the rack of lamb which they also came and topped
off with garlic and something else
And I had the stupid capellini, I failed to notice that it said Scallop not Scallops..so I only got one scallop wrapped in pancetta which tasted pretty good.

But anways, Jean also had the same thing and I want to apologize to the people working here for the attitude she gave off. She was all worried about work and lunch time and all these things. I thought it was ridiculous. But whatever..

Now the Capalleni, well the pasta kind of sucked, the scallop was good but the pasta sucked. It was hard in some parts like maybe it was undercooked? and I have to say kind of bland. A little more flavor just a little bit more. 

Overall the service was good, food was not good for me but I knew it would of been good if I ordered something else. Everyone elses dish seemed to be better than mine.....  =_=

excerpts: It was served with plainly boiled spinach, with some hard and untasty risotto, which wasn't even a risotto, as the rice was so hard.

We had a 15 people birthday party, and ordered over $300 or $400 worth of food, and I went up and asked our waiter if they could do something special, maybe a little complimentary dessert on the house, and he plainly refused, as it probably comes out of his own pocket.
I was saying "Dude, we're giving you automatic 20%+ tip on the bill with over $300 balance.
And you can't give the birthday boy a small dessert??
risotto.author: Bay A.
risotto.review:
Do not eat here.

The service and the food were both horrible!    This is a tourist attraction, and that's all there is to it, with their prime location near Union Square, and their classical modern feel of their ambiance with fancy paintings. 

I ordered the Veel with lemon sauce during dinner time, but it was just thinly sliced veel that did not really have any moisture or taste left, after they tried to tenderize it by pounding on it or something. The lemon sauce was, just lemon??  Where's the complexity to it?  It was served with plainly boiled spinach, with some hard and untasty risotto, which wasn't even a risotto, as the rice was so hard. 
We had a 15 people birthday party, and ordered over $300 or $400 worth of food, and I went up and asked our waiter if they could do something special, maybe a little complimentary dessert on the house, and he plainly refused, as it probably comes out of his own pocket. I was saying "Dude, we're giving you automatic 20%+ tip on the bill with over $300 balance. And you can't give the birthday boy a small dessert??"

I looked in the kitchen, and saw several hispanic looking chefs, and didn't seem very authentic at all, or seemed like they knew what they were doing. The service was lousy too, as all the server did was take our orders, came back maybe only 3 times for water refills and bringing us some breads (it was so hard that I thought it was some bread from couple days ago).

It was a joke alright. And for what? Over priced lousy meal.

excerpts: I had risotto, which I liked.
risotto.author: Chris C.
risotto.review:
I ate here a few nights ago with the GF. The setting is really nice, all outside and everything. It did get a bit cold towards the end of the night, however, and the heaters didn't seem to be placed on. In SF, sometimes you need heaters even in the middle of June. 

The food was pretty good. I had risotto, which I liked. But it wasn't exactly anything crazy good, either. 

The service was acceptable, but far from greater. While the waiter seemed to be a good guy, he mostly ignored out table. I'll chalk it up to the fact that we look young, compared to the rest of the oh-so-sophisticated crowd that was currently eating dinner. Nevertheless, the fact that the waiter forgot that we ordered sides is not a great thing. He really should write the orders down in the future, instead of trying and failing to remember them all in his head. 

Overall, I like the idea of this place much more than I liked it in execution.

excerpts: which I never do (the risotto), but everything else was spot on.
Just outstanding.
risotto.author: Adam X.
risotto.review:
Went again tonight. For the first time ever sent something back which I never do (the risotto), but everything else was spot on. Just outstanding. I can still taste it... those short ribs are incredible in the Red Wine Sauce Served with Horseradish Mashed Potatoes as was the Ultra-Wide Fettuccine with Wild Mushrooms and Wild Boar Ragu.  Steaming hot and wonderful.

do it... do it.

excerpts: we had risotto and a rigatoni.
Both were delicious.
The risotto was the perfect amount of creaminess and flavor and the beef rigatoni was a hearty complement to the bottle of wine the waiter had recommended.
risotto.author: Denise B.
risotto.review:
YUM.  I am guessing I now have been to a true Italian restaurant.

In addition to the standard french bread and yummy pesto dipping sauce, we had for appetizers: the calamari and some oysters.  The oysters were divine, and came with two little sauces that were both really good.  Calamari though I thought was fried, wasn't.  (I guess I need to read my menu more carefully.).  It was stuffed though with a creamy sauce and served on top of bread.  Yummy.  

Entree-wise we had risotto and a rigatoni.  Both were delicious.  The risotto was the perfect amount of creaminess and flavor and the beef rigatoni was a hearty complement to the bottle of wine the waiter had recommended.  

You can't go to a restaurant named Cafe Tiramisu without ordering the tiramisu, which though we were full, we didn't regret ordering.  It was the best ever!!  

Not really a tourist trap: there are some, but also tons of locals, and during the week, lots of people that work in the financial district downtown.  

Service was impeccable and food was great.  Add that to dining outside on a leisurely Saturday evening, and you can't go wrong.

excerpts: Per the yelp review summary, we both tried the risotto dishes.
I had the ahi tuna with spicy risotto and my friend had the black squid ink risotto.
If  Uncle Ben could make risotto, he evidently set up shop at Cafe Tiramisu.
The risotto was NOT creamy and rich, but tasted super chewy and grainy, like a converted rice would taste.
And the spicy sauce combination in my tuna risotto was just plain weird.
I can't say anything much better about the squid ink risotto.
risotto.author: Tom K.
risotto.review:
I don't understand all these 4/5 star ratings.  This is by far the worst Italian food I've had in a while.  This restaurant is tourist trap that tries to gussy up bad food with colorful sauce squirts and liberal dustings of microgreens all over your plate.   

I was weary about this place to begin with but my friend had such a craving for Italian and she was in high heels, I decided to chance it anyway.  Per the yelp review summary, we both tried the risotto dishes.  I had the ahi tuna with spicy risotto and my friend had the black squid ink risotto.  If  Uncle Ben could make risotto, he evidently set up shop at Cafe Tiramisu.   The risotto was NOT creamy and rich, but tasted super chewy and grainy, like a converted rice would taste.  And the spicy sauce combination in my tuna risotto was just plain weird.  I can't say anything much better about the squid ink risotto.

By the way, the men's room at this restaurant was not working, so you had go down 2 store fronts to their "sister" restauant Taverna next door.  If Tiramisu's any indication of Taverna's cooking, I'd avoid Taverna too.

Skip this place and go to Plouf next door for some quality French.

excerpts: I think it's because I love risotto and the risotto here is good.
risotto.author: Aron L.
risotto.review:
I really like this place.  I think it's because I love risotto and the risotto here is good.  

I've been here a couple times.  It's pretty fancy and quite pricey but I've always enjoyed the food, wine and company every time I've been.  I've had fun every time I've been here so I guess I like it.  I like the whole Belden Lane area though.  Eating outside in the cool San Francisco air.  What more can you except from life (except lots of other stuff).

Last time I went, our little group got everything from oysters, mussels (in saffron-fennel sauce), lobster cioppino (which included scallops, salmon and shrimps), veal and a bottle of chianti.  I liked it all but there are a few things to keep in mind:

(1)  I'm in the middle of a love affair with oysters so my opinion may be biased.  It was AWESOME!

(2)  I don't really know what either saffron or fennel are (I'm guessing they're herbs of some sort) but I liked the food.

(3)  Lobster cioppino was overall good.  I'm decent with seafood quality so my opinion on this point is not totally off the mark.

(4)  I know nothing about wine.  I like saying the word "chianti" but I couldn't tell it apart from a "cabernet sauvignon" (which I also like saying because it makes me sound cool).

In conclusion:  Yay! I'm a fan.  So speaketh Yelp.  So speaketh I.

excerpts: We ordered the black ink risotto to share - amazing!!
I ordered seabass and my boyfriend ordered a pasta dish.
Both were equally good, not amazing   but very enjoyable.
risotto.author: Rach O.
risotto.review:
Sometimes winging it for dinner in the city can be fun, but sometimes overwhelming and hard to choose. Lucky for me I live close to the FIDI and was strolling down belden lane looking at menus trying to find a place with a good menu, nice ambiance, and an open table.

Lucky for me we finally managed to stumble upon Cafe Tiramisu, usually i wont eat italian since i work at an Italian restaurant in Nob hill, but the menu was different and interesting.

We ordered the black ink risotto to share - amazing!! I ordered seabass and my boyfriend ordered a pasta dish. Both were equally good, not amazing   but very enjoyable. The wine list is extensive, however we brought our own ( special occasion) and the corkage was $20. 

The reason for 3 stars instead of 4? The service! Ive been a server for 5 years so I am very understanding, however not being greeted for ten minutes... Then no hello, no personality at all-- not understandable. I asked about making a decision between two dishes and got a dismissive eyeroll. No one asked how our dinners were , and even though we were beyond polite, left 20 % and enjoyed our meal the service is what will probably keep me from coming back. I guess being young is cause for dismissal and bad service. 

So great food, awful service! You pick

excerpts: Ordered the veal scalopini with risotto and asparagus.
Food came quickly and tasted good.
Large portions priced somewhat above moderate.
Great wines.
Despite a rough start this place ended on a positive note.
Would not RCA to come back anytime soon
but glad I tried it!
risotto.author: Chuck K.
risotto.review: Not bad. Could be four stars but dropped on service. I stopped in on a Tuesday night. Place was packed and after being seated waited ten minutes to be acknowledged. Ordered the veal scalopini with risotto and asparagus. Food came quickly and tasted good. Large portions priced somewhat above moderate. Great wines. Despite a rough start this place ended on a positive note. Would not RCA to come back anytime soon but glad I tried it!

excerpts: They make a black ink risotto in a lobster bisque that is so ridiculous, you'll want to slap somebody!
risotto.author: Sarah K.
risotto.review:
Yeah, I dig it.

They make a black ink risotto in a lobster bisque that is so ridiculous, you'll want to slap somebody!  Another favorite is the braised beef short ribs .... the lamb dish is spectacular too!

grand finale?  three words - dessert menu sampler.

ridiculous.  seriously.

excerpts: One night I had an extraordinary meal (split down the middle with a friend):  a salad to start, a risotto as a second, and  a meat course (probably a filet mignon), with a glass of champagne to start, and an excellent bottle of Italian cab that wasn't cheap, but it wasn't horrifying.
One of my rules of dining is that most restaurants can't do most things all that well.
Choose simply, and choose meat (because it's hard to mess up a good cut of meat unless you cook it beyond edibility).
risotto.author: Laurel B.
risotto.review:
