One night I had an extraordinary meal (split down the middle with a friend):  a salad to start, a risotto as a second, and  a meat course (probably a filet mignon), with a glass of champagne to start, and an excellent bottle of Italian cab that wasn't cheap, but it wasn't horrifying.  One of my rules of dining is that most restaurants can't do most things all that well.  Choose simply, and choose meat (because it's hard to mess up a good cut of meat unless you cook it beyond edibility).  So I think that's why the meal was so good.  

My other forays generally have been at lunch, when I'm zipping downtownish for lunch with my downtown friends, and on two other occasions, for dinner.  Not so good.  Not bad, just . .. not great.   When I prefer my Tenderloin meals, not because they are inexpensive, but because they are truly good, well, that causes me to question many of my fancier dine-out experiences.  So on a nice day, outside?  I'm sure if you select something simple, you can have a good meal.  Otherwise, there are other much better places to go.

excerpts: The risotto was ok, but I probably wouldn't order it again.
risotto.author: Syd V.
risotto.review:
I was hesitant to take my mom here the other night because of the heavy tourist population, but she really liked Belden Place and wanted Italian... So, Cafe Tiramisu it was. We had a nice time and enjoyed the food. My mom had the sea bass, which she said was great, and my aunt had the short ribs, which are HUGE. The risotto was ok, but I probably wouldn't order it again. The veggie options were not very extensive.

The service was nice, although quite a bit slow. It was a Thursday night, so it was pretty busy. The alley way is great for evenings. This is a great place to take relatives from out of town for lunch or dinner, but the seating is way too jam packed and you sit shoulder-to-shoulder with the other diners. I think the prices are a bit too high for what you get, but I guess you are paying for the atmosphere and they are targeting tourists. Alli in all, its cute and the food is decent.

excerpts: We shared the beef carpacio, caesar salad with dungeness crab, pan seared ahi over risotto, and warm peach tart.
The salad was as I remembered, crispy, creamy, crabby, and delicious!
The ahi was done just right (seared and still rare) and the risotto was very tasty.
risotto.author: Angela O.
risotto.review:
My hubby and I recently lunched here.  I remembered the caesar salad with crab from a previous visit and wanted to come back for another taste.  We shared the beef carpacio, caesar salad with dungeness crab, pan seared ahi over risotto, and warm peach tart.  The salad was as I remembered, crispy, creamy, crabby, and delicious!  The ahi was done just right (seared and still rare) and the risotto was very tasty.  The peach tart was beautifully presented (we had to take a picture on our phone) and yummy!

We sat at a table inside the restaurant, which was nice and much roomier than being packed in with everyone outside.  Plus we were able to enjoy our own conversation (not everyone else's).  The service was good and the staff was friendly.  I will definitely return again for my favorite caesar salad and next time we're trying the dessert sampler!

excerpts: I had the black pepper seared ahi, which came on a bed of risotto and some mild miso sauce.
I was told that the gnocchi tasted definitely machine made (vs handmade) but the sauce was good.
The lava in the chocolate lava cake was great, as was the accompanying hazelnut ice cream.
The service was fine.
risotto.author: Rennie L.
risotto.review:
Pretty good. The food was delicious. I had the black pepper seared ahi, which came on a bed of risotto and some mild miso sauce. 
I was told that the gnocchi tasted definitely machine made (vs handmade) but the sauce was good.
The lava in the chocolate lava cake was great, as was the accompanying hazelnut ice cream. The service was fine.

excerpts: I had the black risotto with scallops as first course, roasted quail and sand dabs for entrees.
risotto.author: Richard Z.
risotto.review:
If you need a choice for a romantic anniversary dinner, consider this. Tucked into Belden place, together with a few other bistro-style eateries, it's like a mini-version of a European sidewalk restaurant street. If your girl likes Europe (who doesn't), you've already scored some brownie points.

The interior adds emphasis to Tiramisu's European/Italian theme. The walls are painted to look like antique marble, and there are faux-marble facades everywhere to remind you of Rome. At nighttime, the conversation is noisy and lively in a warm, comfortable way without being intrusive. If your girl likes Italian, more brownie points.

Girlfriend and I had the black risotto with scallops as first course, roasted quail and sand dabs for entrees. Sand dabs were slightly disappointing because usually they are buttery rather than dry, but the quail was excellent--crispy, sweet, and succulent.

This place also gets kudos for service. The waitress/manager gave us two glasses of champagne "on the house," and the waitress was very attentive throughout the evening.

excerpts: I had the squab wrapped in grape leaves with pumpkin risotto (served in a small pumpkin).
risotto.author: Chris  F.
risotto.review:
My girlfriend and i had a gift certificate, so decided to go out for dinner on a Friday night. We were a little worried it would by touristy but were pleasantly surprised.

I had the squab wrapped in grape leaves with pumpkin risotto (served in a small pumpkin). The pairing was great, and the flavors really complemented each other.

My gf had the duck ravioli, which was also excellent, with a hint of orange in the sauce that was too delicious to resist sopping up with the bread (which wasn't impressive although the dipping sauce was great)

The tiramisu itself was pretty good (not extraordinary), but overpriced at $10/slice

The ambiance was interesting- outdoors with xmas lights above it was romantic but we were packed in like sardines next to our neighbors.

A little pricey, but a good date restaurant

excerpts: Ahi Burschetta on Risotto Cake.
risotto.author: Becky O.
risotto.review:
Was here last night for a business dinner. We were a large group of approx. 12 people. We were seated right away. The host was very nice and we were able to get the downstairs area all to ourselves, which made the dinner quite enjoyable because we could talk about anything, be as loud as we wanted and we had plenty of space. 

In terms of the food, I have to say that while Italian food is wonderful, it's not my favorite due to the fact that everything involves too much pasta. It's just too filling for me. However, I must say that while this place has a small menu, the appetizers and courses were very tasty and the portions were not too big and not too small. 

Starters -- We had the following for the table: Blackened "Kobe Style" Carpaccio. Sauteed Dungeness Crab Cakes. Ahi Burschetta on Risotto Cake. I would pass On the Ahi, but the other two were very good. 

In terms of entrees. I am a big fan of minimal pasta dishes. So, I had the Cioppino (which I buy at Trader Joes all the time; it's wonderful). The waiter said the seafood is brought in fresh everyday at this place. Well, it was absolutely delicious, fresh and cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish it (generous portion). I recommend it for those trying to ease up on the carbs and those who love seafood and tomatoes. 

Others at the table had the Ravioli w/Roasted Eggplant. They liked it very much. And someone had the Gnocchi with meat sauce. She said it was good, but again very generous serving--good for two. 

Desert --We tried Yogurt Panna Cotta. Wonderufl! I recommend this. Light and rich at the same time with fresh fruit. A great finish. The table also ordered the Warm Chocolate Cake w/Hazelnut ice cream -- pass. 

Lastly, wine.. we had a Pinot Grigio and Pinot Noir. I didn't taste the Grigio as I am not a fan of white wine. But, for the Red, we had one from Sonoma (sorry can't recall the name). It was excellent. 

I'd come here again for the Cioppino.

excerpts: Wrong Risotto but - quite good.
Overpriced.
Wine - too warm (aaaaack!
you do NOT store wine under halogen bar lights!!!
risotto.author: Juliana C.
risotto.review:
What have they done with the Spanish place?

That's how we ended up at Cafe Tiramisu.  Belden place was crammed from wall to wall with mostly 20-something girls in discouragingly slutty dress (honey, you HAVE the goods, you don't NEED to package them like old sausage...).  

The hipsters were slinking by.  The waiters looking bored (lined up like gangstas against the bus station).  Hostess was polite and seated us right away.  Obsequious Sicilian with oddly Northern accent took the order, got it wrong, and forgot to bring my glass of wine.  Thank god my date was physically huge enough to be seen over the throngs gesticulating.  He's Sicilian too so hey - he's allowed.

Wrong Risotto but - quite good.  Overpriced.  Wine - too warm (aaaaack! you do NOT store wine under halogen bar lights!!! Jaysus!!!).  

Utterly charming atmosphere - even with the throngs of silly kids.  Harmless little dears having fun.  Could have used a few myself to help bus the table and bring my wine.

I'd do Belden Place again for sure - but on a week night that's warm.  Not weekend in summer.  Yikes!

As for Cafe Tiramisu in particular.  Pass.  The other reviewer who pegged it as touristy is right on.  Feels like one of those places in Venice that Rick Steves tells you to stay away from.  (Como se dice "clip joint?")

excerpts: This is when the guy sitting at the table next to us says "He ordered the gnocchi and she ordered the risotto!
" lol
Waiter looks in shock.
Oh sorry sorry something wrong with computer..." as he runs away again.
We finally get our food when the people next to us are finishing their desserts.
In my opinion, the food was EXCELLENT, but the service was insanely bad.
Took us another 30 minutes after we were finished and our plates had been taken for us to get the check, and we were never offered coffee or dessert.
Totally ridiculous.
Thanks for the worst Valentines Day dinner EVER Cafe Tiramisu.
Could have been a great experience.
Good food plus beautiful atmosphere
, why oh why did that server have to screw it all up?
risotto.author: Tori E.
risotto.review:
Its Valentines Day. I had been drooling over the menu at Cafe Tiramisu for months because I just happened to notice them on OpenTable and it looks sooooooo good. So I made a reservation for this special night and found a hotel close by (The Executive Hotel Vintage Court http://www.yelp.com/biz/executive-hotel-vintage-court-san-francisco#hrid:iiS_EE6i0H3H18UQNFJnHQ) and booked a room at the last minute. 
So we walk from the hotel, which is just about a 3 block walk downhill. 
When we get to the restaurant we come up to the patio entrance where there is a hostess standing outside of this giant plastic cover thing that encloses the entire patio area. The hostess tells us she has a seat for us outside. She unzips the plastic thing and brings us into the patio area (which seems nicely heated) and walks us to a table that is right up against the plastic. 
Ok fine. Then she seats someone next to us, and since the tables are packed in soooo tight this basically means she might as well say "this couple will be joining you for dinner this evening." 
Ok fine. So after a few minutes the waiter comes over. He has such a thick Italian accent I can barely understand him. We order two glasses of wine (two of the SAME wine- seriously, we were making it easy for him) and an appetizer (I cant exactly remember what). Ok for the record, I HATE when the waiter or waitress doesn't write anything down. I seriously hate it. It stresses me out. I get anxiety thinking they are going to mess this up but sometimes they surprise me and its all ok. This guy? Yeah who knows. He was gone for about 20 minutes, then came back and took the order of the people next to us. No wine for us, no appetizer. 
Ok, fine. A few more minutes go by. He comes over with the wine for the people next to us and then steps over to our table and looks at us blankly. 
"Uh..." he says. Yep nothing. Nothing going on up there in that head. I remind him that we ordered wine and an appetizer. He asks me which wine and which appetizer, so I tell him. 
He runs back to the kitchen. 20 minutes later our wine arrives. He tells us there is something wrong with the computer and runs off again. 
I'm slightly irritated at this point, but its the plastic cover thingy that's more annoying that the waiter, because I am freezing my butt off next to this thing. I'm wearing the most adorable dress with a sweater over and ex bfs jacket over my legs to keep from hypothermia. I'm little ok? No meat on these bones! lol 
Alright so the appetizer never came. We finally flag the man down and order our dinners, because at this point we are starvatious. He takes the order and leaves without time for us to ask about our appetizer, but we are so over it at this point. The people next to us are eating their entrees. A few minutes later, here comes Mr. Ding Dong Waiter again. 
"Uh... uh... you uh order uh..." he says. 
I remind him AGAIN of what we ordered. We are trying to make conversation, and trying not to think about our grumbly stomachs, when 10 minutes later the waiter comes back. 
"So sorry, your order?" CONFUSION look on his face. 
This is when the guy sitting at the table next to us says "He ordered the gnocchi and she ordered the risotto!" lol 
Waiter looks in shock. 
"Oh sorry sorry something wrong with computer..." as he runs away again. 
We finally get our food when the people next to us are finishing their desserts. In my opinion, the food was EXCELLENT, but the service was insanely bad. Took us another 30 minutes after we were finished and our plates had been taken for us to get the check, and we were never offered coffee or dessert. Totally ridiculous. 
Thanks for the worst Valentines Day dinner EVER Cafe Tiramisu. Could have been a great experience. Good food plus beautiful atmosphere, why oh why did that server have to screw it all up?

excerpts: I had the Risotto with half lobster:  not as rich as expected, which was graciously appreciated and oh-so yummy!

Being the prima-dona that I am blamed at being, I asked the waiter to take the lobster meat from the shell for me - he didn't even flinch and quickly returned with what looked like the equivalent of meat from a prawn, but nonetheless, made it easier for me...
risotto.author: Nicole Rynee B.
risotto.review:
Walking into this place made me want to brush up on Italian - and I'm not just speaking about my language skills ... ;)

Everything from the decor to the wait staff to the food selections and wine pairings - authentic Italian!  From the outside, Belden looks like a typical tourist trap - bright twinkling lights, cheap tables and chairs lined beneath even cheaper umbrellas, hostesses soliciting your patronage flashing menus, etc...  Nevertheless, Belden, and most importantly Cafe Tiramisu are fabulous and delectable dining experiences!

As we walked down the narrow restaurant to a table nestled in between two tables of two (we were a loud table of 4, okay maybe I was the only real loud one), we quickly realized we were in for a treat.  We were greeted quickly by one of many waiters asking to get us started with a nice bottle of wine.  Our waiter, looking a lot like Giovanni Ribisi, made a wonderful recommendation on a nice Italian red - surprisingly was inexpensive at $54.  

We started with the Beef and Salmon Carpaccio - both wonderful with very unique and delicious flavors.  I had the Risotto with half lobster:  not as rich as expected, which was graciously appreciated and oh-so yummy!  Being the prima-dona that I am blamed at being, I asked the waiter to take the lobster meat from the shell for me - he didn't even flinch and quickly returned with what looked like the equivalent of meat from a prawn, but nonetheless, made it easier for me...  Being at Cafe Tiramisu, we HAD to try the Tiramisu - very light and full of flavor.

We probably overstayed our welcome as we started into a few sales v. marketing battles (I won of course), two bottles of wine emptied and the table cleared... 

I am looking forward to coming back and enjoying the ambiance during a less rainy night - you know, taking in some of the chintzy twinkling lights under the outdoor umbrellas while sipping a fine Chianti... Gratzi! ; )

excerpts: Worst Black Ink Risotto that I've ever had.
What a farce.
risotto.author: Tom B.
risotto.review:
Worst Black Ink Risotto that I've ever had. $12?! What a farce. 
My Veal Scaloppini was mediocre. I also tried the Sea Bass which was way over-cooked. To top the night off, one of my Italian-speaking friends warms the waiters up to giving us a "complimentary" bottle of wine for the table. To our surprise the check came back with the wine surcharge. At that point the waiter said "No worries, just cross out the old total and write in the adjusted one." Low and behold a few weeks later, I notice the surcharge still on my credit card statement. Bastardio, siete molto ingannevoli! I'm getting distraught just trying to finish this review. The only nice thing was the cozy little Belden Place atmosphere which you can get at any of the restaurants up this alley. I'd highly recommend B44 instead.

excerpts: I had the Ahi tuna over Lobster Risotto was truly excellent.
risotto.author: Charles B.
risotto.review:
My visit to Cafe Tiramisu happened to be a beautiful sun-laden day, which meant, of course, that sitting outside was an absolute must. The lunch was a catch-up semi-working lunch and the atmosphere was completely conducive to our needs. 

The menu is a bit on the limited side and the appetizers are not really meant to share. However, every meal at our table of 5 looked great and there were nothing but clean plates to be found after the meal. I had the Ahi tuna over Lobster Risotto was truly excellent. I will go back just to get the same lunch! 

It was only after the lunch that I found out that the Belden alley is famous!

excerpts: (I'm a big risotto freak, btw.)
Their caprese salad is simple but delish.
But one of the things I love best is their dessert tray.
You can get a sampling of nearly every dessert on their menu--there are usually seven or eight options at any given time--for about nine dollars a person.
risotto.author: Lis M.
risotto.review:
I LOVE Tiramisu. When my boyfriend and I lived in San Francisco, this was our go-to spot for romantic dinners and special nights. I had been to Pleuf (also excellent) with co-workers, but wanted to try out another restaurant in Belden Place, so my boyfriend and I went here after our first major date together. 

Like all the restaurants in Belden Place, you have the choice of outdoors seating (usually heated by heat lamps) or indoors, and at times you may feel that the outdoor seating is a little cramped. I prefer to think of it as cozy, myself, and generally don't mind it. 

I have had so much delicious food at Tiramisu it is difficult to know where to start. They had for a delicious zucchini floweret appetiser I particularly loved, and their risottos were almost always flawless. (I'm a big risotto freak, btw.) Their caprese salad is simple but delish. But one of the things I love best is their dessert tray. You can get a sampling of nearly every dessert on their menu--there are usually seven or eight options at any given time--for about nine dollars a person. And since the desserts are so rich, the variety of the sampler tray lets you savor each dessert before you get overwhelmed with that particular flavour. 

I've generally had very good service from the Tiramisu people, and when we had to move out of SF, my boyfriend and I made a point of hitting Tiramisu one last time before we left. 

(I also have enjoyed Pleuf and Taverna among the restaurants of Belden Place, but Cafe Tiramisu is my fav.)

excerpts: but I did enjoy my Risotto.
We also got their Dessert Menu sampler to get a taste of everything.
Boy was it good!
risotto.author: Ida M.
risotto.review: Came here for dinner while on a weekend getaway to SF. I was looking for a place that was not too far from where we where staying and it had decent reviews on yelp so I made reservations to this place. We got seated right away but it took sometime before our server appeared and get our order. Let's just say whatever the service was lacking in, the food made up for it, thankfully. I don't remember what the hubby got but I did enjoy my Risotto. We also got their Dessert Menu sampler to get a taste of everything. Boy was it good!

excerpts: We also had the black ink  risotto and something with arugula (sorry, can't remember...)
as appetizers, and all were impressive.
risotto.author: Sahra H.
risotto.review:
Great, great food. I had the seafood mixed grill, and was really happy with it. We also had the black ink  risotto and something with arugula (sorry, can't remember...) as appetizers, and all were impressive. Both appetizers had white truffle shavings, which can never hurt a meal (I know, truffles are so 2000, but I still love the mushroomy yumminess). 

The service, on the other hand, was weird (as evidenced by my 3.75 stars, rounded up to 4). For example, my water glass was almost never full (I'm a huge imbiber of the H2O), but when I returned to the table from the ladies' room, the maitre'd was there ready with my napkin to position it perfectly on my now seated lap. Also, they took absolutely forever to clear our table, and were in no rush to take our orders. Strange, right?

Overall, it was a good experieince. One warning, though, which you must take to heart: Do not, under any circumstances, accept a table downstairs. The musty basement smell is bound to ruin your meal.

excerpts: The seared Ahi with Spicy prawn risotto is amazing!
risotto.author: Kapeli M.
risotto.review:
(3.5 Stars)  I have to go here a lot on business lunches and dinners.  Very cool ambiance and makes you feel like you are not in SF.  Nice warm days and nights, eat outside.  

IF the Osso Bucco is on the menu, order it, given that you don't have any political problems with veal.  Here they have a contemporary take on a traditional dish, and serve it on a bed of creamy polenta.  It is done very well.  The fish here is ok.  Much of the other stuff actually here goes from ok to pretty good, but the Osso Bucco was the most notable dish on the menu.

Update:  The seared Ahi with Spicy prawn risotto is amazing!

excerpts: It was to die for, and the shrimp risotto that accompanied it was the best I've had since I returned from Italy last January.
In addition to the ahi, our table had the salmon (fabulous), the sandabs with asparagus (yummy), and steak (awesome).
risotto.author: Aubrey W.
risotto.review:
I can't remember the last time I had a meal where I enjoyed every aspect of the meal. 

This restaurant is typical European when it comes to the service. The meals was long, the conversation was good, and the recommendations were excellent. Our waiter was straight out of Italy and recommended an excellent pairing of food and wine. 

Four of us went to dinner, and we all ordered different items. We all shared and all agreed we couldn't decide who had the best meal. After a lot of thought I decided my favorite was the seared ahi. It was to die for, and the shrimp risotto that accompanied it was the best I've had since I returned from Italy last January. In addition to the ahi, our table had the salmon (fabulous), the sandabs with asparagus (yummy), and steak (awesome). With so many great choices I suggest sharing.

The deserts were equally amazing, and I'm glad we saved room. Again, we each had something different, and all were equally as good!

This restaurant is on the pricier side, but every bite is worth it. I highly recommend this restaurant.

excerpts: I ordered the risotto appetizer with squid ink and scallops..
THIS MY FRIEND IS ALONE WORTH THE PRICE..
5 stars
My main dish was the risotto meal with a coke (no refills!!!)
The main dish was nothing compared to the appetizer..
risotto.author: Bernardo C.
risotto.review:
Cafe Tiramisu...I might have over paid...you be the judge...

I first walked along the narrow alley way charmed by the countless Italian choices...I LOVE Italian food..

I was on my lunch break and i felt like spending..i walked over to a table being stared by the hostess.."you need a table"..."why yes i do..just for one please"
She hands me a menu..WOW..pretty pricey but hey i wanted to splurge

I ordered the risotto appetizer with squid ink and scallops..THIS MY FRIEND IS ALONE WORTH THE PRICE..5 stars
(im no food connoisseur though)

My main dish was the risotto meal with a coke (no refills!!!)
The main dish was nothing compared to the appetizer..i could have only wished...

Overall it turned out to be 40 bucks with tip and tax..

To add to my review  i felt I was hated the whole time because i was all alone and everyone around me was there for some business lunch with clients..."hey at least i was dressed in a suit and tie people"

I guess it would have been great if i was there with someone..but as for being by myself..it hurt its own rating...THEY WERE LUCKY WITH THE APPETIZER..I WOULD HAVE GIVEN IT A 1 START IF I DIDNT ORDER IT..

excerpts: I think the theme might be seafood cause for the second course we had crab ravioli, which is amazing, and I had the half lobster with risotto.
Have I told you I love shell fish?
It's a little bit hard to eat cause they don't have the cracker (is that the right word?) for the claw.
I had to pick the meat with the little fork they gave me.
Nonetheless, I was in heaven.
I think the only words can describe their food are good and amazing.
risotto.author: Perry S.
risotto.review:
I went here for Valentine's Day and my husband and I got the 4 course Valentine's Day dinner. It was superb! I honestly can't remember everything that I had since it's in Italian and didn't have the chance to steal the menu =). 

The appetizer I got the butternut squash soup and I thought it would be yucky as butternut isn't exactly my favorite but it was really good. Rich and creamy. My husband had the crab cakes that comes with a little crab salad and it was good! I love shell fish. 

I think the theme might be seafood cause for the second course we had crab ravioli, which is amazing, and I had the half lobster with risotto. Have I told you I love shell fish? It's a little bit hard to eat cause they don't have the cracker (is that the right word?) for the claw. I had to pick the meat with the little fork they gave me. Nonetheless, I was in heaven. I think the only words can describe their food are good and amazing. So let me be redundant here. 

The third course, we had the medallion beef steak and sea bass. I don't particularly like this fish but the way they cooked it made this dish exceptionally good. 

The 4th course is the dessert, my favorite. My husband got the fried bananas with caramel and vanilla ice cream. I got the chocolate cake with raspberry sauce? Guess what? Yep, the desserts were good. They are to die for! Especially the chocolate cake. 

The place is really cute and I think if you come here, you should seat outside. Yeah, no matter how cold it is. They have outdoor heater. Actually the four restaurant on Belden does look very european with the location in the alley, the tables are very close to each other, and the christmas lights above. Funny thing, the couple who sat next to us, they're around mid-40's, the husband had an objection that their table was so close to ours and another couple. He insisted to be moved to another bigger table but the waiter told him that table was for 4 people. Begrudgingly he accepted his table. Kudos for the waiter. 

I understand that he might want some privacy as many americans hate being close to each other but come on,  the whole point of the tables are being so close to each other is to create the communal dinner atmosphere like many restaurants in Europe. Plus, it's not like I was gonna continue eavesdropping after I found out they were talking about work. 

The service was excellent and I didn't feel like I was hurried. I will definitely come back. I heard this place has amazing desserts, so maybe next time I should go just for desserts.

excerpts: I ordered the risotto with a 1/2 lobster.
It had asparagus, and pesto.
It was okay.
For $24, I expected a bit "more.
Not necessarily in quantity, but in quality.
There was not much of a "melt in your mouth" factor.
risotto.author: Sarah F.
risotto.review:
I really enjoy going to Belden Place.  It's a fun place to go with friends.  So we tried out this restaurant; and I was soooo hungry.  We were promptly seated, but downstairs.  I felt like I was in the maid's quarters.  Well, not really; but we were away from the rest of the restaurant.  I ordered the risotto with a 1/2 lobster.  It had asparagus, and pesto.  It was okay.  For $24, I expected a bit "more." Not necessarily in quantity, but in quality.  There was not much of a "melt in your mouth" factor.  The flavors were not really refined; kind of bland.  

I am disappointed, b/c the other Yelp reviews are really good!  Maybe I just went on an off night.  However, our waiter was sooo nice.

excerpts: I thought their lobster risotto was perfection, as was the beef carpaccio and short ribs.
Their namesake wasn't bad either.
risotto.author: Sarah M.
risotto.review:
This is a great place for delicious and comforting food. The atmosphere was perfect for a casual but romantic dinner; my date and I were happy to share a meal here.

I thought their lobster risotto was perfection, as was the beef carpaccio and short ribs. Their namesake wasn't bad either.

excerpts: and I ordered the Risotto -Summer Porcini Mushrooms & Asparagus with Sage Garlic Chips Crust $20 and my coworker ordered the Sea Food Mixed Grill - Roasted Shallots Mashed Potatoes & Lemon Caper Sauce $23.
I'd probably go back just for dessert, as the risotto was just ok and a tad on the expensive side.
risotto.author: Cheryl Q.
risotto.review:
Took a coworker to lunch here to discuss their annual review and goals for this next year. Made reservations the same morning on www.opentable.com for 12:15 and was able to get in with no problems. Was seated inside immediately and I ordered the Risotto -Summer Porcini Mushrooms & Asparagus with Sage Garlic Chips Crust $20 and my coworker ordered the Sea Food Mixed Grill - Roasted Shallots Mashed Potatoes & Lemon Caper Sauce $23.

My food came out lukewarm, but tasty. I didn't bother sending it back because it took a little bit of time to come out and I was too busy talking to my coworker.

We shared the Tiramisu and it was very good. I'd probably go back just for dessert, as the risotto was just ok and a tad on the expensive side.

excerpts: We tried the black squid ink risotto with scallops...
AMAZING!
Beef carpacio was really good.
Fettucine with scallops was good but probably my least favorite of what we ordered.
The boneless sea bream was prepared in such a simple manner but it really delivered on taste.
This is the PERFECT place to go on a nice night in the city.
risotto.author: Mary P.
risotto.review: Excellent ambiance (you MUST sit outside).  Decent service.  Most importantly, GREAT food.  We had a reservation but still had to wait an hour for a table outside.  While we were waiting, we chatted with a restaurant regular and he gave us his recommendations.  We tried the black squid ink risotto with scallops...AMAZING!  Beef carpacio was really good.  Fettucine with scallops was good but probably my least favorite of what we ordered.   The boneless sea bream was prepared in such a simple manner but it really delivered on taste.  This is the PERFECT place to go on a nice night in the city.

excerpts: We have a very pleasure meal there - pan seared ahi tuna with lemon sauce over spicy shrimp risotto is really delicious.
risotto.author: Roserrele W.
risotto.review: My boss bought me lunch there for my birthday.  We have a very pleasure meal there - pan seared ahi tuna with lemon sauce over spicy shrimp risotto is really delicious.  My boss got steamed black mussels with choice of three sauces.  Since I was too full, I did not order any tiramisu.  The service was okay - the receptionist could be more hospitalized but she was not but the waiter was very nice.  I have a very good lunch for my day.

excerpts: As for the meal, the risotto was tasty but the shrimp was too dry.
risotto.author: Evelyn B.
risotto.review:
First time at Belden Place Alley - loved it. So cute and very European (Spanish, Madrid, Plaza de Santa Ana) feel. We waited to get outdoor seating which was worth it considering the beautiful weather.

The pre-meal bread was good, the olive oil with basil/pesto was yummy but could have had more garlic.

As for the meal, the risotto was tasty but the shrimp was too dry. We also had the Capellini (with proschetto wrapped scallop) and it was good...however, when they say scallop they mean scallop, as in one, singular, not plural ;-)

Anyways, minus 1 star for the slightly drunken waiter that was rushing us...and minus the other star for not entirely superb food.

I will definitely be checking out some more restaurants on this cute little alley because the ambiente is great :)

excerpts: We ordered the beef carpaccio, the dungeness crab, the pesto mussel and as the entree the pesto risotto.
risotto.author: Kalifornia S.
risotto.review:
I must be blind! I have been on this strip many times and I always seem to find two places but when I was celebrating Bastille Day I came across this place. I walked in the door and didn't even realize it was a place since the register was right there. Don't let that throw you off. The food is delicious. I think we may have had the owner waiting on us as well. Always love it when the owners get there hands dirty.  

Even though the place was packed, they were able to find us a table for two near the front of the restaurant. They give you bread with oil that has pesto in it. Finally a place that realizes that dipping bread in just oil is boring and bland. We ordered the beef carpaccio, the dungeness crab, the pesto mussel and as the entree the pesto risotto. 

My husband and I shared all the plates and we were not disappointed on anything. We even ordered dessert ..the warm chocolate cake with hazelnut ice cream. Yummy...i can't wait to go back.

excerpts: I ordered the seared scallops on a pea risotto.
Bad choice.
The three scallops were nicely seared, but the risotto was bad.
It was under seasoned and far too tight, easily holding it's trapezoidal shape, rather than "oozy".
However, others in our group really enjoyed the wild mushroom ravioli (which looked more like an appetizer sized serving).
I'm inclined to think it's just what I ordered
so I may revisit this restaurant in the future.
risotto.author: Jason C.
risotto.review: We had a group of 20 or so people and were relegated downstairs which was a little dim and claustrophobic with no windows. I ordered the seared scallops on a pea risotto. Bad choice. The three scallops were nicely seared, but the risotto was bad. It was under seasoned and far too tight, easily holding it's trapezoidal shape, rather than "oozy".  However, others in our group really enjoyed the wild mushroom ravioli (which looked more like an appetizer sized serving).  I'm inclined to think it's just what I ordered so I may revisit this restaurant in the future.

excerpts: I got the Ahi Tuna w/ Spicy shrimp risotto, and one of my friends got Mushroom risotto.
I think someone else had ravioli.
Anyway, awesome service, awesome food.
I would definitely recommend it, and would go back.
risotto.author: Labonee M.
risotto.review: I don't know if tonite was randomly a HIT, but i have no complaints about this cute restaurant in Belden Place.  This European-esque alleyway has a lot of adorable restaurants and stuff.  So I picked Italian cuz all my friends were vegetarian.  Our waiter was so nice!  We had a lot of requests and he was trying very hard to make us feel comfortable.  First, we were seated near the door, where there was a draft, so immediately he moved us to another table when we complained.  Then we asked for a bottle of wine which they happened not to have, so he gave us a more expensive one for the same price!  SCORE!  It was really good too.  All of our dishes were delicious... I got the Ahi Tuna w/ Spicy shrimp risotto, and one of my friends got Mushroom risotto.  I think someone else had ravioli.  Anyway, awesome service, awesome food.  I would definitely recommend it, and would go back.

excerpts: We had had a range of items, including the raw oysters, black ink risotto with scallops, buffalo mozzarella and heirloom tomato salad, mixed grilled seafood, linguine a la vongole and finally, seared ahi  over spicy shrimp risotto.

Of all of these dishes, the only ones I really enjoyed eating were the oysters and the salad, both of which I could find elsewhere or make at home (not enough scallop with the black ink; grilled fish item from mix was rather dry, and the general mix was good but not special; the linguine also lacked outstanding qualities, with the pasta being a little too dry and too much; the spicy shrimp risotto was like risotto mixed with Sriracha and topped with canned tuna fish since the fish was not so much as seared as it was fully cooked).

But, though not impressed with the food, the waitress and management were very accommodating; example, my grandfather was not familiar with any of the menu dishes and has for a long time considered linguine a la vongole his favorite Italian pasta dish.
It was not on the menu, but management whipped it up for him anyway.
I've been told that at night the outdoor seating does not exist, and really the charm of Belden is the canopied front shop seating (note, if you come at 12, you may have to wait a while
but if you come at 12:30, forget about it.
This place is very popular with those working in the Financial District, so clusters of co-workers and small business lunches line up beginning at 12.
Try to get there at the very latest, 11:45); so, if I were to come back it would only be for lunch.

In summary...
5 for customer service
5 for atmosphere
4 for presentation
3 for food... and though everything else was outstanding, I really have to emphasize and warn about the pretty but lackluster food that priced at $20/person for lunch!
I would not object to coming here again, I did have a lot of fun, but be forewarned... this is about the relaxing, 2 hr dining vacation experience than the actual food itself.
risotto.author: Jessica L.
risotto.review:
I'd never actually been down the Belden alleyway, and probably would have missed it if my uncle, a long-time SF resident, hadn't pointed it out to my folks when we visited the city.
Although touristy, it definitely has its quasi-European charm, with its lunchtime outdoor seating, Italian speaking waiting staff and beautifully presented dishes. This place is supposed to be known for its seafood, and while very fresh... I'm a little disappointed, but they were not very memorable in terms of taste, although they were visually very stunning. We had had a range of items, including the raw oysters, black ink risotto with scallops, buffalo mozzarella and heirloom tomato salad, mixed grilled seafood, linguine a la vongole and finally, seared ahi  over spicy shrimp risotto. Of all of these dishes, the only ones I really enjoyed eating were the oysters and the salad, both of which I could find elsewhere or make at home (not enough scallop with the black ink; grilled fish item from mix was rather dry, and the general mix was good but not special; the linguine also lacked outstanding qualities, with the pasta being a little too dry and too much; the spicy shrimp risotto was like risotto mixed with Sriracha and topped with canned tuna fish since the fish was not so much as seared as it was fully cooked). But, though not impressed with the food, the waitress and management were very accommodating; example, my grandfather was not familiar with any of the menu dishes and has for a long time considered linguine a la vongole his favorite Italian pasta dish. It was not on the menu, but management whipped it up for him anyway.
I've been told that at night the outdoor seating does not exist, and really the charm of Belden is the canopied front shop seating (note, if you come at 12, you may have to wait a while but if you come at 12:30, forget about it. This place is very popular with those working in the Financial District, so clusters of co-workers and small business lunches line up beginning at 12. Try to get there at the very latest, 11:45); so, if I were to come back it would only be for lunch.
In summary...
5 for customer service
5 for atmosphere
4 for presentation
3 for food... and though everything else was outstanding, I really have to emphasize and warn about the pretty but lackluster food that priced at $20/person for lunch! I would not object to coming here again, I did have a lot of fun, but be forewarned... this is about the relaxing, 2 hr dining vacation experience than the actual food itself.

excerpts: For starters, we had the black ink risotto with seared scallops and the dungeness crab ceasar salad (recommended by the hostess)...
both were really good.
I've never seen my bf clear our a plate as fast as he did with the black ink risotto and seared scallops!

I'm kinda picky with ceasar salads because they're usually drenched in dressing, but this particular one was perfectly dressed -- pretty much the entire salad was lightly coated with the dreassing and topped with a bed of crab meat and parmesean.
For our main entrees, I had the ahi tuna with spicy crab risotto and my bf had the braised short ribs.
The spicy crab risotto was not so spicy, but I didn't care because spicy or not, it was so good!
I felt the ahi tuna and the risotto paired together really well.
risotto.author: Cat T.
risotto.review:
We were supposed to eat here during our last trip to SF, but we didn't have time. Luckily my bf remembered this place during our trip to SF this past weekend.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the mixed reviews, but I'm so glad I ate here because it was one the best meals I had this weekend! 

For starters, we had the black ink risotto with seared scallops and the dungeness crab ceasar salad (recommended by the hostess)...both were really good. I've never seen my bf clear our a plate as fast as he did with the black ink risotto and seared scallops! I'm kinda picky with ceasar salads because they're usually drenched in dressing, but this particular one was perfectly dressed -- pretty much the entire salad was lightly coated with the dreassing and topped with a bed of crab meat and parmesean.  For our main entrees, I had the ahi tuna with spicy crab risotto and my bf had the braised short ribs. The spicy crab risotto was not so spicy, but I didn't care because spicy or not, it was so good! I felt the ahi tuna and the risotto paired together really well. The braised short ribs was done exactly the way we like our short ribs - so tender that you don't really need a knife.  (Hey, I just noticed that we ordered pretty much the same thing as Joe H.'s review below! I guess we have the same good taste in food!) After all that food we didn't quite make it to dessert. I was bummed out because I saw a few items I really wanted to try, but I was seriously way too full and I didn't think I would be able to walk back to our hotel, or anywhere at all! We loved the food so much that we can't wait to go back!

I had to -1 star because our server was kinda weird. He didn't seem so friendly at first, I think even the people at the table next to us felt that way, but he improved over the course of the dinner. The place is super small and crowded, but I guess that's part of the Belden Alley experience. Hopefully you'll get seated next to people you don't mind talking to because the tables are so close that you 're pretty much dining with them.

excerpts: I had the cioppino and my husband had the seared ahi over risotto.
He said his was good and mine was ok -
I like cioppino to have a real spicy bite.
I'd return...
I like a visit to Belden Place and this little spot was cute with good service.
risotto.author: Sandra P.
risotto.review: Snuck out of work for lunch with the husband... nice place but a bit pricey. We ate inside because I was freezing outside... sorry this LA girl is still not accustomed to the SF chill even after 3 years.  Good attentive service. I had the cioppino and my husband had the seared ahi over risotto. He said his was good and mine was ok - I like cioppino to have a real spicy bite.  I'd return... I like a visit to Belden Place and this little spot was cute with good service.

excerpts:
Appetizers:
Black ink risotto with seared scallops - recommended.
Risotto is perfect texture and the scallops are just lightly cooked, very tender.
Monterey Calamari stuffed with crab and served on Italian garlic toast - Not as good as the risotto, but an ok dish.
I had the Black pepper crusted ahi tuna over a spicy shrimp risotto.
A vast improvement over the dish I remember having two and a half years ago (slab of grilled salmon or something.
It stands out because I remember it being very tender... almost as tender as the scottish salmon that Aqua used to serve).
The tuna was only slightly seared and for the most part rare, just as I like it, but the highlight of the dish is the risotto.
The texture of the rice and shrimp is perfect.
risotto.author: Joe H.
risotto.review:
I haven't eaten here since I started working in downtown in January 2005.

I am glad I went again today (for work).

Meal re-cap:

Appetizers:
Black ink risotto with seared scallops - recommended. Risotto is perfect texture and the scallops are just lightly cooked, very tender.
Monterey Calamari stuffed with crab and served on Italian garlic toast - Not as good as the risotto, but an ok dish. Nothing special here.

Entree:
I had the Black pepper crusted ahi tuna over a spicy shrimp risotto. A vast improvement over the dish I remember having two and a half years ago (slab of grilled salmon or something. It stands out because I remember it being very tender... almost as tender as the scottish salmon that Aqua used to serve). The tuna was only slightly seared and for the most part rare, just as I like it, but the highlight of the dish is the risotto. The texture of the rice and shrimp is perfect. Not really the spicy shrimp as described though.

My friend got the short ribs, which was an absolutely monstrous plate. It would be a good entree if you are starving. Didn't ask him how it tasted as I was too focused on my dish.

Dessert:
My friend's Profiteroles looked amazing, but I had the warm chocolate cake. It came with a hazelnut "soup" and a scoop of chocolate ice cream. The dish is pretty sweet for my tastes, but not too sugary. I did like dipping the chocolate cake into the chocolate hazelnut soup. It reminded me of dunking oreo cookies into chocolate milk for that soggy texture.

Service - Standard. If you've eaten in Belden Alley before, you know what to expect.

-1 star for not being able to seat us outside and putting us all alone in the overflow dungeon downstairs. I had a reservation too! The air was stuffy and smelled of detergent. Regardless, the food was good.

Total cost - $210
- 5 people, no wine, 2 diet cokes, 3 coffees.

excerpts: Seared Ahi Tuna with Risotto
: i give this one a 4/5 rating.
tastewise
it's delicious.
the inside of the tuna is raw
but i eat sushi/sashimi all the time
so this is not anything that will make me not want to eat it, but for the weak minded people out there i wouldn't go for this, unless you're weak minded trying to unweak your mind.
the risotto also has an awesome flavor to it.
a bit salty but still none the less very tasty.
Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.
it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.
the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.
i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.
i suppose the risotto from the ahi tuna was superior to the risotto that came with the veal though.
risotto.author: Jack N.
risotto.review:
check out their menu here: http://www.belden-place.com/view/menu/cafetiramisu/

i guess you could say i love italian food.  one thing's for sure..and that's that i love pasta, bread, garlic and olive oil.  i decided to give this place a try after seeing other yelpers giving it a good review for the most part.  i've got to say, they have a mouth watering tiramisu and i hope it wasn't just for that night.  i mean c'mon! the friggin name of the place is cafe TIRAMISU...how can you go wrong ordering the one thing on the menu that describes the place, right?  anyway, we ordered plenty of dishes but unfortunately this time around i wasn't able to try everyone's food but i will list the ones i did try...

Seared Ahi Tuna with Risotto: i give this one a 4/5 rating.  tastewise it's delicious.  the inside of the tuna is raw  but i eat sushi/sashimi all the time so this is not anything that will make me not want to eat it, but for the weak minded people out there i wouldn't go for this, unless you're weak minded trying to unweak your mind.  the risotto also has an awesome flavor to it.  a bit salty but still none the less very tasty.  an awesome main course dish if i do say so myself.

Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.  it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.  the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.  i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.  i suppose the risotto from the ahi tuna was superior to the risotto that came with the veal though.

Tiramisu: this one gets a 4/5 rating.  i can't say i've had better tiramisu, but i know there's going to be one out there that i like more than this one.  however, when i do try that better one i know i'll rate this one a 3 and that one a 4.  lol..i guess i'm never satisfied, but this tiramisu is definately a must try.  it comes on a large plate (as does everything else) with 4 thin square walls of dark chocolate on the perimeter of the  cake.  not too sweet, which is rare to find...trust me, and you can taste the liquor inside cake..which is awesome.  i think this is possibly the best tiramisu i've ever put in my mouth...so to speak.

Almond Cannoli with chocolate mouse:  this one gets a 3.5/5.  i've had better cannoli, but this dish gets points for presentation as it is a very attractive one.  the cannoli are about 1 in long each (uber tiny) and you get about 3 i think?  it comes with a sauce and some chocolate mouse which is tasty too.  not over sweetened either which is also good for those trying not to attract diabetes to their bodies.  overall good, but probably won't be ordering it again in the future unless someone treats me to one..  will it be you? i doubt it. hah.

gelati & sorbetto combo:  this is good too if you like ice cream.  i give it a 3.5/5 as well.  i'm not much of an ice cream fanatic but if you were this'd probably be a good one to order being it is home made and all.  i guess i dont have much to say except that i know i will never be ordering this because i could care less about sorbet's or ice cream, but don't take my word for it.  try it out yourself, what've you got to lose?  well...i guess you've got $10.50 to lose, but o well, it'll definately be more of a mystery if you're wanting to try it and don't.

and that's my review of this place.  i'm hella tired so i'm gonna be signing off.  have one more review to do but that can wait.  i suppose ill leave you with this note:

TRY CAFE TIRAMISU AND ORDER AHI TUNA!

until next time....EAT MORE FOOOOOD!

excerpts: The most appetizing dish amongst our group of four, was the Ahi Tuna Risotto.
risotto.author: Jesha C.
risotto.review:
Based on the setting, I expected a lot more.  Very European alley type setting.

Food and service left a lot to be desired.  The bread was solid and tasted like cardboard.

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Linguine, which was small in portion, and so-so in taste.  The pasta was dry, and the ahi was minimal.  I ended up eating really slowly, so as to slow down my appetite, all the while filling up on the cardboardlike bread.  

The others at our table pretty much had the same complaints.  Even the less hungry ladies complained of the small portions, and they too, were filling up on bread.  

The most appetizing dish amongst our group of four, was the Ahi Tuna Risotto.  

Service was also quite poor.  After our initial orders, we had the hardest of times flagging down a waiter.  Even when we were able to get a waiter's attention, the simple task of bringing us a wine menu was made quite difficult.  

For the money, there are a lot more tasty, satisfying restaurants in the area.  I would definitely not return.

excerpts:
The food was pretty good the Mozzarella Salad and the Black Ink Risotto
were pretty tasty!
risotto.author: John M.
risotto.review:
The weather was nice so we decided to walk down to Belden Place for dinner.  We had a short wait even though we made a reso on open table before we left the house, they sat a walk in table before us but no big deal we only waited like 5 minutes anyway.  I didn't like the way they dumped us as the table, I was thinking perhaps I should teach them restaurant skills 101. First the guest sits down then you hand them the menu....DUH  You don't throw the menus down and point at the table!  I knew I was in a tourist destination restaurant by the time I sat down.  And all the tables were at different heights and wobbled all over the place.  But, the wine list cheered me up, very nice selection. We ordered a fairly decent Barbera not bad for only $42.  But I haven't seen wine glasses big thick and cheap like theirs since I was in college.  I'm sure they must serve crystal glasses for their more expensive wines that are 400-500 and up.  Oh and then Maurizzio our waiter yanked my partners menu and mumbled something about spilling olive oil on it.  Thank goodness my partner didn't hear what he said because he would have been pissed! 
The food was pretty good the Mozzarella Salad and the Black Ink Risotto
were pretty tasty!  For our entrees we had the Crispy Chicken cooked under a brick and the Beef Short Ribs, both were really good.
It wasn't a total disappointment although I will never go back, to many other options that I like on Belden Place!
Oh and by the way, take your time ordering because they bring the food out so damn fast your head will spin!  I don't mean to be so negative, and I know this is just an outdoor cafe.  But can't the management change all the damn burned out light bulbs that are strung outside??
Total bill with tip was around: $155 for 2 ppl

excerpts: we shared the ahi tuna with vegetables and risotto but all I could do was think of those pillows of love.
Desserrt was tiramisu, of course
and it was very good.
Oh yeah, youu could eat dirt by the way in Belden Lane, it's so dreamy and Parisian with the lights
strung so beautifully across...
risotto.author: Isabella R.
risotto.review: Went here two weeks ago when we had that heavenly warm weather which stretched into the evening. We shared a few different things (oh yes, and the bread with pesto was a lovely way  to begin). Oysters with mignonette and horseradish- not the best,  but fleeting and delicious (one a piece) we had the caesar salad with dungeness crab- lightly dressed, perhaps not lemony enough, with nice lump crabmeat and a perfect amount of parmigiano on top. The real star of the evening was the ravioli-about 7 large ravioli that were the absolute cat's pyjamas-nice homemade pasta, perfectly cooked and filled with porcini mushrooms and ricotta in a butter based sauce with -drumroll- slices of black truffle! So swoony. we shared the ahi tuna with vegetables and risotto but all I could do was think of those pillows of love. Desserrt was tiramisu, of course and it was very good. Oh yeah, youu could eat dirt by the way in Belden Lane, it's so dreamy and Parisian with the lights strung so beautifully across...

excerpts: My risotto with scallops (plural) was really undercooked risotto with scallop (singular), cut in half to look like two scallops.
It was awful.
The cheese ravioli was only marginally better, but was so over buttered/oiled that I could FEEL my cholesterol going up.
The tiramisu for dessert, their "signature," was soggy -
I've made better myself.
The waiter was "faux" Italian, but genuinely bad.
Stay away.
risotto.author: Ryan W.
risotto.review: This place was recommended to some business associates by the concierge at the Ritz-Carlton, so I didn't really have a say in where we were going for dinner.  If I did have a say I would've avoided this place at all costs.  It just seems like it's positioned to capture the tourists with its location in the alley-like Belden Place with its outdoor tables and strings of lights.  Places like this remind me of the scene in the French restaurant in "National Lampoon's European Vacation" where the chefs are in the kitchen microwaving frozen meals and passing them off to the oblivious Griswolds as haute cuisine.  Unfortunately, my instincts were correct.  My risotto with scallops (plural) was really undercooked risotto with scallop (singular), cut in half to look like two scallops.  It was awful.  The cheese ravioli was only marginally better, but was so over buttered/oiled that I could FEEL my cholesterol going up.  The tiramisu for dessert, their "signature," was soggy - I've made better myself.  The waiter was "faux" Italian, but genuinely bad.  Stay away.

excerpts: duck risotto was awesome..
i could eat that for days.
the $9 per person dessert sampler was this huge assorted plate with creme brulee, fudge, ice cream, and other random things though i'd stuck with getting just the creme brulee..
i love how i got a table despite it being a rather busy friday night!
risotto.author: ally o.
risotto.review: duck risotto was awesome.. i could eat that for days. the $9 per person dessert sampler was this huge assorted plate with creme brulee, fudge, ice cream, and other random things though i'd stuck with getting just the creme brulee.. i love how i got a table despite it being a rather busy friday night!

excerpts: The risotto was delicious, great flavors mixed together.
The artichokes under the sand dabs were more delicious than the fish itself.
The buffalo mozzarella salad was delicious-
it comes with red bell peppers marinated in a sweet sauce, arugala, proscuitto.
Except for the vanilla gelato, the desserts were terrible
(we ordered the dessert sampler).
Do not order this, unless you want to be disappointed by most of it.
The service and waiters were good.
I was happy with the restaurant, aside from dessert.
risotto.author: Nisey D.
risotto.review: The risotto was delicious, great flavors mixed together.  The artichokes under the sand dabs were more delicious than the fish itself.  The buffalo mozzarella salad was delicious- it comes with red bell peppers marinated in a sweet sauce, arugala, proscuitto.  Except for the vanilla gelato, the desserts were terrible (we ordered the dessert sampler).  Do not order this, unless you want to be disappointed by most of it. The service and waiters were good.  I was happy with the restaurant, aside from dessert.

excerpts: The scallop risotto was a thimble full of risotto with maybe two scallops on top.
It was damn tiny, and you had to laugh.
And the ahi tuna was nice, kinda like if you can't decide between raw and cooked, so you get both, seared on the outside, raw on the inside.
But not a lot of it on the plate.
Thank goodness the appetizers were so large!
The desert cheese plate was 5 small pieces of cheese, four grapes and one strawberry slice on an enormous plate, reminding me of a modern art gallery.
The saving grace was the tiramisu, the best I've ever had in my life, and I always get tiramisu when it's available.
But that's not enough to eat here.
Just get appetizer and tiramisu, avoid the entrees.
And if they try to seat you in the basement, just walk out.
The only reason to go down there is to use the restroom.
The atmosphere is horrible, horrible down there!
risotto.author: A P.
risotto.review: Decent, fun place on a temperate night.  If you sit outside, it'll be very noisy and there will be smoking.  So, sit inside, as close to the window as possible, so you'll feel like you're outside without all the irritations.  It's quieter inside too.  Make sure you eat here on an expense account because it's damn expensive for what you get.  Appetizers were the best value.  A heaping mussel plate ($15) with the largest mussels ever.  I thought I would be scared, but they were tasty.  The oyster appetizer was underwhelming and the oysters were small, smaller than the mussels.  Strange.  As for the main entrees: my seabass was so overcooked, it tasted like halibut.  Erg.  The assorted seafood platter was horrifying: the most gigantic crawfish (or is that shrimp?) ever with the head and arms still attached (I don't want a gigantic insect like thing sitting on the very top of my plate like it just killed the other items there), and the remaining items weren't appealing, either.  The scallop risotto was a thimble full of risotto with maybe two scallops on top.  It was damn tiny, and you had to laugh.  And the ahi tuna was nice, kinda like if you can't decide between raw and cooked, so you get both, seared on the outside, raw on the inside.  But not a lot of it on the plate.  Thank goodness the appetizers were so large!  The desert cheese plate was 5 small pieces of cheese, four grapes and one strawberry slice on an enormous plate, reminding me of a modern art gallery.  The saving grace was the tiramisu, the best I've ever had in my life, and I always get tiramisu when it's available.  But that's not enough to eat here.  Just get appetizer and tiramisu, avoid the entrees.  And if they try to seat you in the basement, just walk out.  The only reason to go down there is to use the restroom.  The atmosphere is horrible, horrible down there!

excerpts: He ordered the striped sea bass filet which came with lobster, mashed potatoes, and saffron sauce-all of course rich and satisfying.
striped sea bass filet.author: Cyndi S.
striped sea bass filet.review: Tucked away in what appears to be an ally you will find this little treasure of a restaurant. With an Italian feel and menu to match the food is exquisite. Our experience began with oysters with classic mignonette and fresh horseradish. Typically I'm not a fan of horseradish but the way it was served it made it not only tolerable, but enjoyable.  Our main dishes arrived, I ordered the chicken breast. Don't allow the name alone to fool you, the dish was fulfilling and more. The chicken was juicy and the melted cheese and spinach married the flavor of the truffle sauce together wonderfully. The pumpkin gnocchi were a pleasant match with the dish. I took a few fork fulls of my boyfriend's dish (for review purposes of course ;D ) He ordered the striped sea bass filet which came with lobster, mashed potatoes, and saffron sauce-all of course rich and satisfying. He ordered a side of parmesan risotto just because and that too was wonderful. Truly one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a while.

excerpts: I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto.
I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.
The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.
veal scaloppini.author: Amy W.
veal scaloppini.review:
This was a holiday team dinner destination.  This place does seem to do a lot of these even though the space was pretty small. There were 12 of us - but another company had the entire downstairs 3-4 large tables and maybe 30-40 people.

We had a long table and it was hard to hear anyone other than those directly across or next to you.  Bread was served and would have been great warm, but was elevated by a lovey green olive/olive oil tapenade sort of dipping sauce.

There were four appetizers served "family style" (not sure if they were pre-ordered by the organizer of the dinner or what - but sadly 3 of the 4 of them served were fish - so I did not partake (as I recall 3 of them: octopus, ahi tuna and grapefruit, a bruschetta + one more I don't remember).

I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto. I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.  The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.

I doubt I would go there on my own just b/c I hate the way all the Belden Alley hostess try and talk you into going there whenever you walk by, it just feels like the cheesy parts of Paris and Rome where they try and lure the tourists...but if I was trying to figure out a place to get 20 co-workers to dinner I might consider it.

Oh and there is no bar - so if you get there before everyone else you can either wait at the table and look like a loser, or wait outside (and look like a loser).

excerpts: VEAL SCALOPPINI -
The white wine sauce complimented the mushrooms and veal very nicely.
veal scaloppini.author: Tiffany D.
veal scaloppini.review:
Fabulous atmosphere with the restaurant being located in the alley, cushioned right in between other restaurants and having glowing lights hung around the exterior of this place!  Sounds dreamy?  Indeed, it is!

D E C O R - The decor of this place has a Roman touch to it and romantic dining arrangements!  Dine outdoors when the weather forbids!

S E R V I C E - You will be assisted by a hostess upfront and be served by attentive waiters and waitresses throughout your meal courses!

I T A L I A N  F O O D - I loved every dish I tried!  What I HIGHLY RECOMMEND as an opening appetizer is to customize your order by combining their MUSSELS AND CLAMS together in spicy tomato broth!  Having the scrumptious spicy tomato broth to compliment the mussels and clams, the three way combo was tantalizing to my taste buds!!  It was super delicious and when everyone finished eating the mussels and clams, I drank the remaining spicy tomato broth! YUM!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ

O R D E R E D  D I S H E S - 
BRUSCHETTA - Crunchy bread.  Topped with crab meat and diced up, marinated in olive oil, tomatoes, the bruschetta was good.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#UUPXZyoqurkXUkYf9syCeQ

ROASTED SADDLE OF LAMB - The most expensive dish on the menu!  Splurged, but it was surely worth every bite!  The balsamic vinegar with the sage spice flavored around and on the nicely cooked lamb meat, was incredible!

NEW YORK STEAK - Tender and cooked exactly on point!  They could improve on those stringy, thin fries that were topped on the steak, however.  The fries lacked volume and specialty. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#zoTqIB5KPnTdv-amZVrMgA

SEAFOOD MIXED GRILL - The name of the entree is misleading.  The seafood is just salmon!  I like the presentation of this dish - not only was it artsy, but it looked fun!  The capers went well with the salmon!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#9cePDws2M2RgWJCnW_GAXg

VEAL SCALOPPINI - The white wine sauce complimented the mushrooms and veal very nicely.  I love the creamy risotto that was provided with the meal!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#dOPKUbjX08TXy4uDVVZANQ

DESSERT SAMPLERS - There is always room for dessert after a grand meal!  DO GET their dessert samplers because it is basically all the Italian desserts they offer that is combined into petite, delectable portions!  I enjoyed the display and a mini bite of each dessert!  I assumed that their tiramisu will be the best of all the desserts just because the restaurant is named Cafe Tiramisu.  It was not the best tiramisu I have ever had and not the best of all the desserts they provided.  My most favorite dessert, was their ice cream with a cup that was made out of hardened caramel!  It was unique, refreshing and savory!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#nOkzDCEROTQTtEcDeZrRYA

F I N A L  S A Y - A great, low-key restaurant if you are wanting to shy away from the crowd and to enjoy a hint of Italian charm!

excerpts: I had the grilled peaches and the veal scaloppini.
Both were delicious.
The service was very attentive.
My lunch companions also enjoyed their meals - I'll be back!
veal scaloppini.author: Allie H.
veal scaloppini.review: Had a work lunch here - enjoyed it. We arrived without a reservation around 12:30 and were seated right away. I had the grilled peaches and the veal scaloppini. Both were delicious. The service was very attentive. My lunch companions also enjoyed their meals - I'll be back!

excerpts: New York Strip Steak to the Veal Scaloppini, was PERFECT!
Salads were light and flavorful and the wines were excellent and reasonable.
We the most personable, pleasant and efficient service and can't WAIT to return!
veal scaloppini.author: Loreli B.
veal scaloppini.review: All five diners in our group were VERY IMPRESSED with their entrees, salads, sides and dessert, which was some of the BEST TIRAMISU any of us (who have all been to Italy) ever tasted! The homemade bread was light and delicate tasting, and everything from the Petrale Sole, Grilled Salmon, New York Strip Steak to the Veal Scaloppini, was PERFECT! Salads were light and flavorful and the wines were excellent and reasonable. We the most personable, pleasant and efficient service and can't WAIT to return!

excerpts: My Veal Scaloppini was mediocre.
I also tried the Sea Bass which was way over-cooked.
To top the night off, one of my Italian-speaking friends warms the waiters up to giving us a "complimentary" bottle of wine for the table.
To our surprise the check came back with the wine surcharge.
At that point the waiter said "No worries, just cross out the old total and write in the adjusted one.
Low and behold a few weeks later, I notice the surcharge still on my credit card statement.
Bastardio, siete molto ingannevoli!
I'm getting distraught just trying to finish this review.
The only nice thing was the cozy little Belden Place atmosphere which you can get at any of the restaurants up this alley.
I'd highly recommend B44 instead.
veal scaloppini.author: Tom B.
veal scaloppini.review:
Worst Black Ink Risotto that I've ever had. $12?! What a farce. 
My Veal Scaloppini was mediocre. I also tried the Sea Bass which was way over-cooked. To top the night off, one of my Italian-speaking friends warms the waiters up to giving us a "complimentary" bottle of wine for the table. To our surprise the check came back with the wine surcharge. At that point the waiter said "No worries, just cross out the old total and write in the adjusted one." Low and behold a few weeks later, I notice the surcharge still on my credit card statement. Bastardio, siete molto ingannevoli! I'm getting distraught just trying to finish this review. The only nice thing was the cozy little Belden Place atmosphere which you can get at any of the restaurants up this alley. I'd highly recommend B44 instead.

excerpts: I ordered the pork chop and my boyfriend the veal scaloppini.
We were both very happy with our meals.
No, it wasn't huge portions, but in this restaurant I was not expecting a giant meal.
I felt very satisfied with the meal and the service.
I thought the dining room was gorgeous.
For desert we had the cream profiteroles with two dipping sauces.
We loved the entire experience and will definitely go back again.
Next time we're going to do the desert sampler!
veal scaloppini.author: Angela W.
veal scaloppini.review: I really loved this restaurant!  My boyfriend and I went there one evening when we were out after work after hearing about the famous Belden Place.  It was between this and the Spanish place and we chose to go the Italian route.  Well, I am so happy we did.  I have to say I have never thought salad was so good, but the organic salad was so delightfully tasty I wished I had a huge one of those.  I ordered the pork chop and my boyfriend the veal scaloppini.  We were both very happy with our meals.  No, it wasn't huge portions, but in this restaurant I was not expecting a giant meal.  I felt very satisfied with the meal and the service.  I thought the dining room was gorgeous.  For desert we had the cream profiteroles with two dipping sauces.   We loved the entire experience and will definitely go back again.  Next time we're going to do the desert sampler!

excerpts: Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.
it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.
the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.
i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.
veal scaloppini.author: Jack N.
veal scaloppini.review:
check out their menu here: http://www.belden-place.com/view/menu/cafetiramisu/

i guess you could say i love italian food.  one thing's for sure..and that's that i love pasta, bread, garlic and olive oil.  i decided to give this place a try after seeing other yelpers giving it a good review for the most part.  i've got to say, they have a mouth watering tiramisu and i hope it wasn't just for that night.  i mean c'mon! the friggin name of the place is cafe TIRAMISU...how can you go wrong ordering the one thing on the menu that describes the place, right?  anyway, we ordered plenty of dishes but unfortunately this time around i wasn't able to try everyone's food but i will list the ones i did try...

Seared Ahi Tuna with Risotto: i give this one a 4/5 rating.  tastewise it's delicious.  the inside of the tuna is raw  but i eat sushi/sashimi all the time so this is not anything that will make me not want to eat it, but for the weak minded people out there i wouldn't go for this, unless you're weak minded trying to unweak your mind.  the risotto also has an awesome flavor to it.  a bit salty but still none the less very tasty.  an awesome main course dish if i do say so myself.

Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.  it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.  the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.  i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.  i suppose the risotto from the ahi tuna was superior to the risotto that came with the veal though.

Tiramisu: this one gets a 4/5 rating.  i can't say i've had better tiramisu, but i know there's going to be one out there that i like more than this one.  however, when i do try that better one i know i'll rate this one a 3 and that one a 4.  lol..i guess i'm never satisfied, but this tiramisu is definately a must try.  it comes on a large plate (as does everything else) with 4 thin square walls of dark chocolate on the perimeter of the  cake.  not too sweet, which is rare to find...trust me, and you can taste the liquor inside cake..which is awesome.  i think this is possibly the best tiramisu i've ever put in my mouth...so to speak.

Almond Cannoli with chocolate mouse:  this one gets a 3.5/5.  i've had better cannoli, but this dish gets points for presentation as it is a very attractive one.  the cannoli are about 1 in long each (uber tiny) and you get about 3 i think?  it comes with a sauce and some chocolate mouse which is tasty too.  not over sweetened either which is also good for those trying not to attract diabetes to their bodies.  overall good, but probably won't be ordering it again in the future unless someone treats me to one..  will it be you? i doubt it. hah.

gelati & sorbetto combo:  this is good too if you like ice cream.  i give it a 3.5/5 as well.  i'm not much of an ice cream fanatic but if you were this'd probably be a good one to order being it is home made and all.  i guess i dont have much to say except that i know i will never be ordering this because i could care less about sorbet's or ice cream, but don't take my word for it.  try it out yourself, what've you got to lose?  well...i guess you've got $10.50 to lose, but o well, it'll definately be more of a mystery if you're wanting to try it and don't.

and that's my review of this place.  i'm hella tired so i'm gonna be signing off.  have one more review to do but that can wait.  i suppose ill leave you with this note:

TRY CAFE TIRAMISU AND ORDER AHI TUNA!

until next time....EAT MORE FOOOOOD!

excerpts: We were disappointed to not see the short ribs on the lunch menu (as it was online), but we liked everything we got.
short ribs.author: Mi M.
short ribs.review:
I came here with co-workers after two of us saw this on Check Please Bay Area. We were disappointed to not see the short ribs on the lunch menu (as it was online), but we liked everything we got. We started with the meatballs, which were delicious (and could feed one for lunch on its own), and the octopus, which was tender and delicious. 

Two of us had the branzino special, which was perfectly cooked (watch for the bones, though!), which had a sauce with mussels and clams, and nestled on a bed of polenta. The other two had the sole and the salmon, both of which they liked. And, of course, for dessert, the tiramisu, which was light and fluffy and delicious.

No complaints about the service or cleanliness of the place. I'd definitely go there again!

excerpts: For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops.
The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine.
Seriously everything here was great.
I got a special dessert sampler
and I was in dessert heaven.
Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu.
The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to.
Maybe more like a pudding?
The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine.
Seriously everything here was great.
I got a special dessert sampler
and I was in dessert heaven.
Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu.
The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to.
Maybe more like a pudding?
short ribs.author: Vivian D.
short ribs.review:
