Came here for restaurant  week  and had the most exquisite time! Ambiance is real nice. Has a real authentic Italian feel. All the waiters are Italian! Got the prix fix meal and it was definitely worth it. 

For appetizers we got the pan seared scallops and the bresola (air dried beef) and both were soooo good! The scallops were flavorful and melt in your mouth and the beef was just filled with flavor. For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops. The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine. Seriously everything here was great. I got a special dessert sampler and I was in dessert heaven. Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu. The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to. Maybe more like a pudding? But still good nonetheless. 

Glad I got to try a  place I probably never would have gone to!

excerpts: I had the Caesar and the short ribs.
The Caesar was good, nothing extraordinary.
The short rib didn't look like much, just a long piece of meat on a bed of horseradish mashed potatoes with a red/brown sauce.
But the taste.....it was veryyyyy good, succulent meat - didn't even need to chew it, it was that tender.
The sauce was also perfect.
short ribs.author: Johnny L.
short ribs.review:
This is the second time I have been here - how could I have not reviewed this place before??  I must be getting old.

Anyway, this was a picture perfect night.  Why??  Well, it might have to do with my childhood of being around a bunch of people during the holidays and being outside in inclement weather.  This night, we were with our kids, one of my kid's friends and our two friends from Oregon.  We were going to just stay home and have homemade spaghetti sauce and some garlic bread - I am sure glad we decided to come into the city!!!

We parked at Union Square garage, went by Macy's and saw the kitties and pups, saw the tree in the square and then went to Chinatown for some bargain xmas shopping - my kids idea.  All the while, the rain was coming down in buckets.  After a few stops in Chinatown, we decided to get a snack, but, decided otherwise since everyone wanted more than a bite.  I remembered Cafe Tiramisu from another celebration, so, off we went from Chinatown.

The place is located in Belden alley, which in my mind, is a perfect little getaway.  The scene couldn't have been more perfect.... walking down Bush street, jumping over huge puddles, me yelling out to the crowd through the rain buckets "take a left, it's down that alley.  The bright neon sign above the door showed us the way to our perfect destination.

Every dish that was ordered was consumed in record time, not because we were overly ravenous, rather, because with each bite you wanted more!!

I had the Caesar and the short ribs.  The Caesar was good, nothing extraordinary.  The short rib didn't look like much, just a long piece of meat on a bed of horseradish mashed potatoes with a red/brown sauce.  But the taste.....it was veryyyyy good, succulent meat - didn't even need to chew it, it was that tender.  The sauce was also perfect.  I also had a Manhattan and a glass of Cab - both accompanied my meal perfectly.

We all ordered dessert, because, well.... our other choice was to leave and go into a major downpour.  So, we stayed, had cappuccinos and some sweets.  The profiteroles were amazing, the tiramisu was off the charts, I had the sugar and cinnamon coated doughnuts filled with italian custard.   OH  MY EFFIN GOD - THESE WERE AMAZING!!!  Maybe one of the top 5 desserts I ever had - that good.

We were the last in the restaurant, the manager gave us some comp'd lemoncello's. We got to talking to him and the next thing you know, it's 10:15!!!  (we got there at 7:30!!!).  So we bid Tiramisu a fond farewell and went out into the night.

But.... our night wasn't done yet!!!  We walked over to the B of A building (in light rain) to see that tree - it is much nicer than the Union Square tree, imo.  After a photo shoot around the tree, I came up with the idea to walk down to the Hyatt Regency to see their Christmas display.  It was nice, it was warm, it was dry.  After a few trips up and down the elevators (and finding the on/off switch for the lobby xmas tree on the 14th floor and messing with that, hehe) we settled into the Hyatt bar for a drink.

All in all, just a perfect evening with wonderful companions on a picture-perfect night (for me).  This night, not only thanks to Tiramisu, will go down in the annals as one of my fav holiday season visits to the city.  It was just that good.  Sometimes a perfect storm can be quite positive, and in this case, truer words could not be uttered. 

Ya feel me??

excerpts: The first time I had Beef Short Ribs and the cheese platter and the second time Veal Scalapini....
Both wonderful!
Anyone who gives this place 3 1/2 stars or less doesn't have taste buds.
short ribs.author: Branden W.
short ribs.review: I have eaten here 2 times now and both have been wonderful! The food is fresh and delicious and the atmosphere is great as well. I love this place especially for the staff and the owner! They are kind and get the food out in good time!  The location is interesting since it is in a back alley but this allows for a fairly quiet experience since there is not a lot of foot or car traffic that goes by. I would recommend this place over and over. The first time I had Beef Short Ribs and the cheese platter and the second time Veal Scalapini.... Both wonderful! Anyone who gives this place 3 1/2 stars or less doesn't have taste buds.

excerpts: The server took our order and went for the hard sell of the entree's over the pastas, it's one thing to recommend one dish over another, but the server didn't even try to act like the 17 dollar pasta was a viable option over the 28 dollar short ribs.
short ribs.author: Alex S.
short ribs.review:
Went here last night to have a good meal with my family after traveling in from New York.

We were one of their last tables, and i made sure my talkative family made sure to get their order in as soon as we could so the kitchen didn't have to stay late.

The food was very good food, no complaints there.

That was the end of anything positive i can say about Café Tiramisu.

The server took our order and went for the hard sell of the entree's over the pastas, it's one thing to recommend one dish over another, but the server didn't even try to act like the 17 dollar pasta was a viable option over the 28 dollar short ribs.

The server came back twice to confirm our order, and never even thought to use a notepad to write it down.  it's four entree's, how hard is that?

We asked for a bottle of the Riesling and the server shouted over our heads to a busser or another server to get the bottle, no server should be barking out orders over a guests head for anything.

We had to ask twice for butter with the bread.

Then, when we had just finished our dessert (the Tiramisu IS good, after all), they started packing up the patio and actually turned the lights off over us.

I understand that when a restaurant is closing the staff wants to leave and go home.  But it's one thing to nudge a table along and get them out; 
it's another thing to actually shut the restaurant down around a guest as they're signing the check.

I've had better service walking into a dinner 5 minutes before they close in midtown manhattan then here. 

If i never go back here again it will be to soon.

excerpts: I ordered the black ink risotto while my friend ordered the beef short ribs.
short ribs.author: Dani D.
short ribs.review:
Food : A solid four stars
Service : Two stars

The food here was absolutely delicious. I ordered the black ink risotto while my friend ordered the beef short ribs. Both were tasty.

We chose Cafe Tiramisu because of the friendly hostess and the intriguing specials. However, our waiter seemed to resent having to come outside to serve us (we were by no means the only party sitting outside) and his timing was awful. It took forever to get our drinks (they arrived immediately before the food). For the price, I would have expected better service from the waitstaff.

excerpts: For dinner we had the Braised Beef Short Ribs over Horseradish Mashed Potatoes.
You didn't need a knife because the ribs just pulled apart and melted in your mouth.
We also had the Pork Chop that was good
and we don't regret our choice
short ribs.author: Marisa G.
short ribs.review:
This place has major competition because there was a full alley of restaurants that had amazing menus. Cafe Tiramisu is not a big place so I appreciated the quite atmosphere. Service wasn't horrible but you have to be prepared to relax and take your time. 

They brought out bread with a I olive oil based sauce that really got me excited with what was to come because every restaurant I go to they just bring out olive oil but Cafe Tiramisu added something to set them apart. 
Appetizers: Arugola Salad, peaches and Prosciutto salad - very tasty but nothing unique. Polenta cake appetizer is amazing and it has been a month since I was there and I can't stop thinking about it. It had spinach, wild mushroom and gorgonzola. I wanted to lick my plate but there were white table cloths. 

For dinner we had the Braised Beef Short Ribs over Horseradish Mashed Potatoes. You didn't need a knife because the ribs just pulled apart and melted in your mouth. We also had the Pork Chop that was good and we don't regret our choice but I definitively would try something else the next time I go because the menu had tons of delicious options.   

For dessert we had the sampler for two but really we should have just gotten it for one because it was ridiculous how much we had left and that was even after we shared with the next table. I appreciated that they had the sampler pistachio gelato, pistachio creme brulee, chocolate cake, biscotti, canolli because every piece was heaven.

excerpts: The mussel in pesto sauce is amazing, the baby short ribs are tender and succulent overall a good experience.
short ribs.author: Jennifer S.
short ribs.review: The mussel in pesto sauce is amazing, the baby short ribs are tender and succulent overall a good experience.

excerpts: Had the short ribs for my entree.
So good!
Fall off the bone tender, the way short ribs should be.
short ribs.author: Denise M.
short ribs.review:
Black Ink Risotto with pan seared scallop and lobster bisque.  Sounds like three dishes, doesn't it?  Ah, but it's all one deliciously delightful dish.   The lobster bisque is very thick and served more as a sauce.  
It's wonderful.  Simply wonderful.

Had the short ribs for my entree.  So good!  Fall off the bone tender, the way short ribs should be.  Hubby had the hanger steak, also perfect.

Sadly, no room for dessert.

excerpts: We ordered oysters,  crab cake, beef steak and short ribs.
short ribs.author: Angelica C.
short ribs.review:
I ate here with one of my friends and I felt really sick afterwards.  I thought it was just me but she felt the same too.  We ordered oysters,  crab cake, beef steak and short ribs.  We're thinking it was the oysters..

I'll give it  another try and get pasta instead.

excerpts: My friend ordered the beef short ribs.
short ribs.author: Liza T.
short ribs.review:
Café Tiramisu used to be my favorite lunch spot.  Love their outdoor seating, especially when it is sunny and warm.  But based on my last two visits, I think the food was going downhill.  It was not as good as before.  

We started with the Caesar Salad.  The salad was fresh.  The complimentary bread was just so so.  You can save room for something else.  

I got the Black ink risotto with seared scallops.  It was good but not great.  It was a little bit salty to me.  My friend ordered the beef short ribs.  She told me it was just ok.  

My last visit was able a month ago......I got the Sea Bass.  The sea bass was tasteless.  

However, the services were still pretty good there.  Sweet, warm, friendly and efficient.  No complaints on that!

excerpts: My child said the short ribs were good, but the mash potatoes were not good according to their opinion (I didn't try this dish).
But the fingerling fried potatos were good.
You need to go.
short ribs.author: Captain S.
short ribs.review: This was where I first tried risotto when I was at Cal and I was happy that I was able to share this special restaurant with my family. The risotto dish with seared ahi tuna is the best in town. Prices very competitive. Barramundi fish was prepared very well. Wait staff was nice. Sauteed spanish complimented the food well. My child said the short ribs were good, but the mash potatoes were not good according to their opinion (I didn't try this dish). But the fingerling fried potatos were good. You need to go.

excerpts: A co-worker of mine had the braised beef short ribs, which also looked fall-off-the-bone tender, and would certainly be on my list of things to order next time.
short ribs.author: Jordan C.
short ribs.review:
As this was one of the nicer days we've experienced recently, my new manager was kind enough to take the team out for lunch somewhere we could sit outdoors. I had never been to Belden alley before, and it was a pleasant surprise to see so many restaurants off the street in a place where one could dine outside in the sunshine.

Initial Impressions: Good. Each table is provided some crusty Italian bread and some Pesto. This is impressive, as a good pesto is quite the treat, and it took some effort to just not eat an entire loaf of bread with it.

My lunch itself was a wild boar ragout with pasta, and was quite delicious, though was served a little on the cold side. Tasty enough so that I still enjoyed it, it didn't blow me away, and was a little on the expensive side (Had I been paying). However, the portion was perfect lunch sized, and I did not fall into my traditional post-lunch coma.

A co-worker of mine had the braised beef short ribs, which also looked fall-off-the-bone tender, and would certainly be on my list of things to order next time.

3 and a Half Stars if I could provide it. Would go back.

excerpts: My favorite on the menu is the braised short ribs.
If you get them for lunch be prepared to take a nap afterwords since they are so rich.
short ribs.author: Jeff P.
short ribs.review:
Come here for the outdoor seating area, as it is the real winner. Tiramisu is located in Belden Alley where there are several similar small cafes packed into a little alley way. It kind of gives you a feeling that you are dinning at a bistro in a square in Italy or France. If it is a nice day I would highly recommend you eat out side. Just be aware that it gets pretty crowed and the tables are literally right on top of each other. 

The food is good but there is far better Italian food in the city for a much more reasonable price. I just had their ahi tuna and it was delicious. But at 28 dollars it was hardly worth it. I would rather go to The House if I am going to spend that type of money.  My favorite on the menu is the braised short ribs. If you get them for lunch be prepared to take a nap afterwords since they are so rich.

excerpts: (note: on their regular menu my favorite dish is their beef short ribs and or their pork medallion)
short ribs.author: Caroline C.
short ribs.review:
This is my 5th time at Cafe Tiramisu.. Each time it becomes more and more enjoyable - food is great, ambiance is perfect and in the heart of SF - what more can you ask for ?!?   

Tonight was the first time that I had dinner there for a party larger than 4.  Lisa worked with me on getting a prefixed menu together to make sure we covered all bases for our party of 25 to make sure the evening would be perfect for two of my girlfriends as we were celebrating their birthdays. 

* Pappardelle - Ragout with Boar
* Raviloi - Sage with Garlic Chips
* Pork Chop - Grilled Blueberries and Asparagus
* Chicken Breast 
* Salmon - Pesto and Deep Fried Potato

Followed by a Tiramisu Sampler

Lisa was easy to work with to make sure all i's were dotted and t's were crossed and our evening was meant to be enjoyable and fun! I brought gourmet cupcakes for the two birthday celebrants and our waiter placed it on platters for us and served it to all three of our tables across the room.  

Cafe Tiramisu is small and quaint so to have our large party seated downstairs made it easy for our friends to enjoy our private gathering even with three tables strategically placed separately.  

Nevertheless, I have to say Tiramisu once again has exceeded my expectations of great customer service and excellent consistency on food gives me a reason to always come back! (note: on their regular menu my favorite dish is their beef short ribs and or their pork medallion)

excerpts: So for entrees, we ordered the ravioli beef short ribs and the grilled hawaiian swordfish.
Very, very underwhelming.
The swordfish tasted like it was frozen then microwaved for too long.
Very bland and dry.
No flavor whatsoever.
The ravioli was just ok
but my fiancée's grandma makes it ten times better.
Also the portions were both so small compared to the prices they were set at.
Finally, we order a tiramisu.
This was the best thing we ate.
I mean, it wasn't the best tiramisu I've had
but it was the best part of the meal.
So all in all, we spent $100 for the whole meal, including tip and, unfortunately, I have to say that it was not worth the money, time, or appetite.
Save yourself for some real authentic Italian food in north beach.
short ribs.author: M D.
short ribs.review: Had a table for 2 at 5pm on a Thursday. They gave us cold, hard bread that was definitely not fresh. We ordered the zucchini blossom tempura, scallops and risotto for appetizers. My fiancée liked his scallops but I was disappointed in the zucchini. It was a small size and it was lukewarm. And mind you, there were only 2 other patrons at the time, so I expected the food to be piping hot since none of the staff had much to do but cook, greet, and serve. The staff was very prompt, however. Anyway. So for entrees, we ordered the ravioli beef short ribs and the grilled hawaiian swordfish. Very, very underwhelming. The swordfish tasted like it was frozen then microwaved for too long. Very bland and dry. No flavor whatsoever. The ravioli was just ok but my fiancée's grandma makes it ten times better. Also the portions were both so small compared to the prices they were set at. Finally, we order a tiramisu. This was the best thing we ate. I mean, it wasn't the best tiramisu I've had but it was the best part of the meal. So all in all, we spent $100 for the whole meal, including tip and, unfortunately, I have to say that it was not worth the money, time, or appetite. Save yourself for some real authentic Italian food in north beach.

excerpts: The star of the entrees was unquestionably the short ribs:
Very tender
, no knife needed, it falls apart and tasty sauce, on mashed potatoes.
A must have if you are a meat eater.
I had the cioppino, which was good, though the prawns were a little rubbery.
short ribs.author: Shan H.
short ribs.review:
I was a little trepidatious about the service because they had gotten some bad reviews for this, but I found nothing to complain about on an early Sunday evening seating.  No abnormal waits, and I felt the staff was attentive.  

We had a party of 6 and tried a number of dishes.  I had a very good potato leek soup (w/ scallop bits).  The greens (salads) were OK, nothing special.  The star of the entrees was unquestionably the short ribs:  Very tender, no knife needed, it falls apart and tasty sauce, on mashed potatoes.  A must have if you are a meat eater.  I had the cioppino, which was good, though the prawns were a little rubbery.  The pasta (large tubes, called paccieri) with a spicy tomato based sauce and seafood was good, and the "spiciness' was mild.  

We ordered the dessert sampler ("for 2", even though we were 6, we were pretty full), and this was a fun way to have some dessert.  It does turn into a free-for-all. I probably liked the creme brulee the best.

The wine menu selection was pretty good, more Italian than California, but not overwhelming in volume.  We had a very nice Sicilian (Nero d'Avola) wine which went well with everything.

We all enjoyed the evening and would definitely return.

excerpts: I can still taste it... those short ribs are incredible in the Red Wine Sauce Served with Horseradish Mashed Potatoes as was the Ultra-Wide Fettuccine with Wild Mushrooms and Wild Boar Ragu.
short ribs.author: Adam X.
short ribs.review:
Went again tonight. For the first time ever sent something back which I never do (the risotto), but everything else was spot on. Just outstanding. I can still taste it... those short ribs are incredible in the Red Wine Sauce Served with Horseradish Mashed Potatoes as was the Ultra-Wide Fettuccine with Wild Mushrooms and Wild Boar Ragu.  Steaming hot and wonderful.

do it... do it.

excerpts: However, I did get to sample other dishes like the beef short ribs and the pastas.
They were excellent.
The best part was the dessert!
We ordered the dessert sampler and everything was gone in less than 10 mins.
short ribs.author: Anna L.
short ribs.review:
We went to Cafe Tiramisu for a company luncheon.  The oysters were delicious and so were the salmon and beef carpaccio.  The main entree I ordered wasn't so good though.  It was the Ahi Tuna.  The tuna was a little dry.   However, I did get to sample other dishes like the beef short ribs and the pastas.  They were excellent.  The best part was the dessert!  We ordered the dessert sampler and everything was gone in less than 10 mins.   My top picks from the dessert sampler were the tiramisu, creme burlee, and the zuppa inglese ice cream!

Great place for large parties (as long as you made reservations) or small groups.  Convenient location if you work in downtown or if you want to come at night for a romantic dinner.

excerpts: Another favorite is the braised beef short ribs .... the lamb dish is spectacular too!
short ribs.author: Sarah K.
short ribs.review:
Yeah, I dig it.

They make a black ink risotto in a lobster bisque that is so ridiculous, you'll want to slap somebody!  Another favorite is the braised beef short ribs .... the lamb dish is spectacular too!

grand finale?  three words - dessert menu sampler.

ridiculous.  seriously.

excerpts: My mom had the sea bass, which she said was great, and my aunt had the short ribs, which are HUGE.
short ribs.author: Syd V.
short ribs.review:
I was hesitant to take my mom here the other night because of the heavy tourist population, but she really liked Belden Place and wanted Italian... So, Cafe Tiramisu it was. We had a nice time and enjoyed the food. My mom had the sea bass, which she said was great, and my aunt had the short ribs, which are HUGE. The risotto was ok, but I probably wouldn't order it again. The veggie options were not very extensive.

The service was nice, although quite a bit slow. It was a Thursday night, so it was pretty busy. The alley way is great for evenings. This is a great place to take relatives from out of town for lunch or dinner, but the seating is way too jam packed and you sit shoulder-to-shoulder with the other diners. I think the prices are a bit too high for what you get, but I guess you are paying for the atmosphere and they are targeting tourists. Alli in all, its cute and the food is decent.

excerpts: The short ribs melt off the bone.
The tiramisu - the cake soaked in alcohol.
Nice!
If you eat in the inside, it gets a bit cozy.
short ribs.author: Judy L.
short ribs.review:
Here's the rundown:

Don't get the lemonade; its water with bits of lemon juice with little to no flavor. Do get the mussels, but be wary, a full order will fill up a party of two before the main dishes are served. The short ribs melt off the bone. The tiramisu - the cake soaked in alcohol. Nice! If you eat in the inside, it gets a bit cozy.

excerpts: The wife went for broke and ordered up the beef short ribs.
Cooked to perfection, the meat fell away from the bone like France from international relevance.
I tried to keep things somewhat light and sampled the pappardelle with mushroom and wild boar ragout.
My first wild boar.
I was happy.
The meat was like sweet sausage.
short ribs.author: Daryl E.
short ribs.review:
We stopped by this Belden Alley "trap" on a Friday evening after an afternoon of shopping around Union Square.  I work nearby and some coworkers had good things to say.  The dinner rush had yet to develop and we had our choice of the outdoor seating.  The seating outside can be a bit cramped, but focus on your date across the table and do not throw any elbows.  We were warmly greeted and our server was quick with the drink orders.  I had a glass of Chianti Riserva, which may or may not have been overpriced, but was certainly on par with any other restaurant in the city.  We had a moment of apprehension when we discovered the water tasted like it had been mixed with flat Sprite/7-UP.  The replacement glasses were fine.

I was not particularly hungry, having gouged at lunch at Nordstrom.  I committed the faux pas of only ordering a single course.  My wife, more considerate of Italian custom, indulged in a mixed greens salad with a citrus dressing.  "It was o.k."

The bread was fresh and the olive tapenade was habit-forming.

We were most impressed with our entrees.  The wife went for broke and ordered up the beef short ribs.  Cooked to perfection, the meat fell away from the bone like France from international relevance.  I tried to keep things somewhat light and sampled the pappardelle with mushroom and wild boar ragout.  My first wild boar.  I was happy.  The meat was like sweet sausage.  The pasta, if not made in-house, tasted like fresh-made.

We skipped dessert, not falling for the $9 tiramisu, tempting as it was.  We settled for coffees at Starbucks, which cost $39.95.

Having limited ourselves to Italian fare at Milano on Russian Hill, we were pleasantly surprised to find a downtown alternative.  The service was excellent and attentive.  This was a good experience.  Solid.

Price tag for one glass of wine, one appetizer, and two entrees:  $72 (with tip).

excerpts: For the appetizers we had the fresh mozzarella with salad and prosciutto, as well as some buffalo cheese that I do believe was fried and combined with short ribs.
It was INCREDIBLE.
The waiter was very professional and took his job very seriously.
It is a high-end place, and was also very crowded.
I really enjoyed sitting outside, it made for a lively experience, and the musicians were entertaining.
I wouldn't mind going back if I could afford to!
short ribs.author: Katie S.
short ribs.review: AMAZING. I was simply stunned with every bite I ate at Cafe Tiramisu. My boyfriend took me here for a classy pre-Valentine's day dinner. His boss is a friend of the owners and surprised us by paying for the entire meal....lucky for us, because it is VERY expensive. I got the Pepper Crusted Ribeye steak and it was probably the best I've ever had. For the appetizers we had the fresh mozzarella with salad and prosciutto, as well as some buffalo cheese that I do believe was fried and combined with short ribs. It was INCREDIBLE. The waiter was very professional and took his job very seriously. It is a high-end place, and was also very crowded. I really enjoyed sitting outside, it made for a lively experience, and the musicians were entertaining. I wouldn't mind going back if I could afford to!

excerpts: I thought their lobster risotto was perfection, as was the beef carpaccio and short ribs.
Their namesake wasn't bad either.
short ribs.author: Sarah M.
short ribs.review:
This is a great place for delicious and comforting food. The atmosphere was perfect for a casual but romantic dinner; my date and I were happy to share a meal here.

I thought their lobster risotto was perfection, as was the beef carpaccio and short ribs. Their namesake wasn't bad either.

excerpts: For our main entrees, I had the ahi tuna with spicy crab risotto and my bf had the braised short ribs.
The braised short ribs was done exactly the way we like our short ribs -
so tender that you don't really need a knife.
(Hey, I just noticed that we ordered pretty much the same thing as Joe H.'s review below!
I guess we have the same good taste in food!)
After all that food we didn't quite make it to dessert.
I was bummed out because I saw a few items I really wanted to try, but I was seriously way too full
and I didn't think I would be able to walk back to our hotel, or anywhere at all!
short ribs.author: Cat T.
short ribs.review:
We were supposed to eat here during our last trip to SF, but we didn't have time. Luckily my bf remembered this place during our trip to SF this past weekend.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the mixed reviews, but I'm so glad I ate here because it was one the best meals I had this weekend! 

For starters, we had the black ink risotto with seared scallops and the dungeness crab ceasar salad (recommended by the hostess)...both were really good. I've never seen my bf clear our a plate as fast as he did with the black ink risotto and seared scallops! I'm kinda picky with ceasar salads because they're usually drenched in dressing, but this particular one was perfectly dressed -- pretty much the entire salad was lightly coated with the dreassing and topped with a bed of crab meat and parmesean.  For our main entrees, I had the ahi tuna with spicy crab risotto and my bf had the braised short ribs. The spicy crab risotto was not so spicy, but I didn't care because spicy or not, it was so good! I felt the ahi tuna and the risotto paired together really well. The braised short ribs was done exactly the way we like our short ribs - so tender that you don't really need a knife.  (Hey, I just noticed that we ordered pretty much the same thing as Joe H.'s review below! I guess we have the same good taste in food!) After all that food we didn't quite make it to dessert. I was bummed out because I saw a few items I really wanted to try, but I was seriously way too full and I didn't think I would be able to walk back to our hotel, or anywhere at all! We loved the food so much that we can't wait to go back!

I had to -1 star because our server was kinda weird. He didn't seem so friendly at first, I think even the people at the table next to us felt that way, but he improved over the course of the dinner. The place is super small and crowded, but I guess that's part of the Belden Alley experience. Hopefully you'll get seated next to people you don't mind talking to because the tables are so close that you 're pretty much dining with them.

excerpts: Came here for dinner we ordered soup, oysters,salad and something that had parma ham in it and lobster ravioli and short ribs then my MAIN COURSE (2) dessert samplers, all to myself...
YUMMY!!!
short ribs.author: anny g.
short ribs.review: Came here for dinner we ordered soup, oysters,salad and something that had parma ham in it and lobster ravioli and short ribs then my MAIN COURSE (2) dessert samplers, all to myself...YUMMY!!!

excerpts: My friend got the short ribs, which was an absolutely monstrous plate.
It would be a good entree if you are starving.
short ribs.author: Joe H.
short ribs.review:
I haven't eaten here since I started working in downtown in January 2005.

I am glad I went again today (for work).

Meal re-cap:

Appetizers:
Black ink risotto with seared scallops - recommended. Risotto is perfect texture and the scallops are just lightly cooked, very tender.
Monterey Calamari stuffed with crab and served on Italian garlic toast - Not as good as the risotto, but an ok dish. Nothing special here.

Entree:
I had the Black pepper crusted ahi tuna over a spicy shrimp risotto. A vast improvement over the dish I remember having two and a half years ago (slab of grilled salmon or something. It stands out because I remember it being very tender... almost as tender as the scottish salmon that Aqua used to serve). The tuna was only slightly seared and for the most part rare, just as I like it, but the highlight of the dish is the risotto. The texture of the rice and shrimp is perfect. Not really the spicy shrimp as described though.

My friend got the short ribs, which was an absolutely monstrous plate. It would be a good entree if you are starving. Didn't ask him how it tasted as I was too focused on my dish.

Dessert:
My friend's Profiteroles looked amazing, but I had the warm chocolate cake. It came with a hazelnut "soup" and a scoop of chocolate ice cream. The dish is pretty sweet for my tastes, but not too sugary. I did like dipping the chocolate cake into the chocolate hazelnut soup. It reminded me of dunking oreo cookies into chocolate milk for that soggy texture.

Service - Standard. If you've eaten in Belden Alley before, you know what to expect.

-1 star for not being able to seat us outside and putting us all alone in the overflow dungeon downstairs. I had a reservation too! The air was stuffy and smelled of detergent. Regardless, the food was good.

Total cost - $210
- 5 people, no wine, 2 diet cokes, 3 coffees.

excerpts: For our entrees we had the Crispy Chicken cooked under a brick and the Beef Short Ribs,
both were really good.
It wasn't a total disappointment although I will never go back, to many other options that I like on Belden Place!
Oh
and by the way, take your time ordering because they bring the food out
so damn fast your head will spin!
I don't mean to be so negative, and I know this is just an outdoor cafe.
But can't the management change
all the damn burned out light bulbs that are strung outside??
Total bill with tip was around: $155 for 2 ppl
short ribs.author: John M.
short ribs.review:
The weather was nice so we decided to walk down to Belden Place for dinner.  We had a short wait even though we made a reso on open table before we left the house, they sat a walk in table before us but no big deal we only waited like 5 minutes anyway.  I didn't like the way they dumped us as the table, I was thinking perhaps I should teach them restaurant skills 101. First the guest sits down then you hand them the menu....DUH  You don't throw the menus down and point at the table!  I knew I was in a tourist destination restaurant by the time I sat down.  And all the tables were at different heights and wobbled all over the place.  But, the wine list cheered me up, very nice selection. We ordered a fairly decent Barbera not bad for only $42.  But I haven't seen wine glasses big thick and cheap like theirs since I was in college.  I'm sure they must serve crystal glasses for their more expensive wines that are 400-500 and up.  Oh and then Maurizzio our waiter yanked my partners menu and mumbled something about spilling olive oil on it.  Thank goodness my partner didn't hear what he said because he would have been pissed! 
The food was pretty good the Mozzarella Salad and the Black Ink Risotto
were pretty tasty!  For our entrees we had the Crispy Chicken cooked under a brick and the Beef Short Ribs, both were really good.
It wasn't a total disappointment although I will never go back, to many other options that I like on Belden Place!
Oh and by the way, take your time ordering because they bring the food out so damn fast your head will spin!  I don't mean to be so negative, and I know this is just an outdoor cafe.  But can't the management change all the damn burned out light bulbs that are strung outside??
Total bill with tip was around: $155 for 2 ppl

excerpts: Each member of the family ordered a different entree - there were pasta dishes, seared ahi, braised short ribs, chicken - and each dish was more delicious than the next.
We enjoyed the very reasonably priced wine and champagne from an extensive list, and then we topped off our lunch with the dessert sampler, too divine!
Thank you Cafe Tiramisu for yet another exceptional meal on one of the best restaurant streets in San Francisco, Belden Alley.
To fellow Yelpers, you can't miss with this one.
Ciao!
short ribs.author: maria e.
short ribs.review: What an extraordinary meal at Cafe Tiramisu!  I arrived with my family, a table of seven diners, for a birthday luncheon, and our expectations were far exceeded once again.  From our knowledgeable and friendly waiter Pietro, to the gracious and generous proprietor Pino Spinoso, to the outstanding meal, we had a dining experience that will be remembered for a long time.  Each member of the family ordered a different entree - there were pasta dishes, seared ahi, braised short ribs, chicken - and each dish was more delicious than the next.  We enjoyed the very reasonably priced wine and champagne from an extensive list, and then we topped off our lunch with the dessert sampler, too divine!  Thank you Cafe Tiramisu for yet another exceptional meal on one of the best restaurant streets in San Francisco, Belden Alley.  To fellow Yelpers, you can't miss with this one. Ciao!

excerpts: the short ribs here are GREAT, and i recommend any dessert with their hazelnut ice cream on it.
this place is located in the popular belden pl alley, so its always crowded on friday and saturday nights.
you should definitely make reservations.
sitting outside isnt too bad either, because the heat lamps are adequate enough to keep the patio warm.
short ribs.author: Angie K.
short ribs.review: i'm not quite sure why this place averages 3 and a half stars - i think the food here is great! i know the service is bad, but it does at least seem like the servers are hurrying around and trying really hard to cover all customer demands. the short ribs here are GREAT, and i recommend any dessert with their hazelnut ice cream on it. this place is located in the popular belden pl alley, so its always crowded on friday and saturday nights. you should definitely make reservations. sitting outside isnt too bad either, because the heat lamps are adequate enough to keep the patio warm.

excerpts: Grilled octopus fantastic, pork chops great and the pasta just great.
Noisy
but it's an Italian cafe.
pork chops.author: Stewart H.
pork chops.review: Always have a solid meal here. Service great. It's not Five star but good service. Food quality excellent.  Grilled octopus fantastic, pork chops great and the pasta just great. Noisy but it's an Italian cafe.

excerpts: For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops.
The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine.
Seriously everything here was great.
I got a special dessert sampler
and I was in dessert heaven.
Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu.
The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to.
Maybe more like a pudding?
The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine.
Seriously everything here was great.
I got a special dessert sampler
and I was in dessert heaven.
Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu.
The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to.
Maybe more like a pudding?
pork chops.author: Vivian D.
pork chops.review:
Came here for restaurant  week  and had the most exquisite time! Ambiance is real nice. Has a real authentic Italian feel. All the waiters are Italian! Got the prix fix meal and it was definitely worth it. 

For appetizers we got the pan seared scallops and the bresola (air dried beef) and both were soooo good! The scallops were flavorful and melt in your mouth and the beef was just filled with flavor. For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops. The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine. Seriously everything here was great. I got a special dessert sampler and I was in dessert heaven. Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu. The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to. Maybe more like a pudding? But still good nonetheless. 

Glad I got to try a  place I probably never would have gone to!

excerpts: I had their pork chops a year ago when they used to have it on the menu.
Delicious!
Soft, juicy, and full of flavor.
I've been wanting to go back there for their pork chops, will wait untill they bring it back on their menu.
pork chops.author: F A.
pork chops.review:
Great food.  I had their pork chops a year ago when they used to have it on the menu.  Delicious!  Soft, juicy, and full of flavor.  Typical pricing for the SF downtown area, but well worth it.  

I've been wanting to go back there for their pork chops, will wait untill they bring it back on their menu.

excerpts: My friend ordered the pork chops (I don't see it on their menu; it could possibly have been the Pork Medallion), which tasted great as well.
pork chops.author: Niya Y.
pork chops.review:
Delicious food, high prices.

I had lunch here yesterday with a friend. Since the weather was actually sunny and above 60 degrees, we sat outside in the alley.  Between us, we had three glasses of wine.  Each glass cost $11-12, which I thought was overpriced, as I found nothing special about the wine.  But then again, I'm no wine expert, so who knows.

I ordered the Rack of Lamb, which turned out to be delicious.  Even though the meat was cooked to medium well, it was tender.  The rack was flavorful and fragrant in exactly the way a good lamb rack should be.  It was so good that I didn't pay much attention to the sides.  (According to the menu, there were supposed to be garlic chips, herbs, and black truffle; there may have been, but I have no recollection.)  That said, I liked that the mashed potato accompanying the rack seemed lighter than most of the mashed potatoes I've had.

My friend ordered the pork chops (I don't see it on their menu; it could possibly have been the Pork Medallion), which tasted great as well.  He finished his lunch with a cup of coffee.

As much as I enjoyed the food, I was surprised by the $102 bill.  Everything did add up, but I hadn't expected to spend close to $50 on lunch where I had one entree with a glass of wine.

In conclusion: great place to eat, but don't expect to save money.

excerpts: since they ran out of the pork chops (it was only 12:15pm on Wednesday) and they were out.
So I opted to a chicken which was a second recommendation from a friend, and surprisingly, it was good!
A whole chicken thigh and leg that had a smokey and rosemary fagrant, with sides of greens and potatoes.
i devoured almost all of it.
Plus, we chose to sit outdoors under the canopy since the weather was extremely nice today, sunny and warm.
pork chops.author: Oanh N.
pork chops.review: I don't normally order chicken but I had to since they ran out of the pork chops (it was only 12:15pm on Wednesday) and they were out. So I opted to a chicken which was a second recommendation from a friend, and surprisingly, it was good! A whole chicken thigh and leg that had a smokey and rosemary fagrant, with sides of greens and potatoes. i devoured almost all of it. Plus, we chose to sit outdoors under the canopy since the weather was extremely nice today, sunny and warm.

excerpts: I came here with my medical department during a convention, and I personally ordered the veal while everyone else ordered the chicken breast or ravioli.
Veal was soft, and slightly salted, very typical  for an Italian restaurant.
We all loved our meals, BUT I would like to comment that this is NOT a filling meal.
The chicken breasts that my coworkers ordered were small, and side dishes are not included in the prices on the menu.
chicken breast.author: Andrew H.
chicken breast.review:
Four words: Awful value, good chef.

Tiramisu (or Tiraimisv as it's written on the menu), is a restaurant in the middle of a tiny, very crowded alleyway full over at least half a dozen other restaurants. There's plenty of outdoor seating and everything is cramped like it always is in San Francisco.  It's about 30 feet away from a dark alleyway along with the 2 homeless people who live there but it's so crowded here, so it's unlikely that you will be the unlucky person to be bothered here.

I came here with my medical department during a convention, and I personally ordered the veal while everyone else ordered the chicken breast or ravioli.  Veal was soft, and slightly salted, very typical  for an Italian restaurant. We all loved our meals, BUT I would like to comment that this is NOT a filling meal.  The chicken breasts that my coworkers ordered were small, and side dishes are not included in the prices on the menu.  (See photo below of the veal.) 

We also ordered the tiramisu and a slice of chocolate pie, both of which were delicious (as almost all desserts are.)

To summarize, the service is pretty slow, the portions are very small, the outdoor seating isn't special, the location sucks, and the lighting is very dim outside, but the food is prepared well. The dimness would be acceptable if the restaurant was designed to be romantic, but the tables outside are designed to seat big crowds, not couples.

excerpts:
* Chicken Breast 
* Salmon - Pesto and Deep Fried Potato

Followed by a Tiramisu Sampler

Lisa was easy to work with to make sure all i's were dotted and t's were crossed and our evening was meant to be enjoyable and fun!
chicken breast.author: Caroline C.
chicken breast.review:
This is my 5th time at Cafe Tiramisu.. Each time it becomes more and more enjoyable - food is great, ambiance is perfect and in the heart of SF - what more can you ask for ?!?   

Tonight was the first time that I had dinner there for a party larger than 4.  Lisa worked with me on getting a prefixed menu together to make sure we covered all bases for our party of 25 to make sure the evening would be perfect for two of my girlfriends as we were celebrating their birthdays. 

* Pappardelle - Ragout with Boar
* Raviloi - Sage with Garlic Chips
* Pork Chop - Grilled Blueberries and Asparagus
* Chicken Breast 
* Salmon - Pesto and Deep Fried Potato

Followed by a Tiramisu Sampler

Lisa was easy to work with to make sure all i's were dotted and t's were crossed and our evening was meant to be enjoyable and fun! I brought gourmet cupcakes for the two birthday celebrants and our waiter placed it on platters for us and served it to all three of our tables across the room.  

Cafe Tiramisu is small and quaint so to have our large party seated downstairs made it easy for our friends to enjoy our private gathering even with three tables strategically placed separately.  

Nevertheless, I have to say Tiramisu once again has exceeded my expectations of great customer service and excellent consistency on food gives me a reason to always come back! (note: on their regular menu my favorite dish is their beef short ribs and or their pork medallion)

excerpts: Our main dishes arrived, I ordered the chicken breast.
Don't allow the name alone to fool you, the dish was fulfilling and more.
The chicken was juicy and the melted cheese and spinach married the flavor of the truffle sauce together wonderfully.
The pumpkin gnocchi were a pleasant match with the dish.
I took a few fork fulls of my boyfriend's dish (for review purposes of course ;D )
chicken breast.author: Cyndi S.
chicken breast.review: Tucked away in what appears to be an ally you will find this little treasure of a restaurant. With an Italian feel and menu to match the food is exquisite. Our experience began with oysters with classic mignonette and fresh horseradish. Typically I'm not a fan of horseradish but the way it was served it made it not only tolerable, but enjoyable.  Our main dishes arrived, I ordered the chicken breast. Don't allow the name alone to fool you, the dish was fulfilling and more. The chicken was juicy and the melted cheese and spinach married the flavor of the truffle sauce together wonderfully. The pumpkin gnocchi were a pleasant match with the dish. I took a few fork fulls of my boyfriend's dish (for review purposes of course ;D ) He ordered the striped sea bass filet which came with lobster, mashed potatoes, and saffron sauce-all of course rich and satisfying. He ordered a side of parmesan risotto just because and that too was wonderful. Truly one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a while.

excerpts: The plate came with two pieces of chicken, delicious roasted potatoes, and veggies.
It was really good.
I couldn't finish
so I ended up packing the other half to go....
(and then throwing it away
bc i didnt end up eating it)....
Pretty decent.
I think i'll be back!
roasted potatoes.author: Linda P.
roasted potatoes.review: I really like this place. I ordered the Chicken. It was very juicy and plentiful. The plate came with two pieces of chicken, delicious roasted potatoes, and veggies. It was really good. I couldn't finish so I ended up packing the other half to go.... (and then throwing it away bc i didnt end up eating it).... Pretty decent. I think i'll be back!

excerpts: I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto.
I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.
The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.
parmesan risotto.author: Amy W.
parmesan risotto.review:
This was a holiday team dinner destination.  This place does seem to do a lot of these even though the space was pretty small. There were 12 of us - but another company had the entire downstairs 3-4 large tables and maybe 30-40 people.

We had a long table and it was hard to hear anyone other than those directly across or next to you.  Bread was served and would have been great warm, but was elevated by a lovey green olive/olive oil tapenade sort of dipping sauce.

There were four appetizers served "family style" (not sure if they were pre-ordered by the organizer of the dinner or what - but sadly 3 of the 4 of them served were fish - so I did not partake (as I recall 3 of them: octopus, ahi tuna and grapefruit, a bruschetta + one more I don't remember).

I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto. I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.  The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.

I doubt I would go there on my own just b/c I hate the way all the Belden Alley hostess try and talk you into going there whenever you walk by, it just feels like the cheesy parts of Paris and Rome where they try and lure the tourists...but if I was trying to figure out a place to get 20 co-workers to dinner I might consider it.

Oh and there is no bar - so if you get there before everyone else you can either wait at the table and look like a loser, or wait outside (and look like a loser).

excerpts: I had the veal scallopini on a bed of spinach with a side of parmesan risotto.
The veal was fork tender and very flavorful - risotto was average.
Overall, an enjoyable meal.
parmesan risotto.author: Jim M.
parmesan risotto.review: Nice little hideaway near Chinatown.  Bread served with pesto is a plus.  I had the veal scallopini on a bed of spinach with a side of parmesan risotto.  The veal was fork tender and very flavorful - risotto was average.  Overall, an enjoyable meal.

Truly one of the best meals we have enjoyed in a while.

Our experience began with oysters with classic mignonette and fresh horseradish. Typically I'm not a fan of horseradish but the way it was served it made it not only tolerable, but enjoyable.  Our main dishes arrived, I ordered the chicken breast. Don't allow the name alone to fool you, the dish was fulfilling and more. excerpts: but I tried the Parmesan Risotto and again I have had better.
So I thought I will try the Tiramisu, terrible.
Again made in house but over espresso-ed and the bitter chocolate powder was just that a bitter addition, the dish wasn't overly sweet that the powder needed to be added.
It was super crowded, why who knows.
I'm no food expert but this experience for me was bad.
And to offend all the foodies out there, Maggianos which is a chain has better food and the atmosphere doesn't need to transport me anywhere except to sheer ecstasy.

Some Yelper posted on her review that an appetizer, 6 beers and 3 or 4 entrees was $ 150.00, for 1 salad 2 entrees 1 prosecco and a coke was close to $ 80.00 and for a 20% tip we left $ 100.00 lighter.
It's kinda upscale, maybe since I was wearing a Giants ball cap nice yoga outfit and tennis shoes and the b.f.
the same we looked like we didn't belong there?
We had been at a football game all day and wanted to eat a nice meal after, we didn't think we need to change!
Wrap Up, wouldn't go back, wouldn't recommend to anyone I like super disappointed and mad at Bay Area Check Please...
parmesan risotto.author: RedHighHeels R.
parmesan risotto.review:
Went since Check Please Bay Area everyone loved it! Why!!!!!
I know KQED has a lot of foodies, and it's quality t.v. so while in the City I was dying to try this place.  We were greeted by the hostess, the owner was as my bf. said "kind of an ass', didn't get the friendly vibe like on the show.  We were sat at the very back, people have said " They felt as if they were transported to Italy!" Yea it smelled like the Venice canals.  I get it, its an old building but the smell was off putting and gets worse when you go down stairs to use the bathroom or being punished and actually have to sit at the tables down there...  The owner took our order, didn't go over any specials maybe there weren't any?  The menu wasn't that exciting, I wanted to try the homemade pasta and at the recommendation of the owner I ordered the Paperadelle with meat sauce and the bf had Veal Scallopine.  Truthfully nothing sounded all that great.  I ordered a deeelish Prosecco, the waiter brought out with bread, never caught his name.  The bread is made in house, again nothing exciting rolls that should have been served warm I thought and the dipping oil people raved about on this site was forgettable.   I ate a lot of bread since I knew the entree was gonna tank, it did... My dish was paperdalle noodles that were super thin, maybe that's how they are in Italy but I like my pasta with a bit of substance.  The sauce was kinda tasteless except for an overbearing wine taste.  Meeehhh on my food. The bf loooovvveeed his Veal Scaloppine, I don't eat veal but I tried the Parmesan Risotto and again I have had better.  So I thought I will try the Tiramisu, terrible.  Again made in house but over espresso-ed and the bitter chocolate powder was just that a bitter addition, the dish wasn't overly sweet that the powder needed to be added.  It was super crowded, why who knows.  I'm no food expert but this experience for me was bad.  And to offend all the foodies out there, Maggianos which is a chain has better food and the atmosphere doesn't need to transport me anywhere except to sheer ecstasy.  Their Tiramisu is wonderful, and you get as much as you want!  Some Yelper posted on her review that an appetizer, 6 beers and 3 or 4 entrees was $ 150.00, for 1 salad 2 entrees 1 prosecco and a coke was close to $ 80.00 and for a 20% tip we left $ 100.00 lighter.  It's kinda upscale, maybe since I was wearing a Giants ball cap nice yoga outfit and tennis shoes and the b.f. the same we looked like we didn't belong there?  We had been at a football game all day and wanted to eat a nice meal after, we didn't think we need to change!  Wrap Up, wouldn't go back, wouldn't recommend to anyone I like super disappointed and mad at Bay Area Check Please...

excerpts: Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.
it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.
the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.
i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.
parmesan risotto.author: Jack N.
parmesan risotto.review:
check out their menu here: http://www.belden-place.com/view/menu/cafetiramisu/

i guess you could say i love italian food.  one thing's for sure..and that's that i love pasta, bread, garlic and olive oil.  i decided to give this place a try after seeing other yelpers giving it a good review for the most part.  i've got to say, they have a mouth watering tiramisu and i hope it wasn't just for that night.  i mean c'mon! the friggin name of the place is cafe TIRAMISU...how can you go wrong ordering the one thing on the menu that describes the place, right?  anyway, we ordered plenty of dishes but unfortunately this time around i wasn't able to try everyone's food but i will list the ones i did try...

Seared Ahi Tuna with Risotto: i give this one a 4/5 rating.  tastewise it's delicious.  the inside of the tuna is raw  but i eat sushi/sashimi all the time so this is not anything that will make me not want to eat it, but for the weak minded people out there i wouldn't go for this, unless you're weak minded trying to unweak your mind.  the risotto also has an awesome flavor to it.  a bit salty but still none the less very tasty.  an awesome main course dish if i do say so myself.

Veal Scaloppini with Lemon-Caper Sauce, over Florentine Spinach & Parmesan Risotto: i give this one a 3/5 rating.  it was good overall but lacked a little ...i duno... but something was missing.  the veal was soft  and tender, the spinach was flavorful, the risotta was a bit salty, yet still good overall.  i guess there isn't much to say about this one except i guess that it would be a good dish to try but nothing to cry over.  i suppose the risotto from the ahi tuna was superior to the risotto that came with the veal though.

Tiramisu: this one gets a 4/5 rating.  i can't say i've had better tiramisu, but i know there's going to be one out there that i like more than this one.  however, when i do try that better one i know i'll rate this one a 3 and that one a 4.  lol..i guess i'm never satisfied, but this tiramisu is definately a must try.  it comes on a large plate (as does everything else) with 4 thin square walls of dark chocolate on the perimeter of the  cake.  not too sweet, which is rare to find...trust me, and you can taste the liquor inside cake..which is awesome.  i think this is possibly the best tiramisu i've ever put in my mouth...so to speak.

Almond Cannoli with chocolate mouse:  this one gets a 3.5/5.  i've had better cannoli, but this dish gets points for presentation as it is a very attractive one.  the cannoli are about 1 in long each (uber tiny) and you get about 3 i think?  it comes with a sauce and some chocolate mouse which is tasty too.  not over sweetened either which is also good for those trying not to attract diabetes to their bodies.  overall good, but probably won't be ordering it again in the future unless someone treats me to one..  will it be you? i doubt it. hah.

gelati & sorbetto combo:  this is good too if you like ice cream.  i give it a 3.5/5 as well.  i'm not much of an ice cream fanatic but if you were this'd probably be a good one to order being it is home made and all.  i guess i dont have much to say except that i know i will never be ordering this because i could care less about sorbet's or ice cream, but don't take my word for it.  try it out yourself, what've you got to lose?  well...i guess you've got $10.50 to lose, but o well, it'll definately be more of a mystery if you're wanting to try it and don't.

and that's my review of this place.  i'm hella tired so i'm gonna be signing off.  have one more review to do but that can wait.  i suppose ill leave you with this note:

TRY CAFE TIRAMISU AND ORDER AHI TUNA!

until next time....EAT MORE FOOOOOD!

excerpts: I ordered the scallops appetizer served over a butternut squash and risotto and a side of spinach florentine.
The spinach was wonderful served with raisins and onions....
superb.
The scallops were good
however my expectations were that the sauce would have a sweeter taste with the butternut squash sauce
but I really could not taste the squash at all.
spinach florentine.author: Lori M.
spinach florentine.review:
Visited here for a late night dinner after touring San Francisco and it was a pleasant dinner.  We had a wonderful waiter who was on top of everything!

I was only eating small plates because of the hour.  I ordered the scallops appetizer served over a butternut squash and risotto and a side of spinach florentine.  The spinach was wonderful served with raisins and onions....superb.  The scallops were good however my expectations were that the sauce would have a sweeter taste with the butternut squash sauce but I really could not taste the squash at all.  They were still delicious!

My son who is so picky at 13 could not find anything that he wanted to eat, but my hubby and the waiter were able to create a spaghetti and veal meatball dish, that he loved!

Hubby had the short rib ravioli, he liked it but said he would not order it again, just something about the taste.

It is located in the financial district in this cool alley with other restaurants.  They featured outside seating but we chose to eat inside.  The place has a great authentic Italian feel, and I cannot say enough about our waiter and his service.

The only thing minor thing I would add is the menu was kind of limited in choices.  I definitely would go back to try some other dishes.
